original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: tvaṃ hy agne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā /
analyzed: tvam hi agne prathamaḥ manotā asyāḥ dhiyaḥ abhavaḥ dasma hotā
translated: You, O Agni, were the first mind of this one, you became the wondrous priest of these thoughts.

original: tvaṃ sīṃ vṛṣann akṛṇor duṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai //
analyzed: tvam sīm vṛṣan akṛṇoḥ duṣṭarītu sahaḥ viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai
translated: You, O bull, have made this one invincible, with strength for all, to be victorious.

original: adhā hotā ny asīdo yajīyān iḷas pada iṣayann īḍyaḥ san /
analyzed: adhā hotā ni asīdaḥ yajīyān iḷaḥ pade iṣayan īḍyaḥ san
translated: Then you, O priest, have sat down as the most worthy to sacrifice, seeking food, being worthy of worship,

original: taṃ tvā naraḥ prathamaṃ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu gman //
analyzed: tam tvā naraḥ prathamam devayantaḥ mahaḥ rāye citayantaḥ anu gman
translated: In the place of the people who worship the gods, the men have come to you, the first, seeking great wealth and thinking of you.

original: vṛteva yantam bahubhir vasavyais tve rayiṃ jāgṛvāṃso anu gman /
analyzed: vṛtā iva yantam bahubhiḥ vasavyaiḥ tve rayim jāgṛvāṃsaḥ anu gman
translated: As if going surrounded by many possessions, the watchful ones have come to you for wealth,

original: ruśantam agniṃ darśatam bṛhantaṃ vapāvantaṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam //
analyzed: ruśantam agnim darśatam bṛhantam vapāvantam viśvahā dīdivāṃsam
translated: The shining, wondrous, great Agni, the one who is anointed, the one who shines in every way.

original: padaṃ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpann amṛktam /
analyzed: padam devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śravaḥ āpan amṛktam
translated: The ones who seek the place of the god with reverence, the ones who desire fame, have attained the unerring one.

original: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṃ te raṇayanta saṃdṛṣṭau //
analyzed: nāmāni cit dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyām te raṇayanta saṃdṛṣṭau
translated: They have even taken on names worthy of sacrifice, for your good appearance they delight in the auspicious one.

original: tvāṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tvāṃ rāya ubhayāso janānām /
analyzed: tvām vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyām tvām rāyaḥ ubhayāsaḥ janānām
translated: The people on earth strengthen you, the people's wealth, the two-sided wealth of people, comes to you.

original: tvaṃ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadam in mānuṣāṇām //
analyzed: tvam trātā taraṇe cetyaḥ bhūḥ pitā mātā sadam id mānuṣāṇām
translated: You are the protector, the one to be thought of in crossing over, the father, the mother of people at all times.

original: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣv agnir hotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān /
analyzed: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyaḥ vikṣu agniḥ hotā mandraḥ ni sasāda ā yajīyān
translated: The one to be sought after, the beloved Agni in many places, the delightful priest has sat down as the most worthy to sacrifice.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsam upa jñubādho namasā sadema //🔽taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudhyo navyam agne sumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā vayam dame ā dīdivāṃsam upa jñubādhaḥ namasā sadema  tam tvā vayam sudhyaḥ navyam agne sumnāyavaḥ īmahe devayantaḥ
translated: We would sit down near thee, O shining one, at the sacrifice, with our knees bent, and with homage.🔽We, O Agni, desirous of the gods, implore thee, the newly born, for our welfare.

original: tvaṃ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo agne bṛhatā rocanena //
analyzed: tvam viśaḥ anayaḥ dīdyānaḥ divaḥ agne bṛhatā rocanena
translated: Thou, shining, hast led the people, O Agni, with the great light of the heaven.

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ śaśvatīnāṃ nitośanaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām /🔽pretīṣaṇim iṣayantam pāvakaṃ rājantam agniṃ yajataṃ rayīṇām //
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim śaśvatīnām nitośanam vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām  pretīṣaṇim iṣayantam pāvakam rājantam agnim yajatam rayīṇām
translated: The sage of the eternal people, the lord of the people, the ever-kindling bull of men,🔽The purifying one who longs to go forth, the shining Agni, the king of wealth, let us worship.

original: so agna īje śaśame ca marto yas ta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim /
analyzed: saḥ agne īje śaśame ca martaḥ yaḥ te ānaṭ samidhā havya dātim
translated: That mortal, O Agni, who has brought thee, the bearer of oblations, with fuel, has worshipped and served thee.

original: ya āhutim pari vedā namobhir viśvet sa vāmā dadhate tvotaḥ //🔽asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhir agne samidhota havyaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ āhutim pari veda namobhiḥ viśvā id sa vāmā dadhate tvotaḥ  asmai u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiḥ agne samidhā uta havyaiḥ
translated: He who knows the offering and reverences it with homage, all his desires are fulfilled, he is not abandoned.🔽To him, O Agni, we will offer great worship with homage and oblations, O thou who art kindled with fuel.

original: vedī sūno sahaso gīrbhir ukthair ā te bhadrāyāṃ sumatau yatema //
analyzed: vedī sūno sahasaḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ ā te bhadrāyām sumatau yatema
translated: O son of strength, we would serve thee with songs and hymns in thy auspicious and good favour.

original: ā yas tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiś ca śravasyas tarutraḥ /
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiḥ ca śravasyaḥ tarutraḥ
translated: He who hath spread out the two worlds with his radiance, the victorious one with his fame,

original: bṛhadbhir vājai sthavirebhir asme revadbhir agne vitaraṃ vi bhāhi //
analyzed: bṛhadbhiḥ vājaiḥ sthavirebhiḥ asme revadbhiḥ agne vitaram vi bhāhi
translated: With great powers, O thou who art old, with abundant ones, O Agni, shine forth for us with thy light.

original: nṛvad vaso sadam id dhehy asme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ /
analyzed: nṛvat vaso sadam id dhehi asme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ
translated: As a man, O Vasu, always come to us, for abundant offspring and cattle.

original: pūrvīr iṣo bṛhatīr āreaghā asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu //🔽purūṇy agne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasutā te aśyām /🔽purūṇi hi tve puruvāra santy agne vasu vidhate rājani tve //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ bṛhatīḥ āreaghāḥ asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu  purūṇi agne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasu tā te aśyām  purūṇi hi tve puru vāra santi agne vasu vidhate rājani tve
translated: May there be many abundant and far-reaching food-resources for us, and may there be good fame and prosperity for us.🔽Many are the treasures, O Agni, in many ways, O king, which I may hope to obtain from you.🔽For you, O Agni, have many treasures, O you who are to be worshipped, O king, in you are treasures.

original: tvaṃ hi kṣaitavad yaśo 'gne mitro na patyase /
analyzed: tvam hi kṣaitavat yaśaḥ gne mitraḥ na patyase
translated: For you, O Agni, are the fame of the Kshatriyas, you shine as a lord like Mitra.

original: tvaṃ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṃ na puṣyasi //
analyzed: tvam vicarṣaṇe śravaḥ vaso puṣṭim na puṣyasi
translated: You, O active one, O Vasu, promote fame and prosperity like a nurse.

original: tvāṃ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhir gīrbhir īḷate /
analyzed: tvām hi sma carṣaṇayaḥ yajñebhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īḍate
translated: For you are invoked by the people with sacrifices and hymns in the assembly.

original: tvāṃ vājī yāty avṛko rajastūr viśvacarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: tvām vājī yāti a vṛkaḥ rajastūr viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
translated: The strong one, the fearless one, the all-powerful one, goes to you, O Agni, the one who crosses the realm.

original: sajoṣas tvā divo naro yajñasya ketum indhate /
analyzed: sajoṣaḥ tvā divaḥ naraḥ yajñasya ketum indhate
translated: The men of heaven, of one accord, kindle you, the banner of the sacrifice,

original: yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyur juhve adhvare //
analyzed: yat ha sya mānuṣaḥ janaḥ sumnāyuḥ juhve adhvare
translated: When the human people, seeking bliss, offer oblations in the sacrifice.🔽The mortal who, through your inspiration, O you who give good gifts, O Agni, strives for glory,

original: ṛdhad yas te sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate /🔽ūtī ṣa bṛhato divo dviṣo aṃho na tarati //
analyzed: ṛdhat yaḥ te sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate  ūtī sa bṛhataḥ divaḥ dviṣaḥ aṃhaḥ na tarati
translated: With your help, O you of the great heaven, overcomes the distress of the foe.

original: samidhā yas ta āhutiṃ niśitim martyo naśat /
analyzed: samidhā yaḥ te āhutim niśitim martyaḥ naśat
translated: The mortal who serves you with fuel and oblation, who seeks your protection,

original: vayāvantaṃ sa puṣyati kṣayam agne śatāyuṣam //
analyzed: vayāvantam sa puṣyati kṣayam agne śata āyuṣam
translated: He prospers, O Agni, and reaches old age, a life of a hundred years.

original: tveṣas te dhūma ṛṇvati divi ṣañ chukra ātataḥ /
analyzed: tveṣaḥ te dhūmaḥ ṛṇvati divi sam śukraḥ ātataḥ
translated: Thy smoke asketh for the ruddy light in heaven, thy bright flame spreadeth out.

original: sūro na hi dyutā tvaṃ kṛpā pāvaka rocase //
analyzed: sūraḥ na hi dyutā tvam kṛpā pāvaka rocase
translated: For thou, O purifying flame, shinest with splendour like the sun.

original: adhā hi vikṣv īḍyo 'si priyo no atithiḥ /
analyzed: adhā hi vikṣu īḍyaḥ si priyaḥ naḥ atithiḥ
translated: For now thou art to be worshipped in many a place, a dear guest to us,

original: raṇvaḥ purīva jūryaḥ sūnur na trayayāyyaḥ //🔽kratvā hi droṇe ajyase 'gne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ /🔽parijmeva svadhā gayo 'tyo na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ //
analyzed: raṇvaḥ puri iva jūryaḥ sūnuḥ na trayayāyyaḥ  kratvā hi droṇe ajyase gne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ  parijmā iva svadhā gaya u tyaḥ na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ
translated: A friend, like an old man in the city, a son to be cherished.🔽For by wisdom thou art kindled in the trough, O Agni, like a strong horse.🔽Like a swift steed, a child, thy own nature is impetuous.

original: tvaṃ tyā cid acyutāgne paśur na yavase /
analyzed: tvam tyā cit acyutā agne paśuḥ na yavase
translated: Thee, O Agni, even that which is unshaken, like a beast in the pasture,

original: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ //🔽veṣi hy adhvarīyatām agne hotā dame viśām /
analyzed: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ  veṣi hi adhvarīyatām agne hotā dame viśām
translated: When, O thou that art undecaying, the woods are cleft by thy flames.🔽For thou art to be chosen as the Adhvaryu, O Agni, as the Hotar in the house of the people.

original: samṛdho viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyam aṅgiraḥ //
analyzed: samṛdhaḥ viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyam aṅgiraḥ
translated: O lord of the people, make our possessions increase, accept the oblation, O Angiras.

original: acchā no mitramaho deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatiṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: acchā naḥ mitra mahas deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatim rodasyoḥ
translated: Come to us, O god, O Agni, with that great friendship of thine, speak to the gods the good will of the two worlds.

original: vīhi svastiṃ sukṣitiṃ divo nṝn dviṣo aṃhāṃsi duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema //
analyzed: vīhi svastim su kṣitim divaḥ nṝn dviṣaḥ aṃhāṃsi duritā tarema tā tarema tava avasā tarema
translated: Go to the men of heaven for good fortune and a good home. May we pass beyond those hateful evils. May we pass beyond them by thy help. May we pass beyond them.

original: agne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotir naśate devayuṣ ṭe /
analyzed: agne sa kṣeṣat ṛta pāḥ ṛta jāḥ uru jyotiḥ naśate devayuḥ te
translated: O Agni, he who possesses the truth, who is full of truth, shines with wide light, he who is devoted to the gods.

original: yaṃ tvam mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martam aṃhaḥ //
analyzed: yam tvam mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ deva pāsi tyajasā martam aṃhaḥ
translated: The man whom thou, O God, protectest with thy friend Varuna in unison, from the affliction of sin.

original: īje yajñebhiḥ śaśame śamībhir ṛdhadvārāyāgnaye dadāśa /
analyzed: īje yajñebhiḥ śaśame śamībhiḥ ṛdha dvārāya agnaye dadāśa
translated: He who hath worshipped with sacrifices, served with offerings, hath given to Agni who hath prospered.

original: evā cana taṃ yaśasām ajuṣṭir nāṃho martaṃ naśate na pradṛptiḥ //
analyzed: evā cana tam yaśasām ajuṣṭiḥ na aṃhaḥ martam naśate na pradṛptiḥ
translated: Even to him hath no want of worship, no failure, no pride of man, no wrath, no violence.

original: sūro na yasya dṛśatir arepā bhīmā yad eti śucatas ta ā dhīḥ /🔽heṣasvataḥ śurudho nāyam aktoḥ kutrā cid raṇvo vasatir vanejāḥ //
analyzed: sūraḥ na yasya dṛśatiḥ arepāḥ bhīmā yat eti śucataḥ te ā dhīḥ  heṣasvataḥ śurudhaḥ na ayam aktoḥ kutrā cit raṇvaḥ vasatiḥ vanejāḥ
translated: Whose eye, unblemished, like the sun, when he comes forth in his splendour, is terrible.🔽The son of the swift one, the liberal one, the one from the house, the one from the forest, is somewhere a kindly guest.

original: tigmaṃ cid ema mahi varpo asya bhasad aśvo na yamasāna āsā /🔽vijehamānaḥ paraśur na jihvāṃ dravir na drāvayati dāru dhakṣat //🔽sa id asteva prati dhād asiṣyañ chiśīta tejo 'yaso na dhārām /
analyzed: tigmam cit ema mahi varpaḥ asya bhasad aśvaḥ na yamasānaḥ āsā  vijehamānaḥ paraśuḥ na jihvām draviḥ na drāvayati dāru dhakṣat  saḥ id astā iva prati dhāt asiṣyam śiśīta tejaḥ yasaḥ na dhārām
translated: Even his fierce form is like a well-fed horse, like one yoked to a car.🔽Like a hatchet cutting off a branch, like a melting substance melting wood, he melts away.🔽He, as if lying, has taken up his abode, he has sharpened his splendour like a stream of iron.

original: citradhrajatir aratir yo aktor ver na druṣadvā raghupatmajaṃhāḥ //
analyzed: citra dhrajatiḥ aratiḥ yaḥ aktoḥ veḥ na druṣadvāḥ raghu patma jaṃhāḥ
translated: The one with variegated wheels, the one who goes to the house, the one from the house, the one who is like a piece of wood from a tree.

original: sa īṃ rebho na prati vasta usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitramahāḥ /
analyzed: saḥ īm rebhaḥ na prati vaste usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitra mahāḥ
translated: He, like a singer, has covered the two dawns with his splendour, the great one.

original: naktaṃ ya īm aruṣo yo divā nṝn amartyo aruṣo yo divā nṝn //
analyzed: naktam yaḥ īm aruṣaḥ yaḥ divā nṝn amartyaḥ aruṣaḥ yaḥ divā nṝn
translated: The red one who is at night, the red one who is by day among men, the immortal one who is by day among men.

original: divo na yasya vidhato navīnod vṛṣā rukṣa oṣadhīṣu nūnot /
analyzed: divaḥ na yasya vidhataḥ navīnot vṛṣā rukṣaḥ oṣadhīṣu nūnot
translated: Whose ordinances from heaven are new each day, the strong one is generated in the plants.

original: ghṛṇā na yo dhrajasā patmanā yann ā rodasī vasunā daṃ supatnī //
analyzed: ghṛṇā na yaḥ dhrajasā patmanā yan ā rodasī vasunā dam su patnī
translated: He who moves with the swift one by the path, filling the two worlds with wealth, the good wife.

original: dhāyobhir vā yo yujyebhir arkair vidyun na davidyot svebhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ /🔽śardho vā yo marutāṃ tatakṣa ṛbhur na tveṣo rabhasāno adyaut //
analyzed: dhāyobhiḥ vā yaḥ yujyebhiḥ arkaiḥ vidyut na davidyot svebhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ  śardhaḥ vā yaḥ marutām tatakṣa ṛbhuḥ na tveṣaḥ rabhasānaḥ adyaut
translated: He who is yoked with the supporting and joining hymns, who shines with his own light like lightning.🔽Or he who is fashioned by the host of Maruts, the impetuous one shines like a swift one.

original: yathā hotar manuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi /🔽evā no adya samanā samānān uśann agna uśato yakṣi devān //
analyzed: yathā hotar manuṣaḥ devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ yajāsi  eva naḥ adya samanā samānān uśan agne uśataḥ yakṣi devān
translated: As the Hotar, O son of strength, you are to be worshipped with sacrifices by men in the service of the gods.🔽So, O Agni, being pleased, do you today worship the eager gods for us who are eager.

original: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇir na vastor agnir vandāru vedyaś cano dhāt /
analyzed: sa naḥ vibhāvā cakṣaṇiḥ na vastoḥ agniḥ vandāru vedyaḥ canaḥ dhāt
translated: May that Agni, the illuminator, the protector, the guest of the morning, the worshipper, the one to be worshipped, grant us what we desire.

original: viśvāyur yo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūd atithir jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: viśvāyuḥ yaḥ amṛtaḥ martyeṣu uṣarbudh bhūt atithiḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: The all-life, the immortal one among mortals, the ever-present, the guest, the all-knowing.

original: dyāvo na yasya panayanty abhvam bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ /
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na yasya panayanti abhvam bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryaḥ na śukraḥ
translated: Whose greatness the heavens proclaim, he wears the lights like the bright sun.

original: vi ya inoty ajaraḥ pāvako 'śnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyāṇi //
analyzed: vi yaḥ inoti ajaraḥ pāvakaḥ śnasya cit śiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
translated: The undecaying, the purifying one, he overcomes the ancient obstacles, even of the food.

original: vadmā hi sūno asy admasadvā cakre agnir januṣājmānnam /
analyzed: vadmā hi sūno asi adma sadvā cakre agniḥ januṣā ajma annam
translated: For you are the speaker, O son, the one to be fed, Agni has made food by his birth.

original: sa tvaṃ na ūrjasana ūrjaṃ dhā rājeva jer avṛke kṣeṣy antaḥ //🔽nitikti yo vāraṇam annam atti vāyur na rāṣṭry aty ety aktūn /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ ūrja sane ūrjam dhāḥ rājā iva jeḥ avṛke kṣeṣi antar  nitikti yaḥ vā araṇam annam atti vāyuḥ na rāṣṭrī ati eti aktūn
translated: So, O Urdhasana, bestow strength on us, as a king in his own house, free from foes, bestows (gifts).🔽He who eats food that is not well-cooked, like the wind, the king of the air, passes over the clouds.

original: turyāma yas ta ādiśām arātīr atyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut //
analyzed: turyāma yaḥ te ādiśām arātīḥ atyaḥ na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut
translated: He who conquers the hostilities of the quarters, like a swift horse, passes over the flying (enemies).

original: ā sūryo na bhānumadbhir arkair agne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā /
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ na bhānumadbhiḥ arkaiḥ agne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā
translated: O Agni, with thy bright rays like the sun, thou hast extended the two worlds with thy light.

original: citro nayat pari tamāṃsy aktaḥ śociṣā patmann auśijo na dīyan //
analyzed: citraḥ nayat pari tamāṃsi aktaḥ śociṣā patman auśijaḥ na dīyan
translated: Like a variegated (horse), thou carriest away the darkness, like Auśija, thou shinest along thy path.

original: tvāṃ hi mandratamam arkaśokair vavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣy agne /
analyzed: tvām hi mandratamam arka śokaiḥ vavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣi agne
translated: For we have chosen thee, O most delightful one, with the most brilliant rays. Hear us, O Agni, and grant us great wealth.

original: indraṃ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyum pṛṇanti rādhasā nṛtamāḥ //
analyzed: indram na tvā śavasā devatāḥ vāyum pṛṇanti rādhasā nṛtamāḥ
translated: The most truthful deities, like Indra, O Agni, with their might, and Vāyu with their bounty, fill thee.

original: nū no agne 'vṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣy aṃhaḥ /
analyzed: nu naḥ agne vṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣi aṃhaḥ
translated: Now, O Agni, with thy propitious paths, lead us to prosperity, and carry us over misfortune.

original: tā sūribhyo gṛṇate rāsi sumnam madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: tā sūribhyaḥ gṛṇate rāsi sumnam madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Grant that favour to the princes who sing (thy praises). May we rejoice a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: huve vaḥ sūnuṃ sahaso yuvānam adroghavācam matibhir yaviṣṭham /
analyzed: huve vaḥ sūnum sahasaḥ yuvānam adrogha vācam matibhiḥ yaviṣṭham
translated: I invoke your youthful son of strength, whose speech is free from guile, the most youthful with my thoughts,

original: ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāro adhruk //
analyzed: yaḥ invati draviṇāni pracetāḥ viśva vārāṇi puru vāraḥ adruh
translated: Who impels the wealth, the wise one, the bountiful one, the infallible one, who bestows all boons.

original: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotar doṣā vastor erire yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotar doṣā vastoḥ erire yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: In thee, O Hotar, O thou of ancient rites, the Vasus, the most worthy of sacrifice, have placed the night and the dawn.

original: kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṃ saubhagāni dadhire pāvake //
analyzed: kṣāma iva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin sam saubhagāni dadhire pāvake
translated: In him who is like the sky, in whom are all the worlds, in the purifier, they have placed all blessings.

original: tvaṃ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīr abhavo vāryāṇām /
analyzed: tvam vikṣu pradivaḥ sīdaḥ āsu kratvā rathīḥ abhavaḥ vāryāṇām
translated: Thou, O God, hast sat down in these families, in the highest heaven. By wisdom thou hast become the charioteer of all good things.

original: ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vy ānuṣag jātavedo vasūni //
analyzed: atas inoṣi vidhate cikitvaḥ vi ānuṣak jātavedaḥ vasūni
translated: From there, O all-knowing one, thou sendest, according to the wish of the one who has prepared the sacrifice, the treasures, O all-knowing one, in due order.

original: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsad agne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ sanutyaḥ abhidāsat agne yaḥ antaraḥ mitra mahas vanuṣyāt
translated: O Agni, he who would attack us from the quarters, he who would injure us from within, O thou who hast Mitra as thy helper,

original: tam ajarebhir vṛṣabhis tava svais tapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān //
analyzed: tam ajarebhiḥ vṛṣabhiḥ tava svaiḥ tapa tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān
translated: Burn him with thy own, O thou of undecaying strength, with thy most burning heat, O thou who art to be heated.

original: yas te yajñena samidhā ya ukthair arkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat /
analyzed: yaḥ te yajñena samidhā yaḥ ukthaiḥ arkebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ dadāśat
translated: He who serves thee with sacrifice, with fuel, with hymns, with praises, O son of strength,

original: sa martyeṣv amṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti //
analyzed: sa martyeṣu amṛta pracetāḥ rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti
translated: He, O immortal one, who is wise among mortals, shines with wealth, with glory, with fame.

original: sa tat kṛdhīṣitas tūyam agne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān /
analyzed: sa tat kṛdhi iṣitaḥ tūyam agne spṛdhaḥ bādhasva sahasā sahasvān
translated: Do that, O Agni, thou who art to be invoked, drive away the enemies with force, O thou who art full of force.

original: yac chasyase dyubhir akto vacobhis taj juṣasva jaritur ghoṣi manma //
analyzed: yat śasyase dyubhiḥ aktaḥ vacobhiḥ tat juṣasva jarituḥ ghoṣi manma
translated: What thou art praised with the lights, with the hymns, accept that, O thou who art to be invoked, the hymn of the singer.

original: aśyāma taṃ kāmam agne tavotī aśyāma rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīram /
analyzed: aśyāma tam kāmam agne tava ūtī aśyāma rayim rayivas su vīram
translated: We would obtain that desire, O Agni, with thy help, we would obtain wealth, O wealthy one, with good heroes.

original: aśyāma vājam abhi vājayanto 'śyāma dyumnam ajarājaraṃ te //
analyzed: aśyāma vājam abhi vājayantaḥ śyāma dyumnam ajara ajaram te
translated: May we win strength, O thou who givest strength, may we win splendour, O thou of undecaying splendour.

original: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnum acchā yajñena gātum ava icchamānaḥ /
analyzed: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnum acchā yajñena gātum avaḥ icchamānaḥ
translated: With a new sacrifice I seek to win the favour of the Son of Strength, desirous of going.

original: vṛścadvanaṃ kṛṣṇayāmaṃ ruśantaṃ vītī hotāraṃ divyaṃ jigāti //
analyzed: vṛścat vanam kṛṣṇa yāmam ruśantam vītī hotāram divyam jigāti
translated: He cuts down the black-barked wood, the shining one, and goes to the divine Hotar, the all-seeing one.

original: sa śvitānas tanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhir nānadadbhir yaviṣṭhaḥ /🔽yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūny agnir anuyāti bharvan //
analyzed: sa śvitānaḥ tanyatuḥ rocana sthāḥ ajarebhiḥ nānadadbhiḥ yaviṣṭhaḥ  yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūni agniḥ anuyāti bharvan
translated: He, the white-backed one, thundering in the firmament, the youngest, with his undecaying roars,🔽The purifier, the most numerous, Agni, who follows many wide-spread offerings, carrying them.

original: vi te viṣvag vātajūtāso agne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaś caranti /🔽tuvimrakṣāso divyā navagvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ //
analyzed: vi te viṣvak vāta jūtāsaḥ agne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaḥ caranti  tuvi mrakṣāsaḥ divyāḥ navagvāḥ vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ
translated: Your flames, O Agni, fanned by the wind, O pure one, the pure ones move in all directions.🔽The very strong, the divine, the new ones, the woods, shaking, destroy with their firmness.

original: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṃ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ /
analyzed: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmas kṣām vapanti viṣitāsaḥ aśvāḥ
translated: Your bright, pure, pure-shining rays, O pure one, which spread out the earth, like horses in motion,

original: adha bhramas ta urviyā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ //🔽adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo goṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā /
analyzed: adha bhramaḥ te urviyā vi bhāti yātayamānaḥ adhi sānu pṛśneḥ  adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇaḥ goṣuyudhaḥ na aśaniḥ sṛjānā
translated: Then the bee shines forth with its radiance, moving over the ridge of the Pr̥iṣni, the female cloud.🔽Then the tongue of the wicked Vr̥ishṇa moves, the arrow of the cow, the thunderbolt, released.

original: śūrasyeva prasitiḥ kṣātir agner durvartur bhīmo dayate vanāni //
analyzed: śūrasya iva prasitiḥ kṣātiḥ agneḥ durvartuḥ bhīmaḥ dayate vanāni
translated: The destruction of Agni is like the destruction of a hero, terrible, hard to bear, it burns the woods.

original: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahas todasya dhṛṣatā tatantha /
analyzed: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahaḥ todasya dhṛṣatā tatantha
translated: With thy radiance thou hast boldly spread the earthly lights, the might of the burning one.

original: sa bādhasvāpa bhayā sahobhi spṛdho vanuṣyan vanuṣo ni jūrva //🔽sa citra citraṃ citayantam asme citrakṣatra citratamaṃ vayodhām /
analyzed: sa bādhasva apa bhayā sahobhi spṛdhaḥ vanuṣyan vanuṣaḥ ni jūrva  sa citra citram citayantam asme citra kṣatra citratamam vayaḥ dhām
translated: With thy powers, O Agni, drive away fear, burn the foe, O thou who rejoicest in the oblation, burn him.🔽O thou of wondrous deeds, wondrously wise, wondrously powerful, wondrously bestowing life,

original: candraṃ rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṃ candra candrābhir gṛṇate yuvasva //
analyzed: candram rayim puru vīram bṛhantam candra candrābhiḥ gṛṇate yuvasva
translated: grant to the singer, O thou of wondrous light, wondrous wealth, with wondrous gifts, great, full of heroes.

original: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratim pṛthivyā vaiśvānaram ṛta ā jātam agnim /
analyzed: mūrdhānam divaḥ aratim pṛthivyāḥ vaiśvānaram ṛte ā jātam agnim
translated: The head of the sky, the envoy of the earth, Vaiśvānara Agni, born in the womb of truth,

original: kaviṃ samrājam atithiṃ janānām āsann ā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: kavim samrājam atithim janānām āsan ā pātram janayanta devāḥ
translated: the wise, the emperor, the guest of men, the gods have generated the vessel that is near.

original: nābhiṃ yajñānāṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇām mahām āhāvam abhi saṃ navanta /
analyzed: nābhim yajñānām sadanam rayīṇām mahām āhāvam abhi sam navanta
translated: They praise him, the navel of sacrifices, the seat of riches, the great assembly,

original: vaiśvānaraṃ rathyam adhvarāṇāṃ yajñasya ketuṃ janayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: vaiśvānaram rathyam adhvarāṇām yajñasya ketum janayanta devāḥ
translated: Vaiśvānara, the chariot of sacrifices, the banner of the sacrifice, the gods have generated.

original: tvad vipro jāyate vājy agne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: tvat vipraḥ jāyate vājī agne tvat vīrāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: From thee, O Agni, the wise one is born, the strong one; from thee the heroes who conquer the foe.

original: vaiśvānara tvam asmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi //
analyzed: vaiśvānara tvam asmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi
translated: O Vaiśvānara, O king, grant us riches that are desirable.

original: tvāṃ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṃ śiśuṃ na devā abhi saṃ navante /
analyzed: tvām viśve amṛta jāyamānam śiśum na devāḥ abhi sam navante
translated: All the immortal gods praise thee, O child, as thou art born,

original: tava kratubhir amṛtatvam āyan vaiśvānara yat pitror adīdeḥ //
analyzed: tava kratubhiḥ amṛta tvam āyan vaiśvānara yat pitroḥ adīdeḥ
translated: By your sacrifices they have attained immortality, O Vaisvānara, when you shone forth from your parents.

original: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahāny agne nakir ā dadharṣa /
analyzed: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahāni agne nakir ā dadharṣa
translated: O Vaisvānara, those great vows of yours, O Agni, no one transgresses,

original: yaj jāyamānaḥ pitror upasthe 'vindaḥ ketuṃ vayuneṣv ahnām //
analyzed: yat jāyamānaḥ pitroḥ upasthe vindaḥ ketum vayuneṣu ahnām
translated: When, being born in the lap of your parents, you found the banner in the divisions of the days.

original: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divaḥ amṛtasya ketunā
translated: The ridges of Vaisvānara's heaven are measured by his eye, the banner of immortality.

original: tasyed u viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥ sapta visruhaḥ //
analyzed: tasya id u viśvā bhuvanā adhi mūrdhani vayāḥ iva ruruhuḥ sapta visruhaḥ
translated: On his head are all existing things, as if seven wide-spreading rays have grown.

original: vi yo rajāṃsy amimīta sukratur vaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ /
analyzed: vi yaḥ rajāṃsi amimīta sukratuḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vi divaḥ rocanā kaviḥ
translated: He who with good thoughts has measured out the regions, Vaisvānara, the wise one, the luminous firmament of heaven,

original: pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe 'dabdho gopā amṛtasya rakṣitā //
analyzed: pari yaḥ viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe dabdhaḥ gopāḥ amṛtasya rakṣitā
translated: He who has spread out over all existing things, the undeceiving guardian, the protector of immortality.

original: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū sahaḥ pra nu vocaṃ vidathā jātavedasaḥ /
analyzed: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ aruṣasya nu sahaḥ pra nu vocam vidathā jātavedasaḥ
translated: The strength of the tawny, red bull, I will now proclaim the deeds of the all-knowing one.

original: vaiśvānarāya matir navyasī śuciḥ soma iva pavate cārur agnaye //
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya matiḥ navyasī śuciḥ somaḥ iva pavate cāruḥ agnaye
translated: To Vaisvānara a new, pure thought flows like beautiful Soma for Agni.

original: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratāny agnir vratapā arakṣata /
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratāni agniḥ vrata pāḥ arakṣata
translated: When he was born in the highest heaven, Agni, the guardian of vows, guarded the vows.

original: vy antarikṣam amimīta sukratur vaiśvānaro mahinā nākam aspṛśat //
analyzed: vi antarikṣam amimīta sukratuḥ vaiśvānaraḥ mahinā nākam aspṛśat
translated: The wise one measured out the atmosphere, Vaisvānara with his greatness touched the luminous firmament.

original: vy astabhnād rodasī mitro adbhuto 'ntarvāvad akṛṇoj jyotiṣā tamaḥ /
analyzed: vi astabhnāt rodasī mitraḥ adbhutaḥ ntarvāvat akṛṇot jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: Mitra, the wondrous, hath upheld the two world-halves: in the midst he hath made light for darkness.

original: vi carmaṇīva dhiṣaṇe avartayad vaiśvānaro viśvam adhatta vṛṣṇyam //
analyzed: vi carmaṇī iva dhiṣaṇe avartayat vaiśvānaraḥ viśvam adhatta vṛṣṇyam
translated: He hath turned the two bowls asunder as with a knife: Vaiṣvânara hath laid in all the strength of life.

original: apām upasthe mahiṣā agṛbhṇata viśo rājānam upa tasthur ṛgmiyam /🔽ā dūto agnim abharad vivasvato vaiśvānaram mātariśvā parāvataḥ //
analyzed: apām upasthe mahiṣāḥ agṛbhṇata viśaḥ rājānam upa tasthuḥ ṛgmiyam  ā dūtaḥ agnim abharat vivasvataḥ vaiśvānaram mātariśvā parāvataḥ
translated: The mighty ones have seized the King in the waters' lap: the people have attended the King worthy of the hymn.🔽From the far distance Mâtariṣvan hath brought Agni, the envoy, the son of Vivasvan, Vaiṣvânara.

original: yugeyuge vidathyaṃ gṛṇadbhyo 'gne rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehi navyasīm /
analyzed: yuge yuge vidathyam gṛṇadbhyaḥ gne rayim yaśasam dhehi navyasīm
translated: In every age, O Agni, to the singers give wealth that shall be famed among the folk.

original: pavyeva rājann aghaśaṃsam ajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninaṃ na tejasā //
analyzed: pavyā iva rājan agha śaṃsam ajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninam na tejasā
translated: O King, O thou that art not old, with thy flame burn the sinner down, as with an axe a tree.

original: asmākam agne maghavatsu dhārayānāmi kṣatram ajaraṃ suvīryam /
analyzed: asmākam agne maghavatsu dhāraya anāmi kṣatram ajaram su vīryam
translated: O Agni, among our wealthy princes lay thou strength that shall not waste away, and hero might.

original: vayaṃ jayema śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ vaiśvānara vājam agne tavotibhiḥ //
analyzed: vayam jayema śatinam sahasriṇam vaiśvānara vājam agne tava ūtibhiḥ
translated: O Vaiṣvânara Agni, by thy help may we win hundredfold and thousandfold spoil.

original: adabdhebhis tava gopābhir iṣṭe 'smākam pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn /
analyzed: adabdhebhiḥ tava gopābhiḥ iṣṭe smākam pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn
translated: With thy sure, watchful, guarding help guard thou our princes, O thou that art in the three stations.

original: rakṣā ca no daduṣāṃ śardho agne vaiśvānara pra ca tārī stavānaḥ //
analyzed: rakṣā ca naḥ daduṣām śardhaḥ agne vaiśvānara pra ca tārī stavānaḥ
translated: Guard thou our liberal princes, O Agni, Vaiṣvânara: protect our men, O thou that art to be praised.

original: ahaś ca kṛṣṇam ahar arjunaṃ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ /
analyzed: ahar ca kṛṣṇam ahar arjunam ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ
translated: The black day and the red day revolve by turns, with their veils of mist,

original: vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātiraj jyotiṣāgnis tamāṃsi //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ jāyamānaḥ na rājā avātirat jyotiṣā agniḥ tamāṃsi
translated: Vaisvânara, the King, the newly-born, hath overcome the darkness with his light, with fire.

original: nāhaṃ tantuṃ na vi jānāmy otuṃ na yaṃ vayanti samare 'tamānāḥ /
analyzed: na aham tantum na vi jānāmi otum na yam vayanti samare tamānāḥ
translated: I know not the thread nor the end of it, which they weave in the battle, the immortals.

original: kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadāty avareṇa pitrā //
analyzed: kasya svid putraḥ iha vaktvāni paraḥ vadāti avareṇa pitrā
translated: Whose son is it that here must speak, that he is born by a father who is lower than he?

original: sa it tantuṃ sa vi jānāty otuṃ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti /🔽ya īṃ ciketad amṛtasya gopā avaś caran paro anyena paśyan //
analyzed: saḥ id tantum sa vi jānāti otum sa vaktvāni ṛtuthā vadāti  yaḥ īm ciketat amṛtasya gopāḥ avas caran paras anyena paśyan
translated: He knows the thread and the end of it, he speaks according to the season what must be spoken.🔽He who hath thought on him, the guardian of immortality, moving about, seeing beyond by another.

original: ayaṃ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemam idaṃ jyotir amṛtam martyeṣu /
analyzed: ayam hotā prathamaḥ paśyata imam idam jyotiḥ amṛtam martyeṣu
translated: This Priest first sees him, this light of immortality among mortals.

original: ayaṃ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto 'martyas tanvā vardhamānaḥ //
analyzed: ayam sa jajñe dhruvaḥ ā niṣattaḥ martyaḥ tanvā vardhamānaḥ
translated: He it is who hath been born, firmly established, immortal, growing in his body.

original: dhruvaṃ jyotir nihitaṃ dṛśaye kam mano javiṣṭham patayatsv antaḥ /
analyzed: dhruvam jyotiḥ nihitam dṛśaye kam manaḥ javiṣṭham patayatsu antar
translated: The firm light is set up for all to see: the swiftest thought moves in the midst of the moving (waters).

original: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṃ kratum abhi vi yanti sādhu //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ sa ketāḥ ekam kratum abhi vi yanti sādhu
translated: The All-Gods, of one mind, of one resolve, go forth to the one true sacrifice.

original: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣur vīdaṃ jyotir hṛdaya āhitaṃ yat /
analyzed: vi me karṇā patayataḥ vi cakṣuḥ vi idam jyotiḥ hṛdaye āhitam yat
translated: My ears are deafened, my eyes are blinded, and this light which is in my heart is hidden.

original: vi me manaś carati dūraādhīḥ kiṃ svid vakṣyāmi kim u nū maniṣye //
analyzed: vi me manaḥ carati dūra ādhīḥ kim svid vakṣyāmi kim u nu maniṣye
translated: My mind wanders far away, thinking. What shall I say? What shall I think now?

original: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānās tvām agne tamasi tasthivāṃsam /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anamasyan bhiyānāḥ tvām agne tamasi tasthivāṃsam
translated: All the gods bowed down in fear, O Agni, to you who stood in the darkness.

original: vaiśvānaro 'vatūtaye no 'martyo 'vatūtaye naḥ //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ vatu ūtaye naḥ martyaḥ vatu ūtaye naḥ
translated: Vaisvānara, for our protection, the immortal, for our protection.

original: puro vo mandraṃ divyaṃ suvṛktim prayati yajñe agnim adhvare dadhidhvam /
analyzed: puras vaḥ mandram divyam suvṛktim prayati yajñe agnim adhvare dadhidhvam
translated: To you, O delightful one, the heavenly one, the good hymn, at the sacrifice, at the rite, kindle Agni.

original: pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: puras ukthebhiḥ sa hi naḥ vibhāvā su adhvarā karati jātavedāḥ
translated: With praises, for he is to be glorified by us, the all-knower, he makes our sacrifices successful.

original: tam u dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotar agne agnibhir manuṣa idhānaḥ /
analyzed: tam u dyumas purvaṇīka hotar agne agnibhiḥ manuṣe idhānaḥ
translated: To him, O Dyu, O Agni, O priest of the first rank, O Agni, the mortal one, kindling (you) with the fires,

original: stomaṃ yam asmai mamateva śūṣaṃ ghṛtaṃ na śuci matayaḥ pavante //
analyzed: stomam yam asmai śūṣam ghṛtam na śuci matayaḥ pavante
translated: The praise which they offer to him, like a wish, like strength, the pure thoughts purify like ghee.

original: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo agnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yaḥ agnaye dadāśa vipraḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: He has shone forth in glory among mortals, he who has offered to Agni with hymns, O sage.

original: citrābhis tam ūtibhiś citraśocir vrajasya sātā gomato dadhāti //
analyzed: citrābhiḥ tam ūtibhiḥ citra śociḥ vrajasya sātā gomataḥ dadhāti
translated: With variegated aids, the variegated-shining one bestows upon him the good herd of cattle.

original: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamāna urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇādhvā /
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamānaḥ urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇa adhvā
translated: He who, at birth, looked out over the wide earth, with far-seeing, dark-path light,

original: adha bahu cit tama ūrmyāyās tiraḥ śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ //
analyzed: adha bahu cit tamaḥ ūrmyāyāḥ tiras śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ
translated: Even through much darkness, the purifier is seen with his flame.

original: nū naś citram puruvājābhir ūtī agne rayim maghavadbhyaś ca dhehi /
analyzed: nu naḥ citram puru vājābhiḥ ūtī agne rayim maghavadbhyaḥ ca dhehi
translated: Now, O Agni, bestow upon our wealthy princes wondrous wealth with many a boon.

original: ye rādhasā śravasā cāty anyān suvīryebhiś cābhi santi janān //
analyzed: ye rādhasā śravasā ca ati anyān su vīryebhiḥ ca abhi santi janān
translated: Who by their bounty and their glory surpass other men and are exalted by their hero might.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ cano dhā agna uśan yaṃ ta āsāno juhute haviṣmān /
analyzed: imam yajñam canaḥ dhāḥ agne uśan yam te āsānaḥ juhute haviṣmān
translated: Accept this sacrifice, O Agni, with love, which, seated here, the worshipper offers with oblations.

original: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktim avīr vājasya gadhyasya sātau //
analyzed: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktim avīḥ vājasya gadhyasya sātau
translated: Among the Bharadvâjas thou hast accepted the fair hymn, for the winning of strength and booty.

original: vi dveṣāṃsīnuhi vardhayeḷām madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: vi vardhaya iḷām madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Drive away our enemies, increase our friends. May we rejoice through a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: yajasva hotar iṣito yajīyān agne bādho marutāṃ na prayukti /
analyzed: yajasva hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān agne bādhaḥ marutām na prayukti
translated: Offer sacrifice, O Hotar, urged on, most worthy of sacrifice, O Agni, as the leader of the Maruts.

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ
translated: Do ye, O Mitra-Varuṇa, O Nâsatyas, O Heaven and Earth, turn hither to the priesthood.

original: tvaṃ hotā mandratamo no adhrug antar devo vidathā martyeṣu /
analyzed: tvam hotā mandratamaḥ naḥ adhruk antar devaḥ vidathā martyeṣu
translated: Thou art our Hotar, O God, most delightful, among mortals, O Agni, in the assemblies.

original: pāvakayā juhvā vahnir āsāgne yajasva tanvaṃ tava svām //
analyzed: pāvakayā juhvā vahniḥ āsā agne yajasva tanvam tava svām
translated: With thy purifying tongue, O bearer of the oblation, offer sacrifice to thy own body.

original: dhanyā cid dhi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devāñ janma gṛṇate yajadhyai /
analyzed: dhanyā cit hi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devām janma gṛṇate yajadhyai
translated: Even the thought of wealth rests in thee. Do thou, to be praised, offer sacrifice to the gods, to be born, to be glorified.

original: vepiṣṭho aṅgirasāṃ yad dha vipro madhu cchando bhanati rebha iṣṭau //
analyzed: vepiṣṭhaḥ aṅgirasām yat ha vipraḥ madhu chandaḥ bhanati rebhaḥ iṣṭau
translated: The most purifying of the Angirases, when the sage, the singer, breaks the honey-meath in the sacrifice.

original: adidyutat sv apāko vibhāvāgne yajasva rodasī urūcī /
analyzed: adidyutat su apākaḥ vibhāvā agne yajasva rodasī urūcī
translated: Shine forth, O Agni, with thy pure light, worship the two wide-extending worlds.

original: āyuṃ na yaṃ namasā rātahavyā añjanti suprayasam pañca janāḥ //
analyzed: āyum na yam namasā rāta havyāḥ añjanti su prayasam pañca janāḥ
translated: Whom the five peoples, with homage and oblations, anoint as the most active one for life.

original: vṛñje ha yan namasā barhir agnāv ayāmi srug ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ /
analyzed: vṛñje ha yat namasā barhiḥ agnau ayāmi sruc ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ
translated: When I adorn the grass with homage to Agni, I offer the ghee-filled ladle and good praise.

original: amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyā aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ //
analyzed: amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyāḥ aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ
translated: You have looked into the seat on the earth, the sacrifice has rested in the sun, as the eye.

original: daśasyā naḥ purvaṇīka hotar devebhir agne agnibhir idhānaḥ /
analyzed: daśasya naḥ purvaṇīka hotar devebhiḥ agne agnibhiḥ idhānaḥ
translated: O Agni, the Hotar, the leader of the first, to be worshipped by us, kindled by the gods, by the fires,

original: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso vāvasānā ati srasema vṛjanaṃ nāṃhaḥ //
analyzed: rāyaḥ sūno sahasaḥ vāvasānāḥ ati srasema vṛjanam nā aṃhaḥ
translated: O son of strength, may we attain the wealth, the company, the people, as in the day.

original: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḷ agnis todasya rodasī yajadhyai /
analyzed: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣaḥ rāj agniḥ todasya rodasī yajadhyai
translated: The Hotar in the middle of the house, on the grass, Agni is to be worshipped for the roar, for the two worlds.

original: ayaṃ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna //
analyzed: ayam sa sūnuḥ sahasaḥ ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryaḥ na śociṣā tatāna
translated: This is the son, the one of true law, the one who has spread from afar with his radiance, like the sun.

original: ā yasmin tve sv apāke yajatra yakṣad rājan sarvatāteva nu dyauḥ /
analyzed: ā yasmin tve su apāke yajatra yakṣat rājan sarvatātā iva nu dyauḥ
translated: In whom, O you of pure light, O you to be worshipped, O king, all-supporting like the sky,

original: triṣadhasthas tataruṣo na jaṃho havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai //
analyzed: triṣadhasthaḥ tataruṣaḥ na jaṃhaḥ havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai
translated: The one in the three-seated place, the one to be praised like a horse, the offerings, the generous acts of men are to be worshipped.

original: tejiṣṭhā yasyāratir vanerāṭ todo adhvan na vṛdhasāno adyaut /
analyzed: tejiṣṭhā yasya aratiḥ vanerāj todaḥ adhvan na vṛdhasānaḥ adyaut
translated: The one whose wrath, like a forest fire, is the most radiant, the roar, like a growing river, has shone.

original: adrogho na dravitā cetati tmann amartyo 'vartra oṣadhīṣu //🔽sāsmākebhir etarī na śūṣair agni ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: adroghaḥ na dravitā cetati tman amartyaḥ vartre oṣadhīṣu  sā asmākebhiḥ etarī na śūṣaiḥ agni stave dame ā jātavedāḥ
translated: The guileless one, not to be deceived, thinks in himself, the immortal one, the unbarred one, among the plants.🔽With these our own most powerful (songs) we will praise Agni, the all-knower, in the house,

original: drvanno vanvan kratvā nārvosraḥ piteva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: dru annaḥ vanvan kratvā na arva usraḥ pitā iva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ
translated: The one who seeks with wisdom, like a father with his son, with sacrifices, the one who seeks with food.

original: adha smāsya panayanti bhāso vṛthā yat takṣad anuyāti pṛthvīm /
analyzed: adha sma asya panayanti bhāsaḥ vṛthā yat takṣat anuyāti pṛthvīm
translated: Now they praise his rays, when he fashions in vain, following the wide earth.

original: sadyo yaḥ syandro viṣito dhavīyān ṛṇo na tāyur ati dhanvā rāṭ //
analyzed: sadyas yaḥ syandraḥ viṣitaḥ dhavīyān ṛṇaḥ na tāyuḥ ati dhanvā rāj
translated: The one who is suddenly let loose, the most powerful, the one who is stretched out, the king who is like a debtor, who goes beyond the bow.

original: sa tvaṃ no arvan nidāyā viśvebhir agne agnibhir idhānaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ arvan nidāyāḥ viśvebhiḥ agne agnibhiḥ idhānaḥ
translated: You, O horse, for us, O Agni, kindled with all the fires,

original: veṣi rāyo vi yāsi ducchunā madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: veṣi rāyaḥ vi yāsi ducchunāḥ madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: You go to the riches, you drive away misfortune. May we rejoice for a hundred winters with good heroes.

original: tvad viśvā subhaga saubhagāny agne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ /
analyzed: tvat viśvā subhaga saubhagāni agne vi yanti vaninaḥ na vayāḥ
translated: From you, O prosperous one, all good fortunes, O Agni, go forth like trees to their tops.

original: śruṣṭī rayir vājo vṛtratūrye divo vṛṣṭir īḍyo rītir apām //🔽tvam bhago na ā hi ratnam iṣe parijmeva kṣayasi dasmavarcāḥ /
analyzed: śruṣṭiḥ rayiḥ vājaḥ vṛtratūrye divaḥ vṛṣṭiḥ īḍyaḥ rītiḥ apām  tvam bhagaḥ naḥ ā hi ratnam iṣe parijmā iva kṣayasi dasma varcāḥ
translated: The heard wealth, the strength, the Vrtra-slayer, the rain of heaven, the praiseworthy course of the waters.🔽You, O Bhaga, come to us for the treasure, like a guest, O wondrous one, you dwell.

original: agne mitro na bṛhata ṛtasyāsi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ //
analyzed: agne mitraḥ na bṛhataḥ ṛtasya asi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ
translated: O Agni, you are the great judge of Mitra of the right, O god, of abundant wealth.

original: sa satpatiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram agne vipro vi paṇer bharti vājam /
analyzed: sa sat patiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram agne vipraḥ vi paṇeḥ bharti vājam
translated: That lord of the true, with might, slays Vritra, Agni, the sage, carries the prize through the conflict.

original: yaṃ tvam praceta ṛtajāta rāyā sajoṣā naptrāpāṃ hinoṣi //
analyzed: yam tvam pracetaḥ ṛta jāta rāyā sajoṣāḥ naptrā apām hinoṣi
translated: Whom, O wise one born of the waters, thou carriest with wealth, O thou of true birth, in accord with the offspring of the waters.

original: yas te sūno sahaso gīrbhir ukthair yajñair marto niśitiṃ vedyānaṭ /🔽viśvaṃ sa deva prati vāram agne dhatte dhānyam patyate vasavyaiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ te sūno sahasaḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ yajñaiḥ martaḥ niśitim vedyā ānaṭ  viśvam sa deva prati vāram agne dhatte dhānyam patyate vasavyaiḥ
translated: The mortal who, O son of strength, knows thy favour through songs, hymns, and sacrifices,🔽That god, O Agni, obtains all the people, and prospers through his own wealth.

original: tā nṛbhya ā sauśravasā suvīrāgne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyase dhāḥ /
analyzed: tā nṛbhyaḥ ā sauśravasā su vīrā agne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyase dhāḥ
translated: Those, O Agni, son of strength, thou furtherest through fame and good heroes, O son of strength.

original: kṛṇoṣi yac chavasā bhūri paśvo vayo vṛkāyāraye jasuraye //
analyzed: kṛṇoṣi yat śavasā bhūri paśvaḥ vayaḥ vṛkāya araye jasuraye
translated: When thou makest abundant food through might for the wolf, the swift one, the strong one.

original: vadmā sūno sahaso no vihāyā agne tokaṃ tanayaṃ vāji no dāḥ /
analyzed: vadmā sūno sahasaḥ naḥ vihāyāḥ agne tokam tanayam vāji naḥ dāḥ
translated: O son of strength, grant us, O Agni, dwelling, offspring, and strength, O mighty one.

original: viśvābhir gīrbhir abhi pūrtim aśyām madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ abhi pūrtim aśyām madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: With all songs may I obtain fulfilment. May we rejoice through a hundred winters with good heroes.

original: agnā yo martyo duvo dhiyaṃ jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ /
analyzed: agnā yaḥ martyaḥ duvaḥ dhiyam jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, the mortal who delights in thy friendship with his thoughts,

original: bhasan nu ṣa pra pūrvya iṣaṃ vurītāvase //🔽agnir id dhi pracetā agnir vedhastama ṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: bhasan nu sa pra pūrvyaḥ iṣam vurīta avase  agniḥ id hi pracetāḥ agniḥ vedhastamaḥ ṛṣiḥ
translated: Like a bird, O earliest one, he obtains food for his support.🔽Agni indeed is the wise one, Agni is the sage, the seer.

original: agniṃ hotāram īḷate yajñeṣu manuṣo viśaḥ //
analyzed: agnim hotāram īḍate yajñeṣu manuṣaḥ viśaḥ
translated: The people invite Agni as the Hotar priest at sacrifices.

original: nānā hy agne 'vase spardhante rāyo aryaḥ /
analyzed: nānā hi agne vase spardhante rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: For, Agni, the rich men strive in various ways to win thy favour.

original: tūrvanto dasyum āyavo vrataiḥ sīkṣanto avratam //
analyzed: tūrvantaḥ dasyum āyavaḥ vrataiḥ sīkṣantaḥ avratam
translated: The active ones, with their vows, strive to subdue the inactive Dasyu.

original: agnir apsām ṛtīṣahaṃ vīraṃ dadāti satpatim /
analyzed: agniḥ ap sām ṛtīṣaham vīram dadāti sat patim
translated: Agni bestows the hero who conquers the enemies of the waters, the lord of the good.

original: yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravo bhiyā //
analyzed: yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravaḥ bhiyā
translated: Whose power the enemies tremble to look at, through fear.

original: agnir hi vidmanā nido devo martam uruṣyati /
analyzed: agniḥ hi vidmanā nidaḥ devaḥ martam uruṣyati
translated: For we know that Agni, the god, protects the mortal man with his wisdom.

original: sahāvā yasyāvṛto rayir vājeṣv avṛtaḥ //🔽acchā no mitramaho deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatiṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: sahāvā yasya a vṛtaḥ rayiḥ vājeṣu a vṛtaḥ  acchā naḥ mitra mahas deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatim rodasyoḥ
translated: Whose wealth, guarded by him, is guarded in the battles.🔽O Agni, the great friend, speak to the gods, the god, the good will of the two worlds.

original: vīhi svastiṃ sukṣitiṃ divo nṝn dviṣo aṃhāṃsi duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema //
analyzed: vīhi svastim su kṣitim divaḥ nṝn dviṣaḥ aṃhāṃsi duritā tarema tā tarema tava avasā tarema
translated: Go to the prosperity, the good abode of the men of heaven. May we pass over the hateful, evil deeds. May we pass over (them) by thy help. May we pass over (them).

original: imam ū ṣu vo atithim uṣarbudhaṃ viśvāsāṃ viśām patim ṛñjase girā /
analyzed: imam u su vaḥ atithim uṣarbudham viśvāsām viśām patim ṛñjase girā
translated: To this your guest who rises at dawn, the lord of all the people, I go with a song to win him.

original: vetīd divo januṣā kac cid ā śucir jyok cid atti garbho yad acyutam //
analyzed: veti id divaḥ januṣā kad cit ā śuciḥ jyok cit atti garbhaḥ yat acyutam
translated: He, from the birth of heaven, is somehow pure. He eats even the unborn child, for a long time.

original: mitraṃ na yaṃ sudhitam bhṛgavo dadhur vanaspatāv īḍyam ūrdhvaśociṣam /
analyzed: mitram na yam sudhitam bhṛgavaḥ vanaspatau īḍyam ūrdhva śociṣam
translated: Whom the Bhṛgus have established as a well-ordered friend, to be worshipped in the tree, with upward flames.

original: sa tvaṃ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhir mahayase divedive //
analyzed: sa tvam su prītaḥ vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhiḥ mahayase dive dive
translated: You, O wonderful one, being well pleased with Vītahavya, are glorified by the praises day by day.

original: sa tvaṃ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūr aryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam dakṣasya avṛkaḥ vṛdhaḥ bhūḥ aryaḥ parasya antarasya taruṣaḥ
translated: So be thou, O Daksha, the increaser and supporter of the Vr̥ikas, the foe of the most distant foe.

original: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣv ā chardir yaccha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ //
analyzed: rāyaḥ sūno sahasaḥ martyeṣu ā chardiḥ yaccha vītahavyāya saprathaḥ bharadvājāya saprathaḥ
translated: Give to the Maruts, O thou Son of Strength, the gift of wealth, give to the worshipper Bharadvâja the gift of wealth.

original: dyutānaṃ vo atithiṃ svarṇaram agniṃ hotāram manuṣaḥ svadhvaram /
analyzed: dyutānam vaḥ atithim svarṇaram agnim hotāram manuṣaḥ su adhvaram
translated: Your resplendent guest, your golden Agni, the Hotar, Manu's Priest, well skilled in sacrifice,

original: vipraṃ na dyukṣavacasaṃ suvṛktibhir havyavāham aratiṃ devam ṛñjase //
analyzed: vipram na dyukṣa vacasam suvṛktibhiḥ havyavāham aratim devam ṛñjase
translated: The Sage whose words are heavenly, with fair praises I seek, the bearer of oblations, the Priest, the God.

original: pāvakayā yaś citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā /
analyzed: pāvakayā yaḥ citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruce uṣasaḥ na bhānunā
translated: He who with purifying thought, with flame, hath shone on the earth with light as with the beams of dawn,

original: tūrvan na yāmann etaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ //
analyzed: tūrvan na yāman etaśasya nu raṇe ā yaḥ ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇaḥ ajaraḥ
translated: Like Etaṣa in his course, who, never satiate, never decaying, is fain for the food of men.

original: agnimagniṃ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyampriyaṃ vo atithiṃ gṛṇīṣaṇi /
analyzed: agnim agnim vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam priyam vaḥ atithim gṛṇīṣaṇi
translated: Serve ye with fuel Agni, serve with fuel Agni, seek ye to glorify your dear guest dear with every prayer.

original: upa vo gīrbhir amṛtaṃ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṃ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ //
analyzed: upa vaḥ gīrbhiḥ amṛtam vivāsata devaḥ deveṣu vanate hi vāryam devaḥ deveṣu vanate hi naḥ duvaḥ
translated: With songs invite the Immortal One to you: the God wins treasure for the Gods, the God wins worship for the Gods.

original: samiddham agniṃ samidhā girā gṛṇe śucim pāvakam puro adhvare dhruvam /
analyzed: samiddham agnim samidhā girā gṛṇe śucim pāvakam puras adhvare dhruvam
translated: With fuel I praise Agni the kindled One, the pure, the purifying One, the stedfast One, in front at sacrifice.

original: vipraṃ hotāram puruvāram adruhaṃ kaviṃ sumnair īmahe jātavedasam //
analyzed: vipram hotāram puru vāram adruham kavim sumnaiḥ īmahe jātavedasam
translated: The priest, the all-knower, the benevolent, the guileless, the sage, we implore with offerings.

original: tvāṃ dūtam agne amṛtaṃ yugeyuge havyavāhaṃ dadhire pāyum īḍyam /
analyzed: tvām dūtam agne amṛtam yuge yuge havyavāham dadhire pāyum īḍyam
translated: You, O Agni, the immortal messenger, the bearer of oblations, the protector, the one to be praised, they have made you the guardian in every age.

original: devāsaś ca martāsaś ca jāgṛviṃ vibhuṃ viśpatiṃ namasā ni ṣedire //
analyzed: devāsaḥ ca martāsaḥ ca jāgṛvim vibhum viśpatim namasā ni sedire
translated: The gods and mortals have settled with reverence the all-pervading lord of the people, the watchful one.

original: vibhūṣann agna ubhayāṃ anu vratā dūto devānāṃ rajasī sam īyase /
analyzed: vibhūṣan agne ubhayān anu vratā dūtaḥ devānām rajasī sam īyase
translated: Adorning both the ordinances, O Agni, as a messenger you move through the realms of the gods.

original: yat te dhītiṃ sumatim āvṛṇīmahe 'dha smā nas trivarūthaḥ śivo bhava //
analyzed: yat te dhītim sumatim āvṛṇīmahe sma naḥ tri varūthaḥ śivaḥ bhava
translated: When we choose your thought and favor, then be to us a protector with three shelters and auspicious.

original: taṃ supratīkaṃ sudṛśaṃ svañcam avidvāṃso viduṣṭaraṃ sapema /🔽sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyam agnir amṛteṣu vocat //
analyzed: tam su pratīkam sudṛśam svañcam avidvāṃsaḥ viduṣṭaram sapema  sa yakṣat viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyam agniḥ amṛteṣu vocat
translated: We, the unwise, desire to serve that one of beautiful form, beautiful appearance, and easy to approach, the more skillful.🔽He, knowing all the ways, having worshipped, has announced the offering to the immortals.

original: tam agne pāsy uta tam piparṣi yas ta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim /
analyzed: tam agne pāsi uta tam piparṣi yaḥ te ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim
translated: You, O Agni, protect him and nourish him who has come to you with a thought for the wise one, O hero.

original: yajñasya vā niśitiṃ voditiṃ vā tam it pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā //
analyzed: yajñasya vā niśitim vā uditim vā tam id pṛṇakṣi śavasā uta rāyā
translated: Whether it is the completion of the sacrifice or its rising, you fill him with power and wealth.

original: tvam agne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvann avadyāt /
analyzed: tvam agne vanuṣyataḥ ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvan avadyāt
translated: You, O Agni, protect the one who is to be favored; you, O victor, protect us from blame.

original: saṃ tvā dhvasmanvad abhy etu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī //
analyzed: sam tvā dhvasmanvat abhī etu pāthaḥ sam rayi spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī
translated: May the path that leads to prosperity and wealth, thousandfold, and is free from sorrow, come to thee.

original: agnir hotā gṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā gṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni is the Hotar, the lord of the house, the king; he knows all generations as the all-knower.

original: devānām uta yo martyānāṃ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatām ṛtāvā //
analyzed: devānām uta yaḥ martyānām yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatām ṛtāvā
translated: He who is best to be worshipped of the gods and of men, he, the most righteous, is the priest of the sacrificers.

original: agne yad adya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṃ hi yajvā /🔽ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yad bhūr havyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya //
analyzed: agne yat adya viśaḥ adhvarasya hotar pāvaka śoce veḥ tvam hi yajvā  ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yat bhūḥ havyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya
translated: O Agni, whatever today of the people's sacrifice, O Hotar, O purifier, thou dost attend to, for thou art the worshipper.🔽Thou dost worship with truth, when thou hast become great by power. Carry the offerings, O youngest, which are thine today.

original: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyo ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai /
analyzed: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyaḥ ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai
translated: The well-ordered rites have come to thee, O wise one. Let the two worlds seat thee to be worshipped.

original: avā no maghavan vājasātāv agne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema //
analyzed: avāḥ naḥ maghavan vājasātau agne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tava avasā tarema
translated: O bountiful one, help us to win strength. O Agni, may we all overcome the evils. May we overcome them by thy help.

original: agne viśvebhiḥ svanīka devair ūrṇāvantam prathamaḥ sīda yonim /
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ su anīka devaiḥ ūrṇāvantam prathamaḥ sīda yonim
translated: O Agni, with all the gods, O fair one, first sit in the wool-covered birthplace.

original: kulāyinaṃ ghṛtavantaṃ savitre yajñaṃ naya yajamānāya sādhu //🔽imam u tyam atharvavad agnim manthanti vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: kulāyinam ghṛtavantam savitre yajñam naya yajamānāya sādhu  imam u tyam atharva vat agnim manthanti vedhasaḥ
translated: Carry the nest-like, ghee-filled sacrifice to Savitar, to the sacrificer, well.🔽This Agni here, whom the wise ones churn out like a wheel,

original: yam aṅkūyantam ānayann amūraṃ śyāvyābhyaḥ //
analyzed: yam aṅkūyantam ānayan amūram śyāvyābhyaḥ
translated: whom they have brought, the unerring one, from the two dark ones.

original: janiṣvā devavītaye sarvatātā svastaye /
analyzed: janiṣva deva vītaye sarvatātā svastaye
translated: Be born for the feast of the gods, for all, for well-being.

original: ā devān vakṣy amṛtāṃ ṛtāvṛdho yajñaṃ deveṣu pispṛśaḥ //
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi amṛtān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ yajñam deveṣu pispṛśaḥ
translated: Carry the immortal gods who strengthen truth to the sacrifice, to the gods, to whom you belong.

original: vayam u tvā gṛhapate janānām agne akarma samidhā bṛhantam /
analyzed: vayam u tvā gṛhapate janānām agne akarma samidhā bṛhantam
translated: We, O Agni, the people's lord, with fuel, have served you, the great one, in our work.

original: asthūri no gārhapatyāni santu tigmena nas tejasā saṃ śiśādhi //
analyzed: asthūri naḥ gārhapatyāni santu tigmena naḥ tejasā sam śiśādhi
translated: Let our domestic rites be not burdensome to us. Sharpen us with your sharp splendor.

original: tvam agne yajñānāṃ hotā viśveṣāṃ hitaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne yajñānām hotā viśveṣām hitaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the priest of all sacrifices, appointed.

original: devebhir mānuṣe jane //
analyzed: devebhiḥ mānuṣe jane
translated: Among the gods and among the human people.

original: sa no mandrābhir adhvare jihvābhir yajā mahaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ mandrābhiḥ adhvare jihvābhiḥ yaja mahaḥ
translated: Therefore, with your sweet tongues, worship the great one at our sacrifice.

original: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca //
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: Carry the gods and worship them.

original: vetthā hi vedho adhvanaḥ pathaś ca devāñjasā /
analyzed: vettha hi vedhaḥ adhvanaḥ pathaḥ ca deva añjasā
translated: For you know the path and the way, O creator, to the gods quickly,

original: agne yajñeṣu sukrato //
analyzed: agne yajñeṣu sukrato
translated: O Agni, O you who are wise in sacrifice.

original: tvām īḷe adha dvitā bharato vājibhiḥ śunam /
analyzed: tvām īḍe adha dvitā bharataḥ vājibhiḥ śunam
translated: I praise you, O Agni, day after day, O Bharata, with the good horses,

original: īje yajñeṣu yajñiyam //
analyzed: īje yajñeṣu yajñiyam
translated: I have worshipped the one worthy of sacrifice in the sacrifices.

original: tvam imā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate /
analyzed: tvam imā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate
translated: You, O Agni, these boons to Divodasa, the presser of the Soma,

original: bharadvājāya dāśuṣe //
analyzed: bharadvājāya dāśuṣe
translated: To Bharadvaja, the giver.

original: tvaṃ dūto amartya ā vahā daivyaṃ janam /
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ amartyaḥ ā vaha daivyam janam
translated: You, O immortal messenger, bring the divine people,

original: śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim //🔽tvām agne svādhyo martāso devavītaye /
analyzed: śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim  tvām agne su ādhyaḥ martāsaḥ deva vītaye
translated: Listening to the good praise of the sage.🔽You, O Agni, the mortals with good thoughts, for the feast of the gods,

original: yajñeṣu devam īḷate //
analyzed: yajñeṣu devam īḍate
translated: Worship the god in the sacrifices.

original: tava pra yakṣi saṃdṛśam uta kratuṃ sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: tava pra yakṣi saṃdṛśam uta kratum sudānavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones will serve thy majesty and also thy power,

original: viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ //
analyzed: viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ
translated: All who delight in thee.

original: tvaṃ hotā manurhito vahnir āsā viduṣṭaraḥ /🔽agne yakṣi divo viśaḥ //
analyzed: tvam hotā manuḥ hitaḥ vahniḥ āsā viduṣṭaraḥ  agne yakṣi divaḥ viśaḥ
translated: Thou art the priest, O Manu's friend, the most excellent messenger of these.🔽O Agni, worship the people of heaven.

original: agna ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇāno havyadātaye /
analyzed: agne ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇānaḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Agni, come to the feast, being praised, to receive the oblation.

original: ni hotā satsi barhiṣi //🔽taṃ tvā samidbhir aṅgiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi /
analyzed: ni hotā satsi barhiṣi  tam tvā samidbhiḥ aṅgiraḥ ghṛtena vardhayāmasi
translated: Sit as Hotar on the strew.🔽O Angiras, we increase thee with fuel and ghee,

original: bṛhac chocā yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: bṛhat śoca yaviṣṭhya
translated: O thou of lofty flame, O thou most youthful.

original: sa naḥ pṛthu śravāyyam acchā deva vivāsasi /
analyzed: sa naḥ pṛthu śravāyyam acchā deva vivāsasi
translated: O God, thou shinest forth to us, to the wide-spread fame-deserving (worship),

original: bṛhad agne suvīryam //🔽tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā nir amanthata /
analyzed: bṛhat agne su vīryam  tvām agne puṣkarāt adhi atharvā niḥ amanthata
translated: O Agni, to lofty hero strength.🔽From the navel, O Agni, the Atharvan, Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan,

original: mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhnaḥ viśvasya vāghataḥ
translated: Rubbed thee forth, the head of every sacrificer.

original: tam u tvā dadhyaṅṅ ṛṣiḥ putra īdhe atharvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tam u tvā dadhyaṅ ṛṣiḥ putraḥ īdhe atharvaṇaḥ
translated: Thee, O Indra, the R̥ishi Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan,

original: vṛtrahaṇam purandaram //
analyzed: vṛtra haṇam purandaram
translated: The Vritra-slayer, the conqueror of forts, kindled.

original: tam u tvā pāthyo vṛṣā sam īdhe dasyuhantamam /
analyzed: tam u tvā pāthyaḥ vṛṣā sam īdhe dasyu hantamam
translated: Thee, O Indra, the bull Pathyâ kindled, best slayer of the Dasyus,

original: dhanañjayaṃ raṇeraṇe //
analyzed: dhanañjayam raṇeraṇe
translated: The winner of a thousand treasures in every fight.

original: ehy ū ṣu bravāṇi te 'gna itthetarā giraḥ /
analyzed: ehi u su bravāṇi te gne itthā itarāḥ giraḥ
translated: Come, I will speak to thee, O Agni, other songs than these,

original: ebhir vardhāsa indubhiḥ //
analyzed: ebhiḥ vardhāse indubhiḥ
translated: With these drops that strengthen thee.

original: yatra kva ca te mano dakṣaṃ dadhasa uttaram /
analyzed: yatra kva ca te manaḥ dakṣam dadhase uttaram
translated: Whithersoever thou hast placed thy mind, thy most exalted power,

original: tatrā sadaḥ kṛṇavase //
analyzed: tatra sadaḥ kṛṇavase
translated: There make thou us a dwelling-place.

original: nahi te pūrtam akṣipad bhuvan nemānāṃ vaso /
analyzed: nahi te pūrtam akṣipat bhuvat nemānām vaso
translated: For you have not cast away the fulfilment of these, O Vasu, nor of these people.

original: athā duvo vanavase //
analyzed: athā duvaḥ vanavase
translated: Now for the sake of service and dwelling.

original: āgnir agāmi bhārato vṛtrahā purucetanaḥ /
analyzed: ā agniḥ agāmi bhārataḥ vṛtra hā puru cetanaḥ
translated: Agni has come, the Indian, the slayer of Vrtra, the very wise one,

original: divodāsasya satpatiḥ //
analyzed: divodāsasya satpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the people of Divodasa.

original: sa hi viśvāti pārthivā rayiṃ dāśan mahitvanā /
analyzed: sa hi viśvā ati pārthivā rayim dāśat mahitvanā
translated: For he bestows on all earthly riches with his greatness,

original: vanvann avāto astṛtaḥ //
analyzed: vanvan a vātaḥ a stṛtaḥ
translated: Seeking, unhindered, unrestrained.

original: sa pratnavan navīyasāgne dyumnena saṃyatā /
analyzed: sa pratna vat navīyasā agne dyumnena saṃyatā
translated: He, like the ancient one, with the newer, O Agni, bound by glory,

original: bṛhat tatantha bhānunā //🔽pra vaḥ sakhāyo agnaye stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā /
analyzed: bṛhat tatantha bhānunā  pra vaḥ sakhāyaḥ agnaye stomam yajñam ca dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: Has stretched out the great light.🔽You friends, to Agni, with strength, the praise and the sacrifice,

original: arca gāya ca vedhase //
analyzed: arca gāya ca vedhase
translated: Worship, sing, and to the creator.

original: sa hi yo mānuṣā yugā sīdad dhotā kavikratuḥ /
analyzed: sa hi yaḥ mānuṣā yugā sīdat hotā kavi kratuḥ
translated: For he, the wise one, who has sat down in the human ages,

original: dūtaś ca havyavāhanaḥ //
analyzed: dūtaḥ ca havyavāhanaḥ
translated: The messenger and bearer of oblations.

original: tā rājānā śucivratādityān mārutaṃ gaṇam /
analyzed: tā rājānā śuci vratā ādityān mārutam gaṇam
translated: You two kings, of pure vows, the Adityas, the Marut host,

original: vaso yakṣīha rodasī //
analyzed: vaso yakṣi iha rodasī
translated: Vas, worship these two worlds.

original: vasvī te agne saṃdṛṣṭir iṣayate martyāya /
analyzed: vasvī te agne saṃdṛṣṭiḥ iṣayate martyāya
translated: Your vision, O Agni, is rich in food for the mortal man,

original: ūrjo napād amṛtasya //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt amṛtasya
translated: From the foot of the immortal strength.

original: kratvā dā astu śreṣṭho 'dya tvā vanvan surekṇāḥ /
analyzed: kratvā dāḥ astu śreṣṭhaḥ dya tvā vanvan surekṇāḥ
translated: By wisdom let him be the best today, seeking you, O you who find the gods well.

original: marta ānāśa suvṛktim //
analyzed: martaḥ ānāśa suvṛktim
translated: The mortal has obtained good praise.

original: te te agne tvotā iṣayanto viśvam āyuḥ /
analyzed: te te agne tvotāḥ iṣayantaḥ viśvam āyuḥ
translated: Those of yours, O Agni, who are invoked by you, seeking all life,

original: taranto aryo arātīr vanvanto aryo arātīḥ //
analyzed: tarantaḥ aryaḥ arātīḥ vanvantaḥ aryaḥ arātīḥ
translated: Crossing over the enemies' hostilities, winning over the enemies' hostilities.

original: agnis tigmena śociṣā yāsad viśvaṃ ny atriṇam /
analyzed: agniḥ tigmena śociṣā yāsat viśvam ni atriṇam
translated: Agni, with his sharp flame, has sat down to burn up all the obstructors.

original: agnir no vanate rayim //
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ vanate rayim
translated: Agni will win wealth for us.

original: suvīraṃ rayim ā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: su vīram rayim ā bhara jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: Bring us wealth with good heroes, O all-active Jatavedas.

original: jahi rakṣāṃsi sukrato //
analyzed: jahi rakṣāṃsi su krato
translated: Destroy the Raksases, O most wise one.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pāhy aṃhaso jātavedo aghāyataḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ jātavedaḥ aghāyataḥ
translated: Protect us, O Jâtavedas, from distress, O thou who art free from sin.

original: rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇas kave //
analyzed: rakṣa naḥ brahmaṇaḥ kave
translated: Guard our prayer, O thou who art skilled in prayer.

original: yo no agne dureva ā marto vadhāya dāśati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agne durevaḥ ā martaḥ vadhāya dāśati
translated: The mortal who, O Agni, aims at us from afar to slay us with his weapon,

original: tasmān naḥ pāhy aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: tasmāt naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ
translated: From him do thou deliver us, O thou who art free from sin.

original: tvaṃ taṃ deva jihvayā pari bādhasva duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: tvam tam deva jihvayā pari bādhasva duṣkṛtam
translated: O God, with thy tongue do thou torment that evildoer,

original: marto yo no jighāṃsati //🔽bharadvājāya saprathaḥ śarma yaccha sahantya /🔽agne vareṇyaṃ vasu //
analyzed: martaḥ yaḥ naḥ jighāṃsati  bharadvājāya saprathaḥ śarma yaccha sahantya  agne vareṇyam vasu
translated: The mortal who would injure us.🔽O Agni, grant shelter to Bharadvaja, O thou who art mighty, O thou who art to be worshipped.🔽O Agni, the most excellent treasure.

original: agnir vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyur vipanyayā /
analyzed: agniḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanat draviṇasyuḥ vipanyayā
translated: Agni, the seeker of wealth, with his flame, shall smite down the Vr̥itras.

original: samiddhaḥ śukra āhutaḥ //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ śukraḥ āhutaḥ
translated: Enkindled, bright, offered with the sacrificial oil.

original: garbhe mātuḥ pituṣ pitā vididyutāno akṣare /
analyzed: garbhe mātuḥ pituḥ pitā vididyutānaḥ akṣare
translated: The father of the father in the mother's womb, shining in the imperishable one,

original: sīdann ṛtasya yonim ā //
analyzed: sīdan ṛtasya yonim ā
translated: Sits down in the place of sacrifice.

original: brahma prajāvad ā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: brahma prajāvat ā bhara jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: Bring, O all-active Jatavedas, the prayer that is rich in offspring.

original: agne yad dīdayad divi //🔽upa tvā raṇvasaṃdṛśam prayasvantaḥ sahaskṛta /
analyzed: agne yat dīdayat divi  upa tvā raṇva saṃdṛśam prayasvantaḥ sahaskṛta
translated: O Agni, that which shines in the sky.🔽We have sent forth to thee, O thou who art to be worshipped, O thou who art to be praised, O Agni, our songs,

original: agne sasṛjmahe giraḥ //
analyzed: agne sasṛjmahe giraḥ
translated: O thou who art to be worshipped, O thou who art to be praised, O Agni, our songs,🔽O thou who art to be worshipped, O thou who art to be praised, O Agni, our songs,

original: upa cchāyām iva ghṛṇer aganma śarma te vayam /
analyzed: upa chāyām iva ghṛṇeḥ aganma śarma te vayam
translated: We have come to thy protection, O Agni, as to the shade from heat,

original: agne hiraṇyasaṃdṛśaḥ //
analyzed: agne hiraṇya saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: O thou who art like gold to look on.

original: ya ugra iva śaryahā tigmaśṛṅgo na vaṃsagaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ iva śaryahā tigma śṛṅgaḥ na vaṃsagaḥ
translated: He who, like a fierce archer, with a sharp point, not bent,

original: agne puro rurojitha //
analyzed: agne puraḥ rurojitha
translated: O Agni, hast rent asunder the forts.

original: ā yaṃ haste na khādinaṃ śiśuṃ jātaṃ na bibhrati /
analyzed: ā yam haste na khādinam śiśum jātam na bibhrati
translated: Whom, like a child newly born, they bear in the hand,

original: viśām agniṃ svadhvaram //
analyzed: viśām agnim su adhvaram
translated: Agni, the pure of the people.

original: pra devaṃ devavītaye bharatā vasuvittamam /
analyzed: pra devam deva vītaye bharata vasu vittamam
translated: Bring the God, most liberal of treasures, to the feast of the Gods.

original: ā sve yonau ni ṣīdatu //
analyzed: ā sve yonau ni sīdatu
translated: Let him sit down in his own birthplace.

original: ā jātaṃ jātavedasi priyaṃ śiśītātithim /
analyzed: ā jātam jātavedasi priyam śiśīta atithim
translated: Let him sharpen the dear guest, born in the flame of the all-knower,

original: syona ā gṛhapatim //
analyzed: syone ā gṛhapatim
translated: The kindly one, the lord of the house.

original: agne yukṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ /
analyzed: agne yukṣvā hi ye tava āśvāsaḥ deva sādhavaḥ
translated: O Agni, yoke, O God, those good horses of thine

original: araṃ vahanti manyave //
analyzed: aram vahanti manyave
translated: Which carry thee to the thought.

original: acchā no yāhy ā vahābhi prayāṃsi vītaye /
analyzed: acchā naḥ yāhi ā vaha abhi prayāṃsi vītaye
translated: Come to us, bring hitherward the thoughts to the feast,

original: ā devān somapītaye //
analyzed: ā devān soma pītaye
translated: The Gods to drink the Soma.

original: ud agne bhārata dyumad ajasreṇa davidyutat /
analyzed: ud agne bhārata dyumat ajasreṇa davidyutat
translated: Rise up, O Agni, O Bhārata, shine forth with thy ceaseless light,

original: śocā vi bhāhy ajara //
analyzed: vi bhāhi ajara
translated: Blaze, O undecaying one.

original: vītī yo devam marto duvasyed agnim īḷītādhvare haviṣmān /
analyzed: vītī yaḥ devam martaḥ duvasyet agnim īḍīta adhvare haviṣmān
translated: The mortal man who would serve the God, Agni, should worship him at the sacrifice with oblations,

original: hotāraṃ satyayajaṃ rodasyor uttānahasto namasā vivāset //
analyzed: hotāram satya yajam rodasyoḥ uttāna hastaḥ namasā vivāset
translated: The priest, the true offerer to the two worlds, should serve him with uplifted hands and reverence.

original: ā te agna ṛcā havir hṛdā taṣṭam bharāmasi /
analyzed: ā te agne ṛcā haviḥ hṛdā taṣṭam bharāmasi
translated: We bring to thee, O Agni, oblation with the R̥ich, fashioned in the heart,

original: te te bhavantūkṣaṇa ṛṣabhāso vaśā uta //
analyzed: te te bhavantu ukṣaṇaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ vaśāḥ uta
translated: May they all be bulls and heifers for you.

original: agniṃ devāso agriyam indhate vṛtrahantamam /
analyzed: agnim devāsaḥ agriyam indhate vṛtra hantamam
translated: The gods kindle Agni, the eldest, the best slayer of Vrtra,

original: yenā vasūny ābhṛtā tṛḷhā rakṣāṃsi vājinā //
analyzed: yena vasūni ābhṛtā tṛḷhā rakṣāṃsi vājinā
translated: By whom the treasures are brought, the greedy demons are destroyed by his strength.

original: pibā somam abhi yam ugra tarda ūrvaṃ gavyam mahi gṛṇāna indra /
analyzed: pibā somam abhi yam ugra tardaḥ ūrvam gavyam mahi gṛṇānaḥ indra
translated: Drink the Soma, O mighty one, whom, O fierce one, they praise, the great udder full of milk, O Indra,

original: vi yo dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣo vajrahasta viśvā vṛtram amitriyā śavobhiḥ //
analyzed: vi yaḥ dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣaḥ vajrahasta viśvā vṛtram amitriyā śavobhiḥ
translated: You who, O daring one, will slay with your thunderbolt, O you who have all the powers, with your might, O you who have all the powers, with your might,

original: sa īm pāhi ya ṛjīṣī tarutro yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabho yo matīnām /
analyzed: saḥ īm pāhi yaḥ ṛjīṣī tarutraḥ yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabhaḥ yaḥ matīnām
translated: You who are the protector, the conqueror, the one with the beautiful forehead, the bull of the hymns,

original: yo gotrabhid vajrabhṛd yo hariṣṭhāḥ sa indra citrāṃ abhi tṛndhi vājān //
analyzed: yaḥ gotrabhid vajrabhṛt yaḥ hariṣṭhāḥ saḥ indra citrān abhi tṛndhi vājān
translated: You who break the cowpens, who hold the thunderbolt, who are the most beautiful, O Indra, extend those wonderful powers of yours.

original: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvota gīrbhiḥ /
analyzed: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasva uta gīrbhiḥ
translated: Thus protect, as before, let him delight you, listen to the prayer and prosper through the songs.

original: āviḥ sūryaṃ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūṃr abhi gā indra tṛndhi //
analyzed: āvis sūryam kṛṇuhi pīpihi iṣaḥ jahi śatrūṃr abhi gāḥ indra tṛndhi
translated: Make the sun visible, increase the light, slay the enemies, O Indra, extend the cattle.

original: te tvā madā bṛhad indra svadhāva ime pītā ukṣayanta dyumantam /
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ bṛhat indra svadhāvas ime pītāḥ ukṣayanta dyumantam
translated: These intoxicating drinks, O Indra, who art mighty by nature, these libations make you, the glorious one, swell.

original: mahām anūnaṃ tavasaṃ vibhūtim matsarāso jarhṛṣanta prasāham //
analyzed: mahām anūnam tavasam vibhūtim matsarāsaḥ jarhṛṣanta prasāham
translated: The juices make you, the great one, the unlimited one, the powerful one, the all-pervading one, the impetuous one, rejoice.

original: yebhiḥ sūryam uṣasam mandasāno 'vāsayo 'pa dṛḷhāni dardrat /
analyzed: yebhiḥ sūryam uṣasam mandasānaḥ vāsaya u pa dṛḷhāni dardrat
translated: With which, rejoicing, thou didst open the sun and the dawn, and didst burst asunder the firm doors.

original: mahām adrim pari gā indra santaṃ nutthā acyutaṃ sadasas pari svāt //
analyzed: mahām adrim pari gāḥ indra santam nutthāḥ acyutam sadasaḥ pari svāt
translated: Thou didst shake the great mountain, O Indra, from its seat, from its own abode, O thou that art not to be shaken.

original: tava kratvā tava tad daṃsanābhir āmāsu pakvaṃ śacyā ni dīdhaḥ /🔽aurṇor dura usriyābhyo vi dṛḷhod ūrvād gā asṛjo aṅgirasvān //
analyzed: tava kratvā tava tat daṃsanābhiḥ āmāsu pakvam śacyā ni  aurṇoḥ duraḥ usriyābhyaḥ vi dṛḍhā ud ūrvāt gāḥ asṛjaḥ aṅgirasvān
translated: By thy wisdom, by thy splendour, O thou of mighty power, thou didst set in motion the ripe (food) in the raw (food), and didst open it.🔽Thou didst burst open the stone for the sake of the sheep, and didst let loose the cows from the stall, O thou of the power of Angiras.

original: paprātha kṣām mahi daṃso vy urvīm upa dyām ṛṣvo bṛhad indra stabhāyaḥ /
analyzed: paprātha kṣām mahi daṃsaḥ vi urvīm upa dyām ṛṣvaḥ bṛhat indra stabhāyaḥ
translated: Thou hast filled the earth with thy mighty power, and hast extended it to the broad atmosphere. Thou, O lofty Indra, hast propped the sky.

original: adhārayo rodasī devaputre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya //
analyzed: adhārayaḥ rodasī deva putre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya
