translated: Thou hast supported the two heavenly worlds, the ancient, the young mothers of holy order.

original: adha tvā viśve pura indra devā ekaṃ tavasaṃ dadhire bharāya /
analyzed: adha tvā viśve puras indra devāḥ ekam tavasam dadhire bharāya
translated: Then all the gods, O Indra, have made thee the one supporter to bear (the world).

original: adevo yad abhy auhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇata indram atra //
analyzed: adevaḥ yat abhī auhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇate indram atra
translated: When thou, the godless, didst attack the gods, then they chose Indra, the self-dependent one, here (to help them).

original: adha dyauś cit te apa sā nu vajrād dvitānamad bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ /
analyzed: adha dyauḥ cit te apa sā nu vajrāt dvitā anamat bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ
translated: Then even the heaven was afraid of thy thunderbolt, and trembled in two places from the fear of thy own wrath.

original: ahiṃ yad indro abhy ohasānaṃ ni cid viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna //
analyzed: ahim yat indraḥ abhī ohasānam ni cit viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna
translated: When thou didst attack Ahi, O Indra, who was rejoicing, then the all-life-supporting one struck him down, as he lay.

original: adha tvaṣṭā te maha ugra vajraṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ vavṛtac chatāśrim /
analyzed: adha tvaṣṭā te mahaḥ ugra vajram sahasra bhṛṣṭim vavṛtat śata aśrim
translated: Then Tvastr fashioned for thee, O mighty and fierce one, a thunderbolt with a thousand edges and a hundred points.

original: nikāmam aramaṇasaṃ yena navantam ahiṃ sam piṇag ṛjīṣin //
analyzed: nikāmam aramaṇasam yena navantam ahim sam piṇak ṛjīṣin
translated: By which, O thou of tawny steeds, thou didst crush the serpent who was swelling to his fill.

original: vardhān yaṃ viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacac chatam mahiṣāṃ indra tubhyam /
analyzed: vardhān yam viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacat śatam mahiṣān indra tubhyam
translated: Whom the All-Gods of one accord increase, and cook a hundred buffaloes for thee, O Indra.

original: pūṣā viṣṇus trīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtrahaṇam madiram aṃśum asmai //
analyzed: pūṣā viṣṇuḥ trīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtra haṇam madiram aṃśum asmai
translated: Pūṣan and Viṣṇu, running to the three lakes, have brought the intoxicating stalk to him, the Vṛtra-slayer.

original: ā kṣodo mahi vṛtaṃ nadīnām pariṣṭhitam asṛja ūrmim apām /
analyzed: ā kṣodaḥ mahi vṛtam nadīnām pariṣṭhitam asṛjaḥ ūrmim apām
translated: The great swelling of the waters, the flood of the rivers, the wave of the waters, he hath set in motion.

original: tāsām anu pravata indra panthām prārdayo nīcīr apasaḥ samudram //
analyzed: tāsām anu pravataḥ indra panthām prārdayaḥ nīcīḥ apasaḥ samudram
translated: Along the path of those, O Indra, thou hast forced the low-lying waters to the ocean.

original: evā tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsam indram mahām ugram ajuryaṃ sahodām /
analyzed: eva tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsam indram mahām ugram ajuryam sahaḥ dām
translated: Thus all these have made Indra, the mighty, the terrible, the undecaying, the strong, the bountiful.

original: suvīraṃ tvā svāyudhaṃ suvajram ā brahma navyam avase vavṛtyāt //
analyzed: su vīram tvā su āyudham su vajram ā brahma navyam avase vavṛtyāt
translated: May the new prayer turn to thee, O thou who hast brave heroes, who hast good weapons, who hast a good thunderbolt, for help.

original: sa no vājāya śravasa iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumata indra viprān /
analyzed: sa naḥ vājāya śravase iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumataḥ indra viprān
translated: Grant us, O Indra, for strength, for glory, for food, for wealth, O thou who hast the lightning, the princes.

original: bharadvāje nṛvata indra sūrīn divi ca smaidhi pārye na indra //
analyzed: bharadvāje nṛvataḥ indra sūrīn divi ca smā edhi pārye naḥ indra
translated: Be thou, O Indra, in the Bharadvājas' battles, and in the last fight, O Indra, in heaven.

original: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Thus may we win the strength which the gods favour. May we rejoice a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: tam u ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvann avātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ /
analyzed: tam u stuhi yaḥ abhibhūti ojāḥ vanvan a vātaḥ puruhūtaḥ indraḥ
translated: Praise him whose strength is all-surpassing, who, unvanquished, much-invoked, wins booty, Indra.

original: aṣāḷham ugraṃ sahamānam ābhir gīrbhir vardha vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām //🔽sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumāṃ ṛjīṣī /
analyzed: aṣāḷham ugram sahamānam ābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ vardha vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām  sa yudhmaḥ satvā khaja kṛt samadvā tuvi mrakṣaḥ nadanumān ṛjīṣī
translated: He is the warrior, the hero, the destroyer of forts, the conqueror of many, the mighty, the impetuous,

original: bṛhadreṇuś cyavano mānuṣīṇām ekaḥ kṛṣṭīnām abhavat sahāvā //
analyzed: bṛhat reṇuḥ cyavanaḥ mānuṣīṇām ekaḥ kṛṣṭīnām abhavat sahāvā
translated: The one who shakes the dust of men, the unconquerable, has become the helper of the people.

original: tvaṃ ha nu tyad adamāyo dasyūṃr ekaḥ kṛṣṭīr avanor āryāya /
analyzed: tvam ha nu tyad adamāyaḥ dasyūṃr ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ avanoḥ āryāya
translated: You alone, for the Ārya, destroyed the Dasyus, the enemies, and gave the people to the plowman.

original: asti svin nu vīryaṃ tat ta indra na svid asti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ //
analyzed: asti svid nu vīryam tat te indra na svid asti tat ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ
translated: Is there such manly strength in you, O Indra? Is there such strength? Tell us in due season.

original: sad id dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatas turasya /
analyzed: sat id hi te tuvi jātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turataḥ turasya
translated: I think that the strength of you, the greatly born, is the most enduring of the enduring, the swiftest of the swift.

original: ugram ugrasya tavasas tavīyo 'radhrasya radhraturo babhūva //🔽tan naḥ pratnaṃ sakhyam astu yuṣme itthā vadadbhir valam aṅgirobhiḥ /
analyzed: ugram ugrasya tavasaḥ tavīyaḥ radhrasya radhraturaḥ babhūva  tat naḥ pratnam sakhyam astu yuṣme itthā vadadbhiḥ valam aṅgirobhiḥ
translated: The stronger of the strong, the mighty, the most impetuous of the impetuous, the conqueror of the weak, has become the conqueror of the weak.🔽Let that ancient friendship be with you, with those who speak thus, with the Angiras, with the strong.

original: hann acyutacyud dasmeṣayantam ṛṇoḥ puro vi duro asya viśvāḥ //🔽sa hi dhībhir havyo asty ugra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye /
analyzed: han acyuta cyut dasma iṣayantam ṛṇoḥ puraḥ vi duraḥ asya viśvāḥ  sa hi dhībhiḥ havyaḥ asti ugraḥ īśāna kṛt mahati vṛtratūrye
translated: He who shakes the immovable, the moving, the one who destroys the forts of the enemy, has overcome all his enemies.🔽For he is to be worshipped with thoughts, the strong one, the lord, in the great battle against Vṛtra.

original: sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu //
analyzed: sa toka sātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyaḥ abhavat samatsu
translated: He, the wielder of the thunderbolt, has become the protector of offspring, of the son, the one who spreads out in the battles.

original: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇām amartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre /
analyzed: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇām amartyena nāmnā ati pra sarsre
translated: He, with his might, surpasses the generations of men with his immortal name.

original: sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ //
analyzed: sa dyumnena sa śavasā uta rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ
translated: With glory, with wealth, and with power, he, the best of men, is equal (to his foes).

original: sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca /
analyzed: sa yaḥ na muhe na mithū bhūt sumantu nāmā cumurim dhunim ca
translated: He who was not a false or fickle friend to the people, the one named Sumantu, crushed Chumuri and Dhuni,

original: vṛṇak pipruṃ śambaraṃ śuṣṇam indraḥ purāṃ cyautnāya śayathāya nū cit //
analyzed: vṛṇak piprum śambaram śuṣṇam indraḥ purām cyautnāya śayathāya nu cit
translated: Indra crushed Pipru, Shambara, and Shushna, to overthrow their forts, and never failed.

original: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya ratham indra tiṣṭha /
analyzed: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtra hatyāya ratham indra tiṣṭha
translated: Mount your chariot, O Indra, with your swift and bountiful strength, to slay Vrtra.

original: dhiṣva vajraṃ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ //
analyzed: dhiṣva vajram haste ā dakṣiṇatrā abhi pra manda puru datra māyāḥ
translated: Take up your thunderbolt in your right hand, and crush the magic arts, O you who give much.

original: agnir na śuṣkaṃ vanam indra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣy aśanir na bhīmā /
analyzed: agniḥ na śuṣkam vanam indra hetī rakṣaḥ ni dhakṣi aśaniḥ na bhīmā
translated: Like Agni to dry wood, O Indra, with your weapon, burn up the demon, like a terrible thunderbolt.

original: gambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayac ca //
analyzed: ṛṣvayā yaḥ ruroja adhvānayat duritā dambhayat ca
translated: With your deep and lofty voice, you who have shattered, have brought down the obstacles and have destroyed them.

original: ā sahasram pathibhir indra rāyā tuvidyumna tuvivājebhir arvāk /🔽yāhi sūno sahaso yasya nū cid adeva īśe puruhūta yotoḥ //
analyzed: ā sahasram pathibhiḥ indra rāyā tuvi dyumna tuvi vājebhiḥ arvāk  yāhi sūno sahasaḥ yasya nu cit a devaḥ īśe puruhūta yotoḥ
translated: Come, O Indra, with a thousand paths, with wealth, with great splendor, with great booty, to us.🔽Come, O son of strength, to whom no god, O much-invoked one, is master of the sacrifice.

original: pra tuvidyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣver divo rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: pra tuvi dyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ divaḥ rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The greatness of the one with great splendor, the mighty one, is praised in heaven and on earth.

original: nāsya śatrur na pratimānam asti na pratiṣṭhiḥ purumāyasya sahyoḥ //
analyzed: na asya śatruḥ na pratimānam asti na pratiṣṭhiḥ puru māyasya sahyoḥ
translated: He has no foe, no rival, no support, no one to withstand the mighty one in the two Sahas.

original: pra tat te adyā karaṇaṃ kṛtam bhūt kutsaṃ yad āyum atithigvam asmai /
analyzed: pra tat te adyā karaṇam kṛtam bhūt kutsam yat āyum atithigvam asmai
translated: That deed of thine, O Indra, hath been done this day, when thou gavest Kutsa, Âyu, Âtithigva,

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśā abhi kṣām ut tūrvayāṇaṃ dhṛṣatā ninetha //
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāḥ abhi kṣām ud tūrvayāṇam dhṛṣatā ninetha
translated: And didst slay many thousands in the land, and boldly broughtest back the chariot-borne.

original: anu tvāhighne adha deva devā madan viśve kavitamaṃ kavīnām /
analyzed: anu tvā ahi ghne adha deva devāḥ madan viśve kavitamam kavīnām
translated: After thee, O God, as slayer of the foe, all the Gods rejoice, most wise of all the wise,

original: karo yatra varivo bādhitāya dive janāya tanve gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: karaḥ yatra varivaḥ bādhitāya dive janāya tanve gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Where thou, O bountiful one, givest room to the afflicted, to the people, to the sky, to the body, to the singer.

original: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat ta ojo 'martyā jihata indra devāḥ /
analyzed: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat te ojaḥ martyāḥ jihate indra devāḥ
translated: After that strength of thine, O immortal Indra, the Gods, Heaven and Earth, strive to win.

original: kṛṣvā kṛtno akṛtaṃ yat te asty ukthaṃ navīyo janayasva yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: kṛṣva kṛtno a kṛtam yat te asti uktham navīyaḥ janayasva yajñaiḥ
translated: Do thou, O thou who art to be made, make what thou hast to be made, generate by sacrifices a new hymn.

original: mahāṃ indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ /
analyzed: mahān indraḥ nṛ vat ā carṣaṇi prāḥ uta dvibarhāḥ aminaḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: Great is Indra, like a man, the leader of the people, and with his twofold strength is not to be overcome.

original: asmadryag vāvṛdhe vīryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt //
analyzed: asmadryak vāvṛdhe vīryāya uruḥ pṛthuḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: He hath grown mighty for our strength, wide, broad, well-made by the makers.

original: indram eva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhād bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṃ yuvānam /
analyzed: indram eva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhāt bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram yuvānam
translated: The thought hath nourished Indra for his help, the mighty, lofty, undecaying, youthful one,

original: aṣāḷhena śavasā śūśuvāṃsaṃ sadyaś cid yo vāvṛdhe asāmi //
analyzed: a ṣāḍhena śavasā śūśuvāṃsam sadyas cit yaḥ vāvṛdhe asāmi
translated: The self-strong, rejoicing in his strength, who in a moment hath grown great, and is not to be vanquished.

original: pṛthū karasnā bahulā gabhastī asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi /🔽yūtheva paśvaḥ paśupā damūnā asmāṃ indrābhy ā vavṛtsvājau //
analyzed: pṛthū karasnā bahulā gabhastī asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi  yūthā iva paśvaḥ paśu pāḥ damūnāḥ asmān indra abhi ā vavṛtsva ājau
translated: Make broad thy arms, extend thy many rays, and measure out glories for us.🔽Like a herdsman, O lord of cattle, dwelling in our house, turn thou unto us, O Indra, in the fight.

original: taṃ va indraṃ catinam asya śākair iha nūnaṃ vājayanto huvema /
analyzed: tam vaḥ indram catinam asya śākaiḥ iha nūnam vājayantaḥ huvema
translated: We will call upon that Indra, the bountiful, here, now, with our praises, to give us strength,

original: yathā cit pūrve jaritāra āsur anedyā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: yathā cit pūrve jaritāraḥ āsuḥ anedyāḥ anavadyāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: That he may be to us as he was to the singers of old, free from all sin, from all reproach, and all misfortune.

original: dhṛtavrato dhanadāḥ somavṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ /
analyzed: dhṛtavrataḥ dhana dāḥ soma vṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ
translated: He who is firm in his vow, who gives wealth, who waxes strong through Soma, he who is the great lord of all good things,

original: saṃ jagmire pathyā rāyo asmin samudre na sindhavo yādamānāḥ //
analyzed: sam jagmire pathyāḥ rāyaḥ asmin samudre na sindhavaḥ yādamānāḥ
translated: The paths of wealth have come together in this one, as the rivers, striving, come together in the sea.

original: śaviṣṭhaṃ na ā bhara śūra śava ojiṣṭham ojo abhibhūta ugram /
analyzed: śaviṣṭham naḥ ā bhara śūra śavaḥ ojiṣṭham ojaḥ abhibhūte ugram
translated: Bring us, O Indra, the most manly strength, O hero, the most powerful power, that overcomes, the most mighty.

original: viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇām asmabhyaṃ dā harivo mādayadhyai //
analyzed: viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇām asmabhyam dāḥ harivas mādayadhyai
translated: All the glories and manly powers of men, O giver of good things, bestow on us, that we may rejoice.

original: yas te madaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ amṛdhra indra taṃ na ā bhara śūśuvāṃsam /
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ pṛtanāṣāh amṛdhraḥ indra tam naḥ ā bhara śūśuvāṃsam
translated: That gladdening strength of thine, O Indra, which is irresistible in battle, bring thou to us, O thou who art to be praised.

original: yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṃsīmahi jigīvāṃsas tvotāḥ //
analyzed: yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṃsīmahi jigīvāṃsaḥ tvotāḥ
translated: Wherewith we may bethink us, urged on by thee, of the winning of children and offspring.

original: ā no bhara vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indra dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ sudakṣam /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indra dhana spṛtam śūśuvāṃsam su dakṣam
translated: Bring us, O Indra, the manly strength that is most powerful, that wins booty, that is most glorious, and most skilful.

original: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tavotibhir uta jāmīṃr ajāmīn //
analyzed: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tava ūtibhiḥ uta jāmīn ajāmīn
translated: By whom thou breakest the clans in battles, and the kinsmen who are not kinsmen.

original: ā te śuṣmo vṛṣabha etu paścād ottarād adharād ā purastāt /
analyzed: ā te śuṣmaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ etu paścāt ā uttarāt adharāt ā purastāt
translated: Let thy strength come to thee from the west, O bull, from the north, from the south, from the east.

original: ā viśvato abhi sam etv arvāṅ indra dyumnaṃ svarvad dhehy asme //
analyzed: ā viśvatas abhi sam etu arvāṅ indra dyumnam svarvat dhehi asme
translated: From all sides let it come to thee from near. Bring us, O Indra, glory with the heaven.

original: nṛvat ta indra nṛtamābhir ūtī vaṃsīmahi vāmaṃ śromatebhiḥ /
analyzed: nṛvat te indra nṛtamābhiḥ ūtī vaṃsīmahi vāmam śromatebhiḥ
translated: Like a hero, O Indra, with thy most manly aids, we will win the good with our most famous deeds.

original: īkṣe hi vasva ubhayasya rājan dhā ratnam mahi sthūram bṛhantam //
analyzed: īkṣe hi vasvaḥ ubhayasya rājan dhāḥ ratnam mahi sthūram bṛhantam
translated: For I look on the wealth of both, O king. Grant the treasure that is great, vast, and high.

original: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānam akavāriṃ divyaṃ śāsam indram /🔽viśvāsāham avase nūtanāyograṃ sahodām iha taṃ huvema //
analyzed: marutvantam vṛṣabham vāvṛdhānam a kavārim divyam śāsam indram  viśvāsāham avase nūtanāya ugram sahaḥ dām iha tam huvema
translated: The Marut-attended bull, the waxing, the irresistible, the heavenly, the ruling Indra,🔽The all-conquering, the new, we will invoke him here for help, the one whose strength is mighty.

original: janaṃ vajrin mahi cin manyamānam ebhyo nṛbhyo randhayā yeṣv asmi /🔽adhā hi tvā pṛthivyāṃ śūrasātau havāmahe tanaye goṣv apsu //🔽vayaṃ ta ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥśatror uttara it syāma /
analyzed: janam vajrin mahi cit manyamānam ebhyaḥ nṛbhyaḥ randhaya yeṣu asmi  adhā hi tvā pṛthivyām śūrasātau havāmahe tanaye goṣu apsu  vayam te ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥ śatroḥ uttare id syāma
translated: The people, O wielder of the thunderbolt, who think even of thee, grant them to these men, in whom I am.🔽For now we call thee, O hero, on the earth in the winning of booty, in the offspring, in the cattle, in the waters.🔽We, O much-invoked one, with these friends of thine, may we be ever victorious over each foe.

original: ghnanto vṛtrāṇy ubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatā tvotāḥ //
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi ubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatā tvotāḥ
translated: Slaying the Vr̥itras on both sides, O hero, may we rejoice in great wealth, exalted by thee.

original: dyaur na ya indrābhi bhūmāryas tasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān /
analyzed: dyauḥ na yaḥ indra abhi bhūmā āryaḥ tasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān
translated: Like the sky, O Indra, the noble wealth which stands for the people in battles through strength,

original: taṃ naḥ sahasrabharam urvarāsāṃ daddhi sūno sahaso vṛtraturam //
analyzed: tam naḥ sahasra bharam urvarā sām daddhi sūno sahasaḥ vṛtra turam
translated: Give us that, O son of strength, which brings a thousand, which conquers Vritra, for the fields.

original: divo na tubhyam anv indra satrāsuryaṃ devebhir dhāyi viśvam /
analyzed: divaḥ na tubhyam anu indra satrā asuryam devebhiḥ dhāyi viśvam
translated: O Indra, all this world, O Indra, is for you, in the battles, in the contests, along with the gods.

original: ahiṃ yad vṛtram apo vavrivāṃsaṃ hann ṛjīṣin viṣṇunā sacānaḥ //
analyzed: ahim yat vṛtram apaḥ vavrivāṃsam han ṛjīṣin viṣṇunā sacānaḥ
translated: When you, O powerful one, in company with Vishnu, slew the dragon Vritra, who was about to cover the waters,

original: tūrvann ojīyān tavasas tavīyān kṛtabrahmendro vṛddhamahāḥ /
analyzed: tūrvan ojīyān tavasaḥ tavīyān kṛta brahmā indraḥ vṛddha mahāḥ
translated: You, O Indra, who are stronger than the strong, who are more powerful than the powerful, who have accomplished the prayer, who are great and mighty,

original: rājābhavan madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsāṃ yat purāṃ dartnum āvat //
analyzed: rājā abhavat madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsām yat purām dartnum āvat
translated: Have become the king of sweet Soma juice, because you broke through all the forts.

original: śatair apadran paṇaya indrātra daśoṇaye kavaye 'rkasātau /
analyzed: śataiḥ apadran paṇayaḥ indra atra daśoṇaye kavaye rka sātau
translated: The Panis fled in hundreds, O Indra, here, for the sake of the ten-ox, for the sake of the wise one, in the battle for the Arka.

original: vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasyāśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvo nārirecīt kiṃ cana pra //🔽maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ /
analyzed: vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya aśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvaḥ na arirecīt kim cana pra  mahaḥ druhaḥ apa viśva āyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ
translated: The evil-wishing Shushṇa's wiles, the drinker, did not escape at all, as if they were killed.🔽The great, all-life-giving protection was given to the enemies, when Shushṇa was struck down by the fall of the thunderbolt.

original: uru ṣa sarathaṃ sārathaye kar indraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau //
analyzed: uru sa sa ratham sārathaye kaḥ indraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau
translated: You made the chariot-path wide for the charioteer, O Indra, in the battle for the sun's light.

original: pra śyeno na madiram aṃśum asmai śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan /
analyzed: pra śyenaḥ na madiram aṃśum asmai śiraḥ dāsasya namuceḥ mathāyan
translated: The hawk, as if crushing the intoxicating stalk for him, the head of Namuci the Dāsa,

original: prāvan namīṃ sāpyaṃ sasantam pṛṇag rāyā sam iṣā saṃ svasti //
analyzed: prāvat namīm sāpyam sasantam pṛṇak rāyā sam iṣā sam svasti
translated: He has obtained the moist one, the sapful one, and has filled the full one with wealth, food, and well-being.

original: vi pipror ahimāyasya dṛḷhāḥ puro vajriñ chavasā na dardaḥ /
analyzed: vi piproḥ ahi māyasya dṛḍhāḥ puraḥ vajrim śavasā na dardar
translated: The firm forts of Vipra and Ahimayas, O wielder of the thunderbolt, you have shattered with your power.

original: sudāman tad rekṇo apramṛṣyam ṛjiśvane dātraṃ dāśuṣe dāḥ //
analyzed: su dāman tat rekṇaḥ apramṛṣyam ṛjiśvane dātram dāśuṣe dāḥ
translated: O Sudaman, give to the worshipper the gift that is not to be taken away, the wealth of the one who has a straight horse.

original: sa vetasuṃ daśamāyaṃ daśoṇiṃ tūtujim indraḥ svabhiṣṭisumnaḥ /
analyzed: sa vetasum daśa māyam daśoṇim tūtujim indraḥ su abhiṣṭi sumnaḥ
translated: That Indra, who is to be praised, who desires his own welfare, has conquered the ten-gated, ten-spoked Vetasu,

original: ā tugraṃ śaśvad ibhaṃ dyotanāya mātur na sīm upa sṛjā iyadhyai //🔽sa īṃ spṛdho vanate apratīto bibhrad vajraṃ vṛtrahaṇaṃ gabhastau /
analyzed: ā tugram śaśvat ibham dyotanāya mātuḥ na sīm upa sṛjai iyadhyai  saḥ īm spṛdhaḥ vanate apratītaḥ bibhrat vajram vṛtra haṇam gabhastau
translated: And has sent the ever-moving Tugra to shine, as if releasing him from the lap of his mother.🔽He, the unconquered one, conquers the enemies, holding in his arms the thunderbolt that slays Vrtra.

original: tiṣṭhad dharī adhy asteva garte vacoyujā vahata indram ṛṣvam //
analyzed: tiṣṭhat harī adhi astā iva garte vacaḥ yujā vahataḥ indram ṛṣvam
translated: Standing in the two bays, as if in a pit, yoked by speech, they carry the lofty Indra.

original: sanema te 'vasā navya indra pra pūrava stavanta enā yajñaiḥ /
analyzed: sanema te vasā navyaḥ indra pra pūravaḥ stavante enā yajñaiḥ
translated: May we, O Indra, with your new help, O bountiful one, may the Pûrus, praising you with sacrifices,

original: sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīr dard dhan dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan //
analyzed: sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīḥ dart han dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan
translated: When you broke the seven autumn forts, giving the Dâsa-maidens to Purukutsa.

original: tvaṃ vṛdha indra pūrvyo bhūr varivasyann uśane kāvyāya /
analyzed: tvam vṛdhaḥ indra pūrvyaḥ bhūḥ varivasyan uśane kāvyāya
translated: You, O Indra, are the ancient increaser, being gracious to the wise Ushanâ,

original: parā navavāstvam anudeyam mahe pitre dadātha svaṃ napātam //
analyzed: parā navavāstvam anudeyam mahe pitre dada atha svam napātam
translated: You have given the great father his own grandson, who has nine dwellings, to follow after.

original: tvaṃ dhunir indra dhunimatīr ṛṇor apaḥ sīrā na sravantīḥ /
analyzed: tvam dhuniḥ indra dhunimatīḥ ṛṇoḥ apaḥ sīrāḥ na sravantīḥ
translated: You are the shaker, O Indra, the shaker of the waters of the foe, like flowing streams.

original: pra yat samudram ati śūra parṣi pārayā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ svasti //🔽tava ha tyad indra viśvam ājau sasto dhunīcumurī yā ha siṣvap /
analyzed: pra yat samudram ati śūra parṣi pāraya turvaśam yadum svasti  tava ha tyad indra viśvam ājau sastaḥ dhunī cumurī yā ha siṣvap
translated: When, O hero, you carry across the ocean, do you carry Turvaṣa and Yadu across in safety.🔽That, O Indra, is all yours in the battle, the two waters, the deep and the shallow, which you have drunk.

original: dīdayad it tubhyaṃ somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītir idhmabhṛtiḥ pakthy arkaiḥ //
analyzed: dīdayat id tubhyam somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītiḥ idhma bhṛtiḥ pakthī arkaiḥ
translated: The worshipper shines forth for you with the Soma, the Adhvaryu with the fuel, the Pakthya with the hymns.

original: imā u tvā purutamasya kāror havyaṃ vīra havyā havante /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purutamasya kāroḥ havyam vīra havyā havante
translated: These offerings of yours, O hero, are brought by the most liberal of priests, the offerings of the sacrificer.

original: dhiyo ratheṣṭhām ajaraṃ navīyo rayir vibhūtir īyate vacasyā //
analyzed: dhiyaḥ ratheṣṭhām ajaram navīyaḥ rayiḥ vibhūtiḥ īyate vacasyā
translated: The newest, undecaying thought, seated in the chariot, the most desirable wealth, the most extensive, is brought.

original: tam u stuṣa indraṃ yo vidāno girvāhasaṃ gīrbhir yajñavṛddham /
analyzed: tam u stuṣe indram yaḥ vidānaḥ gir vāhasam gīrbhiḥ yajña vṛddham
translated: Praise him, O Indra, who knows, the bearer of the hymn, who is increased by the sacrifices.

original: yasya divam ati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya ririce mahitvam //
analyzed: yasya divam ati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ puru māyasya ririce mahi tvam
translated: Whose greatness, of the very wise one, surpasses the greatness of heaven and earth.

original: sa it tamo 'vayunaṃ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavac cakāra /
analyzed: saḥ id tamaḥ vayunam tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavat cakāra
translated: He made the darkness, which was without light, to be with light by the sun.

original: kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ //
analyzed: kadā te martāḥ amṛtasya dhāma iyakṣantaḥ na minanti svadhāvas
translated: When will the mortals, O self-existent one, seeking your abode, the immortal one, not fail?

original: yas tā cakāra sa kuha svid indraḥ kam ā janaṃ carati kāsu vikṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ tā cakāra sa kuha svid indraḥ kam ā janam carati kāsu vikṣu
translated: Where is that Indra who did that? In what people does he move, in what families?

original: kas te yajño manase śaṃ varāya ko arka indra katamaḥ sa hotā //
analyzed: kaḥ te yajñaḥ manase śam varāya kaḥ arkaḥ indra katamaḥ sa hotā
translated: What sacrifice, what hymn, what priest is best for thy mind, O Indra?

original: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsaḥ āsuḥ puru kṛt sakhāyaḥ
translated: For these are thy former, ancient friends, O thou of many deeds, who have come to thee from afar.

original: ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi //
analyzed: ye madhyamāsaḥ uta nūtanāsaḥ uta avamasya puruhūta bodhi
translated: Be thou also the helper of the middling and the new ones, O thou who art invoked by many.

original: tam pṛcchanto 'varāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ /
analyzed: tam pṛcchantaḥ varāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā te indra śrutyā anu yemuḥ
translated: The later ones, seeking thee, have followed the ancient ones, O Indra, who have gone to the farther ones, by thy fame.

original: arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yād eva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam //
analyzed: arcāmasi vīra brahma vāhaḥ yāt eva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam
translated: We praise thee, O hero, who hast the Brahman for thy steed, as great as we know thee to be.

original: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānam abhi tat su tiṣṭha /
analyzed: abhi tvā pājaḥ rakṣasaḥ vi tasthe mahi jajñānam abhi tat su tiṣṭha
translated: The flame of the Rakshas has stood against thee, O mighty one, at the time of thy birth, stand forth to that.

original: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apa tā nudasva //
analyzed: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apa tāḥ nudasva
translated: With thy ancient yoke-fellowship, O bold one, with thy thunderbolt, drive them away.

original: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ /
analyzed: sa tu śrudhi indra nūtanasya brahmaṇyataḥ vīra kāru dhāyaḥ
translated: Listen to that, O Indra, of the new prayer, O thou who givest the hero his food.

original: tvaṃ hy āpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṃ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau //
analyzed: tvam hi āpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇām śaśvat babhūtha su havaḥ eṣṭau
translated: For thou hast ever been the guardian of the wide-spread (sacrifices) of the fathers, easy to be invoked in the search (for help).

original: protaye varuṇam mitram indram marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya /
analyzed: protaye varuṇam mitram indram marutaḥ kṛṣva avase naḥ adya
translated: For the sake of the sacrifice, win for us today Varuna, Mitra, Indra, the Maruts.

original: pra pūṣaṇaṃ viṣṇum agnim purandhiṃ savitāram oṣadhīḥ parvatāṃś ca //
analyzed: pra pūṣaṇam viṣṇum agnim purandhim savitāram oṣadhīḥ parvatān ca
translated: Win for us today Pusan, Vishnu, Agni, Purandhi, Savitar, the plants, and the mountains.

original: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhy arcanty arkaiḥ /
analyzed: ime u tvā puru śāka prayajyo jaritāraḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ
translated: These, O thou who art to be worshipped, O thou of great power, the singers glorify with hymns.

original: śrudhī havam ā huvato huvāno na tvāvāṃ anyo amṛta tvad asti //
analyzed: śrudhi havam ā huvataḥ huvānaḥ na tvāvām anyaḥ amṛta tvat asti
translated: Listen to the call of him who calls, O thou who art to be invoked. There is none other than thee, O Immortal One.

original: nū ma ā vācam upa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajatraiḥ /
analyzed: nu me ā vācam upa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ yajatraiḥ
translated: Now come thou, O wise one, to my call, with all the adorable sons of strength,

original: ye agnijihvā ṛtasāpa āsur ye manuṃ cakrur uparaṃ dasāya //
analyzed: ye agni jihvāḥ ṛtasāpaḥ āsuḥ ye manum cakruḥ uparam dasāya
translated: Those who have the tongue of Agni, who are devoted to truth, who have made Manu the overlord for the foe.

original: sa no bodhi puraetā sugeṣūta durgeṣu pathikṛd vidānaḥ /🔽ye aśramāsa uravo vahiṣṭhās tebhir na indrābhi vakṣi vājam //
analyzed: sa naḥ bodhi puraetā sugeṣu uta durgeṣu pathikṛt vidānaḥ  ye aśramāsaḥ uravaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ tebhiḥ naḥ indra abhi vakṣi vājam
translated: Be thou our leader on easy paths, a maker of paths on difficult ones, O thou who art to be known.🔽With those most excellent paths, O Indra, bring us strength, those which are free from toil, the swift ones, which are in the mountains.

original: ya eka id dhavyaś carṣaṇīnām indraṃ taṃ gīrbhir abhy arca ābhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id havyaḥ carṣaṇīnām indram tam gīrbhiḥ abhī arce ābhiḥ
translated: Him who alone is to be worshipped by the people, him Indra, I glorify with these hymns, with these songs.

original: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān //
analyzed: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān
translated: Who is the lord, the strong bull, the mighty one, the true hero, the wise one, the powerful one.

original: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaro navagvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ navagvāḥ sapta viprāsaḥ abhi vājayantaḥ
translated: Him our ancient fathers, the Navagvas, the seven sages, exalting,

original: nakṣaddābhaṃ taturim parvateṣṭhām adroghavācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham //
analyzed: nakṣat dābham taturim parvateṣṭhām adrogha vācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
translated: Have made the irresistible, the swift one, the mountain-dweller, the one whose speech is guileless, the most powerful one, with their thoughts.

original: tam īmaha indram asya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ /
analyzed: tam īmahe indram asya rāyaḥ puru vīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
translated: We invoke that Indra for this wealth, for the wealth of many heroes, of the manly one, of the mighty one.

original: yo askṛdhoyur ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivo mādayadhyai //
analyzed: yaḥ askṛdhoyuḥ ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivas mādayadhyai
translated: Bring hither him who is ever-active, undecaying, the possessor of heaven, O thou who hast Bay Horses, that we may rejoice in him.

original: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cij jaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnam indra /
analyzed: tat naḥ vi vocaḥ yadi te purā cit jaritāraḥ ānaśuḥ sumnam indra
translated: Tell us this, if at any time before this our praisers have obtained favour from thee, O Indra.

original: kas te bhāgaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ te bhāgaḥ kim vayaḥ dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso sura ghnaḥ
translated: What is thy share, what is thy food, O wondrous one, O thou who art much invoked, O thou who hast much wealth, O thou who slayest the Asuras?

original: tam pṛcchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhām indraṃ vepī vakvarī yasya nū gīḥ /
analyzed: tam pṛcchantī vajrahastam ratheṣṭhām indram vepī vakvarī yasya nu gīḥ
translated: We ask this Indra, who wields the thunderbolt, who rides in the chariot, whose is this hymn, which is like a bird with outspread wings.

original: tuvigrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram accha //
analyzed: tuvi grābham tuvikūrmim rabhaḥ dām gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram accha
translated: To the strong one, of mighty grasp, of mighty impulse, of wondrous power, we go for food, for the sake of motion, to the ruddy one.

original: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena /
analyzed: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manaḥ juvā svatavaḥ parvatena
translated: This one, with his own power, with his own thought-swift magic power, has grown great with the mountain.

original: acyutā cid vīḷitā svojo rujo vi dṛḷhā dhṛṣatā virapśin //
analyzed: acyutā cit vīḍitā su ojaḥ rujaḥ vi dṛḍhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
translated: Even the unshaken he has shaken, with his own strength he has crushed, with his own daring he has rent asunder the firm ones.

original: taṃ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnam pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnam pratna vat paritaṃsayadhyai
translated: We will yoke him, the strongest, with a new hymn, the ancient one, as of old, to be our charioteer.

original: sa no vakṣad animānaḥ suvahmendro viśvāny ati durgahāṇi //
analyzed: sa naḥ vakṣat animānaḥ suvahmā indraḥ viśvāni ati durgahāṇi
translated: May he, the swift-moving one, carry us beyond all difficult things, O Indra, beyond all troubles.

original: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo 'ntarikṣā /
analyzed: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayaḥ ntarikṣā
translated: Light up for the people, for the hostile one, the earthly, the heavenly, and the atmospheric lights.

original: tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣām apaś ca //
analyzed: tapa vṛṣan viśvatas śociṣā tān brahma dviṣe śocaya kṣām apaḥ ca
translated: Scorch them, O bull, on every side with thy flame, burn the earth and the waters for him who hates prayer.

original: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagatas tveṣasaṃdṛk /🔽dhiṣva vajraṃ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagataḥ tveṣa saṃdṛś  dhiṣva vajram dakṣiṇe indra haste viśvāḥ ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ
translated: King of the people of earth and of heaven, with thy bright appearance,🔽Hold the thunderbolt in thy right hand, O Indra, thou dost destroy all unchanging illusions.

original: ā saṃyatam indra ṇaḥ svastiṃ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām /
analyzed: ā saṃyatam indra naḥ svastim śatru tūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām
translated: O Indra, bring us prosperity, which is to be attained, vast, invincible, for the conquest of enemies,

original: yayā dāsāny āryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi //🔽sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhir ā gahi prayajyo /
analyzed: yayā dāsāni āryāṇi vṛtrā karaḥ vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi  sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedhaḥ viśva vārābhiḥ ā gahi prayajyo
translated: By which, O wielder of the thunderbolt, thou hast made the Aryan and Dāsa peoples perform noble deeds, O son of Nahusa.🔽O much-invoked one, O wise one, come to us with those aids which are most desired, O worthy of sacrifice,

original: na yā adevo varate na deva ābhir yāhi tūyam ā madryadrik //
analyzed: na yāḥ adevaḥ varate na devaḥ ābhiḥ yāhi tūyam ā madryadrik
translated: By which thou mayst come quickly to us, O thou who art to be praised by men, whether they be non-divine or divine.

original: suta it tvaṃ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamāna ukthe /🔽yad vā yuktābhyām maghavan haribhyām bibhrad vajram bāhvor indra yāsi //
analyzed: sute id tvam nimiślaḥ indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamāne ukthe  yat vā yuktābhyām maghavan haribhyām bibhrat vajram bāhvoḥ indra yāsi
translated: Thou art pressed, O Indra, at the libation, at the hymn, at the prayer, at the chanted praise,🔽Or when, O bountiful one, thou goest, O Indra, bearing the thunderbolt in thy arms, yoked with thy two bay horses.

original: yad vā divi pārye suṣvim indra vṛtrahatye 'vasi śūrasātau /
analyzed: yat vā divi pārye suṣvim indra vṛtra hatye vasi śūrasātau
translated: Or when, O Indra, on the last day, in the battle for heroic deeds, in the slaying of Vrtra, thou dost dwell,

original: yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyad arandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn //
analyzed: yat vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣaḥ a bibhyat arandhayaḥ śardhataḥ indra dasyūn
translated: Or when, fearless, thou didst terrify the trembling Daksas, thou didst crush the Dasyus, O Indra.

original: pātā sutam indro astu somam praṇenīr ugro jaritāram ūtī /
analyzed: pātā sutam indraḥ astu somam praṇenīḥ ugraḥ jaritāram ūtī
translated: May Indra, the strong one, be the protector of the pressed Soma, of the draught, of the singer,

original: kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṃ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit //
analyzed: kartā vīrāya suṣvaye u lokam dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit
translated: The maker of a wide space for the hero, the giver of wealth even to the poor praiser.

original: ganteyānti savanā haribhyām babhrir vajram papiḥ somaṃ dadir gāḥ /
analyzed: gantā iyānti savanā haribhyām babhriḥ vajram papiḥ somam dadiḥ gāḥ
translated: The goer will go to the libations with the two bays, the bearer will bear the thunderbolt, the drinker will drink the Soma, the giver will give the cows.

original: kartā vīraṃ naryaṃ sarvavīraṃ śrotā havaṃ gṛṇata stomavāhāḥ //🔽asmai vayaṃ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ /🔽sute some stumasi śaṃsad ukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṃ yathāsat //
analyzed: kartā vīram naryam sarva vīram śrotā havam gṛṇataḥ stoma vāhāḥ  asmai vayam yat vāvāna tat viviṣmaḥ indrāya yaḥ naḥ pradivaḥ apaḥ kaḥ  sute some stumasi śaṃsat ukthā indrāya brahma vardhanam yathā asat
translated: The maker of the hero, the man, the hero of all, the hearer of the call, the bearer of the praise of the singer.🔽What we have gained for him, that we will accomplish for Indra, who has given us the waters from the sky.🔽In the pressed Soma, we praise the hymn of praise, the prayer to Indra, that it may be as we wish.

original: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhir viviṣmaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat te indra matibhiḥ viviṣmaḥ
translated: For you have made prayers and praises, so far we will accomplish them with our thoughts for you, O Indra.

original: sute some sutapāḥ śantamāni rāṇḍyā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: sute some suta pāḥ śantamāni rāṇḍyā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ
translated: In the pressed Soma, O you who are purified by the pressed Soma, the most auspicious, by the sacrifice of the one who is born in the womb, we will accomplish the rites.

original: sa no bodhi puroḷāśaṃ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṃ goṛjīkam indra /🔽edam barhir yajamānasya sīdoruṃ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam //🔽sa mandasvā hy anu joṣam ugra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu /
analyzed: sa naḥ bodhi puroḷāśam rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somam goṛjīkam indra  ā idam barhiḥ yajamānasya sīda urum kṛdhi tvāyataḥ u lokam  sa mandasva hi anu joṣam ugra pra tvā yajñāsaḥ ime aśnuvantu
translated: Be pleased with the cake that is offered to you, drink the Soma mixed with milk, O Indra.🔽Sit on this sacrificial grass of the sacrificer, make it wide and long for you.🔽Be pleased, O mighty one, according to your desire, may these sacrifices of ours reach you.

original: preme havāsaḥ puruhūtam asme ā tveyaṃ dhīr avasa indra yamyāḥ //
analyzed: pra ime havāsaḥ puruhūtam asme ā tvā iyam dhīḥ avase indra yamyāḥ
translated: The prayers have come to the much-invoked one for us, this thought of yours, O Indra, is for the two who are to be helped.

original: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṃ yathā suteṣu somebhir īm pṛṇatā bhojam indram /
analyzed: tam vaḥ sakhāyaḥ sam yathā suteṣu somebhiḥ īm pṛṇata bhojam indram
translated: As friends to you, so may they fill the bountiful Indra with the pressed Soma juices at the feasts.

original: kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvim indro 'vase mṛdhāti //🔽eved indraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayad in maghonaḥ /🔽asad yathā jaritra uta sūrir indro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā //
analyzed: kuvid tasmai asati naḥ bharāya na suṣvim indraḥ vase mṛdhāti  eva id indraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayat id maghonaḥ  asat yathā jaritre uta sūriḥ indraḥ rāyaḥ viśva vārasya dātā
translated: Will he not bear us for support, even him who is not? Indra will not disdain the worshipper for his help.🔽Even this Indra has been gladdened with the pressed Soma, in the house of the wealthy Bharadvājas.🔽Let him be as a charioteer to the singer and a prince, Indra the giver of wealth with all its blessings.

original: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī /🔽arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthair dyukṣo rājā girām akṣitotiḥ //🔽taturir vīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṃ gṛṇata urvyūtiḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā made indre śloke ukthā sacā someṣu suta pāḥ ṛjīṣī  arcatryaḥ maghavā nṛbhyaḥ ukthaiḥ dyukṣaḥ rājā girām a kṣita ūtiḥ  taturiḥ vīraḥ naryaḥ vicetāḥ śrotā havam gṛṇate urvyūtiḥ
translated: The strong rapture is in Indra, the hymn and the lauds are with him, the impetuous one, at the well-pressed Soma juices.🔽The worshipper, the bountiful one, the hero among men, the discerning one, the hearer of the cry of the singer, the one with wide protection,

original: vasuḥ śaṃso narāṃ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam //🔽akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: vasuḥ śaṃsaḥ narām kāru dhāyāḥ vājī stutaḥ vidathe dāti vājam  akṣaḥ na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ
translated: the good singer, the one who gives men their livelihood, the strong one praised in the assembly, bestows strength.🔽O hero, the axle is great between the wheels, by thy greatness thy two worlds are extended.

original: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vy ūtayo ruruhur indra pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayāḥ vi ūtayaḥ ruruhuḥ indra pūrvīḥ
translated: O much-invoked one, many are thy supports, O Indra, as the branches of a tree.

original: śacīvatas te puruśāka śākā gavām iva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ /
analyzed: śacīvataḥ te puru śāka śākāḥ gavām iva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ
translated: The supports of thee, the powerful one, the one with many powers, are like the paths of cows,🔽the supports of the singer, the one who gives men their livelihood, the strong one praised in the assembly, bestow strength.

original: vatsānāṃ na tantayas ta indra dāmanvanto adāmānaḥ sudāman //
analyzed: vatsānām na tantayaḥ te indra dāmanvantaḥ a dāmānaḥ su dāman
translated: O Indra, the bonds of the calves are not for you, the bonds of the generous are not for the bountiful one.

original: anyad adya karvaram anyad u śvo 'sac ca san muhur ācakrir indraḥ /
analyzed: anyat adya karvaram anyat u śvas sat ca sat muhur ācakriḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra has made one thing today, another tomorrow, and again and again he has made what was not.

original: mitro no atra varuṇaś ca pūṣāryo vaśasya paryetāsti //
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra varuṇaḥ ca pūṣā aryaḥ vaśasya paryetā asti
translated: Here Mitra, Varuna, and Pushan, the noble ones, are to be honored by us.

original: vi tvad āpo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhād ukthebhir indrānayanta yajñaiḥ /
analyzed: vi tvat āpaḥ na parvatasya pṛṣṭhāt ukthebhiḥ indra anayanta yajñaiḥ
translated: The waters have brought Indra from the back of the mountain, with hymns and sacrifices.

original: taṃ tvābhiḥ suṣṭutibhir vājayanta ājiṃ na jagmur girvāho aśvāḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā ābhiḥ suṣṭutibhiḥ vājayantaḥ ājim na jagmuḥ gir vāhaḥ aśvāḥ
translated: They have urged him with these fine praises, the singers' horses have gone to the race.

original: na yaṃ jaranti śarado na māsā na dyāva indram avakarśayanti /
analyzed: na yam jaranti śaradaḥ na māsāḥ na dyāvaḥ indram avakarśayanti
translated: Whom neither the autumns nor the months, nor the heavens, weaken, Indra.

original: vṛddhasya cid vardhatām asya tanū stomebhir ukthaiś ca śasyamānā //
analyzed: vṛddhasya cit vardhatām asya tanū stomebhiḥ ukthaiḥ ca śasyamānā
translated: Even of the aged one, his body grows with his praises and hymns being extolled.

original: na vīḷave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyujūtāya stavān /
analyzed: na vīḍave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyu jūtāya stavān
translated: I do not bow to the strong one, nor to the firm one, nor to the daring one who is allied with the Dasyus.

original: ajrā indrasya girayaś cid ṛṣvā gambhīre cid bhavati gādham asmai //🔽gambhīreṇa na uruṇāmatrin preṣo yandhi sutapāvan vājān /
analyzed: ajrāḥ indrasya girayaḥ cit ṛṣvāḥ gambhīre cit bhavati gādham asmai  gambhīreṇa naḥ uruṇā amatrin pra iṣaḥ yandhi suta pāvan vājān
translated: Even the lofty mountains of Indra are not high enough, there is a deep abyss for him.🔽O you who have good fires, send us food with your deep and wide-reaching messenger.

original: sthā ū ṣu ūrdhva ūtī ariṣaṇyann aktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām //
analyzed: sthāḥ u su ūrdhvaḥ ūtī a riṣaṇyan aktoḥ vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām
translated: Stand firm, O one who cannot be resisted, at the rising of the sun, at the dawn.

original: sacasva nāyam avase abhīka ito vā tam indra pāhi riṣaḥ /
analyzed: sacasva nāyam avase abhīke itas vā tam indra pāhi riṣaḥ
translated: Be with this one for help, O fearless one; or from here, O Indra, protect him from harm.

original: amā cainam araṇye pāhi riṣo madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: amā ca enam araṇye pāhi riṣaḥ madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: And protect him in the wilderness from harm. May we rejoice through a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: yā ta ūtir avamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminn asti /
analyzed: yā te ūtiḥ avamā yā paramā yā madhyamā indra śuṣmin asti
translated: That lowest, that highest, O Indra, that which is in the middle, O mighty one, of your help,

original: tābhir ū ṣu vṛtrahatye 'vīr na ebhiś ca vājair mahān na ugra //
analyzed: tābhiḥ u su vṛtra hatye vīḥ naḥ ebhiḥ ca vājaiḥ mahān naḥ ugra
translated: With those, O hero, for the slaying of Vrtra, and with these powers, be great and strong for us.

original: ābhi spṛdho mithatīr ariṣaṇyann amitrasya vyathayā manyum indra /
analyzed: ābhiḥ spṛdhaḥ mithatīḥ a riṣaṇyan amitrasya vyathaya manyum indra
translated: With these, O Indra, repelling the deceitful hostilities, the wrath of the enemy,

original: ābhir viśvā abhiyujo viṣūcīr āryāya viśo 'va tārīr dāsīḥ //
analyzed: ābhiḥ viśvāḥ abhiyujaḥ viṣūcīḥ āryāya viśaḥ vaḥ tārīḥ dāsīḥ
translated: With these all the hostile attacks from afar, the Aryan people, and the Dāsa people, do thou drive away.

original: indra jāmaya uta ye 'jāmayo 'rvācīnāso vanuṣo yuyujre /
analyzed: indra jāmayaḥ uta ye jāmayaḥ rvācīnāsaḥ vanuṣaḥ yuyujre
translated: O Indra, those who are kinsmen and those who are not kinsmen, who have yoked their teams for battle, who are here,

original: tvam eṣāṃ vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhī parācaḥ //🔽śūro vā śūraṃ vanate śarīrais tanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite /
analyzed: tvam eṣām vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhi parācaḥ  śūraḥ vā śūram vanate śarīraiḥ tanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite
translated: Do thou destroy their feeble powers, O mighty one, and make their virility turn away.🔽A hero conquers a hero with his body, when he does what is to be done with the radiance of his form.

original: toke vā goṣu tanaye yad apsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite //
analyzed: toke vā goṣu tanaye yat apsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite
translated: When ye two roar in the young of the cows, in the offspring, in the waters, ye two roar in the tilled fields.

original: nahi tvā śūro na turo na dhṛṣṇur na tvā yodho manyamāno yuyodha /
analyzed: nahi tvā śūraḥ na turaḥ na dhṛṣṇuḥ na tvā yodhaḥ manyamānaḥ yuyodha
translated: For neither a hero, nor a swift one, nor a daring one, nor a warrior who thinks of himself, fights with thee.

original: indra nakiṣ ṭvā praty asty eṣāṃ viśvā jātāny abhy asi tāni //
analyzed: indra nakir tvā prati asti eṣām viśvā jātāni abhī asi tāni
translated: O Indra, none of these is equal to thee: thou surpassest all these creatures.

original: sa patyata ubhayor nṛmṇam ayor yadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante /
analyzed: sa patyate ubhayoḥ nṛmṇam ayoḥ yadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante
translated: He rules over the manly strength of both, when the two wise ones are summoned to the contest.

original: vṛtre vā maho nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite //
analyzed: vṛtre vā mahaḥ nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite
translated: If these two wide ones are spread out, either in the great battle with Vritra, or in the battle of men.

original: adha smā te carṣaṇayo yad ejān indra trātota bhavā varūtā /
analyzed: adha smā te carṣaṇayaḥ yat ejān indra trātā uta bhava varūtā
translated: Then, O Indra, be thou a protector and a guardian to the people, when they are agitated by thee.

original: asmākāso ye nṛtamāso arya indra sūrayo dadhire puro naḥ //🔽anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viśvam anu vṛtrahatye /
analyzed: asmākāsaḥ ye nṛtamāsaḥ aryaḥ indra sūrayaḥ dadhire puras naḥ  anu te dāyi mahe indriyāya satrā te viśvam anu vṛtra hatye
translated: Those who are most manly among us, the noble ones, O Indra, have placed us in the front.🔽Grant to thee the great power, always to thee for the slaying of Vritra.

original: anu kṣatram anu saho yajatrendra devebhir anu te nṛṣahye //
analyzed: anu kṣatram anu sahaḥ yajatra indra devebhiḥ anu te nṛṣahye
translated: After the lordship, after the strength, O holy Indra, after thee in the battle of men, together with the gods.

original: evā na spṛdhaḥ sam ajā samatsv indra rārandhi mithatīr adevīḥ /🔽vidyāma vastor avasā gṛṇanto bharadvājā uta ta indra nūnam //
analyzed: eva naḥ spṛdhaḥ sam aja samatsu indra rārandhi mithatīḥ adevīḥ  vidyāma vastoḥ avasā gṛṇantaḥ bharadvājāḥ uta te indra nūnam
translated: Thus, O Indra, in the battles, in the contests, delight in the quarrels, in the wicked ones.🔽May we, the Bharadvajas, praising, find the favour of the one who is to be praised, and thou also, O Indra, now.

original: śrudhī na indra hvayāmasi tvā maho vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ indra hvayāmasi tvā mahaḥ vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ
translated: Listen to us, O Indra, we invoke thee for the great gain of strength, pouring (gifts).

original: saṃ yad viśo 'yanta śūrasātā ugraṃ no 'vaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ //
analyzed: sam yat viśaḥ yanta śūra sātau ugram naḥ vaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ
translated: When the people have come together, O hero, for the contest, give us strong help on the last day.

original: tvāṃ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya gadhyasya sātau /
analyzed: tvām vājī havate vājineyaḥ mahaḥ vājasya gadhyasya sātau
translated: The strong steed, worthy of the prize, invokes thee in the great contest for the prize to be gained.

original: tvāṃ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṃ tarutraṃ tvāṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā goṣu yudhyan //
analyzed: tvām vṛtreṣu indra sat patim tarutram tvām caṣṭe muṣṭi hā goṣu yudhyan
translated: Thee, O Indra, the lord of heroes, in battles, the smiter with the fist, the warrior, looks to in the fight for the kine.

original: tvaṃ kaviṃ codayo 'rkasātau tvaṃ kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ dāśuṣe vark /
analyzed: tvam kavim codayaḥ rka sātau tvam kutsāya śuṣṇam dāśuṣe vark
translated: Thou hast urged the sage in the contest for the light; thou hast given Kushtha to the worshipper for the slaying of Sushna.

original: tvaṃ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhann atithigvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan //
analyzed: tvam śiraḥ amarmaṇaḥ parāhan atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan
translated: Thou hast smitten off the head of the one without a wound, O Indra, for the glorification of Atithigva.

original: tvaṃ ratham pra bharo yodham ṛṣvam āvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum /
analyzed: tvam ratham pra bharaḥ yodham ṛṣvam āvaḥ yudhyantam vṛṣabham daśadyum
translated: Thou hast sent forth the lofty warrior chariot, the bull to aid in the fight, O thou of tenfold might.

original: tvaṃ tugraṃ vetasave sacāhan tvaṃ tujiṃ gṛṇantam indra tūtoḥ //
analyzed: tvam tugram vetasave sacā ahan tvam tujim gṛṇantam indra tūtoḥ
translated: Thou hast slain Tugra with the Vetasus; thou hast helped Tuji, O Indra, who sang thy praise.

original: tvaṃ tad uktham indra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yac chatā sahasrā śūra darṣi /
analyzed: tvam tat uktham indra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yat śatā sahasrā śūra darṣi
translated: This hymn, O Indra, thou hast magnified, O hero, when thou didst smite a hundred thousand.

original: ava girer dāsaṃ śambaraṃ han prāvo divodāsaṃ citrābhir ūtī //
analyzed: ava gireḥ dāsam śambaram han prāvaḥ divodāsam citrābhiḥ ūtī
translated: Thou hast slain the Dâsa of the mountain, Sambara; thou hast helped Divodasa with wondrous aids.

original: tvaṃ śraddhābhir mandasānaḥ somair dabhītaye cumurim indra siṣvap /
analyzed: tvam śraddhābhiḥ mandasānaḥ somaiḥ dabhītaye cumurim indra siṣvap
translated: Thou, rejoicing in the faith, in the Soma-juices, hast, O Indra, crushed Chumuri for Dabhit.

original: tvaṃ rajim piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā śacyā sacāhan //
analyzed: tvam rajim piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭim sahasrā śacyā sacā ahan
translated: Thou, bestowing favour on Pitîna, hast slain with might sixty thousand Rajis.

original: ahaṃ cana tat sūribhir ānaśyāṃ tava jyāya indra sumnam ojaḥ /
analyzed: aham cana tat sūribhiḥ ānaśyām tava jyāyaḥ indra sumnam ojaḥ
translated: I would not even share that with the princes, thy favour, O Indra, thy strength.

original: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrās trivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha //
analyzed: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāḥ tri varūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha
translated: O you who are praised by heroes together with your heroic sons, O most powerful one, with your threefold protection, O Nahusha!

original: vayaṃ te asyām indra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: vayam te asyām indra dyumna hūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ
translated: O Indra, in this invocation of yours, may we be your friends, most beloved, most honored.

original: prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīr astu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṃ sanaye dhanānām //
analyzed: prātardaniḥ kṣatra śrīḥ astu śreṣṭhaḥ ghane vṛtrāṇām sanaye dhanānām
translated: May he who gives in the morning be the best, having the glory of kingship, for the destruction of many foes, for the winning of riches.

original: kim asya made kim v asya pītāv indraḥ kim asya sakhye cakāra /
analyzed: kim asya made kim u asya pītau indraḥ kim asya sakhye cakāra
translated: What has he done in its intoxication, what in its drinking, what has Indra done in its friendship?

original: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṃ te asya purā vividre kim u nūtanāsaḥ //
analyzed: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kim te asya purā vividre kim u nūtanāsaḥ
translated: Or what have they done in its battles, in its sitting? What have they formerly known of it, and what is new?

original: sad asya made sad v asya pītāv indraḥ sad asya sakhye cakāra /
analyzed: sat asya made sat u asya pītau indraḥ sat asya sakhye cakāra
translated: He has done well in its intoxication, he has done well in its drinking, Indra has done well in its friendship.

original: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya purā vividre sad u nūtanāsaḥ //
analyzed: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya purā vividre sat u nūtanāsaḥ
translated: Or what have they done in its battles, in its sitting? They have done well in it formerly, and they have done well in it newly.

original: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma /
analyzed: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavat tvasya vidma
translated: For we know not the greatness of this, O bountiful one, nor the bounty of your bounty,

original: na rādhasorādhaso nūtanasyendra nakir dadṛśa indriyaṃ te //🔽etat tyat ta indriyam aceti yenāvadhīr varaśikhasya śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: na rādhasaḥ rādhasaḥ nūtanasya indra nakir dadṛśe indriyam te  etat tyad te indriyam aceti yena avadhīḥ varaśikhasya śeṣaḥ
translated: Nor the new bounty of your bounty, O Indra. No one has seen your power, O Indra.🔽This is the power of yours, O Indra, which you have, by which you killed Varashikha's son.

original: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāc cid indra paramo dadāra //
analyzed: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāt cit indra paramaḥ dadāra
translated: From the roar of your slain thunderbolt, O Indra, the highest one has split asunder.

original: vadhīd indro varaśikhasya śeṣo 'bhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan /
analyzed: vadhīt indraḥ vara śikhasya śeṣaḥ bhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan
translated: Indra slew the remnant of Varashikha, teaching him who turned back and who advanced.

original: vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṃ han pūrve ardhe bhiyasāparo dart //
analyzed: vṛcīvataḥ yat hariyūpīyāyām han pūrve ardhe bhiyasā aparaḥ dart
translated: When he struck the first in the battle at Hariyupiya, the second fled in fear.

original: triṃśacchataṃ varmiṇa indra sākaṃ yavyāvatyām puruhūta śravasyā /🔽vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānā nyarthāny āyan //
analyzed: triṃśat śatam varmiṇaḥ indra sākam yavyāvatyām puruhūta śravasyā  vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānāḥ nyarthāni āyan
translated: Thirty hundred armored ones, O Indra, invoked by many, O much-invoked one, for fame,🔽Endowed with strength, striving for glory, their vessels broken, went away with empty hands.

original: yasya gāvāv aruṣā sūyavasyū antar ū ṣu carato rerihāṇā /
analyzed: yasya gāvau aruṣā sūyavasyū antar u su carataḥ rerihāṇā
translated: Whose two red cows, grazing on good grass, move about lowing within (the stable),

original: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśam parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāya śikṣan //
analyzed: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśam parādāt vṛcīvataḥ daivavātāya śikṣan
translated: He gave Turvasa to Sringin, teaching him who had strength, who had the gods' favor.

original: dvayāṃ agne rathino viṃśatiṃ gā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṃ samrāṭ /
analyzed: dvayām agne rathinaḥ viṃśatim gāḥ vadhūmataḥ maghavā mahyam samrāj
translated: Two chariots, twenty cows, the lord of the people, the emperor, the generous one,

original: abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṃ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām //
analyzed: abhyāvartī cāyamānaḥ dadāti dūṇāśeyam dakṣiṇā pārthavānām
translated: Gives to me, turning back and advancing. The Dakshina of the Parthavas is full of hope.

original: ā gāvo agmann uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantv asme /
analyzed: ā gāvaḥ agman uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantu asme
translated: The cows have come and have done well. May they sit in the cowshed and delight us.

original: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syur indrāya pūrvīr uṣaso duhānāḥ //
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ puru rūpāḥ iha syuḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ duhānāḥ
translated: May they be here, rich in offspring and varied, yielding abundant milk to Indra, the dawns.

original: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣaty uped dadāti na svam muṣāyati /
analyzed: indraḥ yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣati upa id dadāti na svam muṣāyati
translated: Indra favors the sacrificer and the giver, he comes and gives, he does not steal his own.

original: bhūyobhūyo rayim id asya vardhayann abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum //
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas rayim id asya vardhayan abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum
translated: Increasing his wealth again and again, he places the god-adoring one in an unbroken trough.

original: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsām āmitro vyathir ā dadharṣati /
analyzed: na tāḥ naśanti na dabhāti taskaraḥ na āsām āmitraḥ vyathiḥ ā dadharṣati
translated: They are not lost, a thief does not injure them, an enemy's misfortune does not oppress them.

original: devāṃś ca yābhir yajate dadāti ca jyog it tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha //
analyzed: devān ca yābhiḥ yajate dadāti ca jyok id tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha
translated: With those by which he worships the gods and gives gifts, the lord of the cows dwells long with them.

original: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tā abhi /
analyzed: na tāḥ arvā reṇu kakāṭaḥ aśnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tāḥ abhi
translated: The dust-heap does not reach those cows, they do not approach the place of preparation.

original: urugāyam abhayaṃ tasya tā anu gāvo martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ //
analyzed: uru gāyam abhayam tasya tāḥ anu gāvaḥ martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ
translated: The cows of the sacrificer move about in the wide pasture of that one who is safe from danger.

original: gāvo bhago gāva indro me acchān gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ bhagaḥ gāvaḥ indraḥ me acchān gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ
translated: The cows are bliss, the cows are Indra's share with me, the cows are the first food of Soma.

original: imā yā gāvaḥ sa janāsa indra icchāmīd dhṛdā manasā cid indram //🔽yūyaṃ gāvo medayathā kṛśaṃ cid aśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ gāvaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ icchāmi id hṛdā manasā cit indram  yūyam gāvaḥ medayatha kṛśam cit aśrīram cit kṛṇutha su pratīkam
translated: These cows are the people, they are Indra. I desire Indra with my heart and mind.🔽O cows, you make even the lean one fat, you make even the ugly one beautiful.

original: bhadraṃ gṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu //
analyzed: bhadram gṛham kṛṇutha bhadra vācaḥ bṛhat vaḥ vayaḥ ucyate sabhāsu
translated: You make the house auspicious, you speak auspicious words. Your great strength is proclaimed in the assemblies.

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṃ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇe pibantīḥ /
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasam riśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ
translated: The cows, rich in offspring, seeking good pasture, drinking pure water at a good drinking place,

original: mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ //
analyzed: mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ hetiḥ rudrasya vṛjyāḥ
translated: Let not the thief rule over you, nor the slanderer. May you escape from the dart of Rudra.

original: upedam upaparcanam āsu goṣūpa pṛcyatām /🔽upa ṛṣabhasya retasy upendra tava vīrye //
analyzed: upa idam upaparcanam āsu goṣu upa pṛcyatām  upa ṛṣabhasya retasi upa indra tava vīrye
translated: Here let this remedy be applied to these cows.🔽To the seed of the bull, to the strength of Indra.

original: indraṃ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepur maho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ /
analyzed: indram vaḥ naraḥ sakhyāya sepuḥ mahaḥ yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ
translated: The men have followed Indra for friendship, longing for his great favour and shining.

original: maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahām u raṇvam avase yajadhvam //
analyzed: mahaḥ hi dātā vajra hastaḥ asti mahām u raṇvam avase yajadhvam
translated: For he is the great giver, the wielder of the thunderbolt. Worship the great and kind one for help.

original: ā yasmin haste naryā mimikṣur ā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ /🔽ā raśmayo gabhastyo sthūrayor ādhvann aśvāso vṛṣaṇo yujānāḥ //🔽śriye te pādā duva ā mimikṣur dhṛṣṇur vajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān /
analyzed: ā yasmin haste naryāḥ mimikṣuḥ ā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ  ā raśmayaḥ gabhastyoḥ sthūrayoḥ ādhvan aśvāsaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yujānāḥ  śriye te pādā duvaḥ ā mimikṣuḥ dhṛṣṇuḥ vajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān
translated: In whose hand the heroes have mingled, the charioteers in the golden chariot.🔽The reins, the thick poles, the yoking of the strong horses on the way.🔽For your glory, the feet have mingled in the service. The bold one, the wielder of the thunderbolt, is victorious with strength.

original: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svar ṇa nṛtav iṣiro babhūtha //
analyzed: vasānaḥ atkam surabhim dṛśe kam svar na nṛto iṣiraḥ babhūtha
translated: Wearing the fragrant garment for the sight, you have become like the swift heaven.

original: sa soma āmiślatamaḥ suto bhūd yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santi dhānāḥ /
analyzed: sa somaḥ āmiślatamaḥ sutaḥ bhūt yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santi dhānāḥ
translated: That Soma has become the most desirable when pressed, in which the cake is baked, the grains are present.

original: indraṃ nara stuvanto brahmakārā ukthā śaṃsanto devavātatamāḥ //
analyzed: indram naraḥ stuvantaḥ brahma kārāḥ ukthā śaṃsantaḥ deva vātatamāḥ
translated: The Brahmins, the makers of prayers, praising Indra, singing the hymns, most devoted to the gods.

original: na te antaḥ śavaso dhāyy asya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā /
analyzed: na te antaḥ śavasaḥ dhāyi asya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā
translated: In the midst of his glory he is to be worshipped; he hath widely spread the two worlds by his greatness.

original: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujāno yūthevāpsu samījamāna ūtī //
analyzed: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ yūthā iva apsu samījamānaḥ ūtī
translated: The prince, the helper, who is ready to give, is filled with food, like a herd (of cattle) in the water, when it is moving on.

original: eved indraḥ suhava ṛṣvo astūtī anūtī hiriśipraḥ satvā /🔽evā hi jāto asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn //
analyzed: eva id indraḥ su havaḥ ṛṣvaḥ astūtī anūtī hiri śipraḥ satvā  eva hi jātaḥ asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn
translated: So may Indra be easily invoked, lofty, with helpers and helpers' helpers, the tawny-visored hero.🔽So, indeed, he who is born with unequalled strength, slays many Vritras and Dasyus.

original: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyaṃ eko ajuryo dayate vasūni /
analyzed: bhūyas id vāvṛdhe vīryāyam ekaḥ ajuryaḥ dayate vasūni
translated: He has grown greater still in this manly strength; alone, the undecaying one, he distributes treasures.

original: pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardham id asya prati rodasī ubhe //
analyzed: pra ririce divaḥ indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ ardham id asya prati rodasī ubhe
translated: Indra has spread himself out over the earth and heaven; he has filled both worlds, the two, with his greatness.

original: adhā manye bṛhad asuryam asya yāni dādhāra nakir ā mināti /
analyzed: adhā manye bṛhat asuryam asya yāni dādhāra nakir ā mināti
translated: Now I think of his great godhead, which no one can transgress, which he has established.

original: divedive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmāny urviyā sukratur dhāt //
analyzed: dive dive sūryaḥ darśataḥ bhūt vi sadmāni urviyā su kratuḥ dhāt
translated: Day by day the sun has become more glorious; the wise one has spread out the abodes with his greatness.

original: adyā cin nū cit tad apo nadīnāṃ yad ābhyo arado gātum indra /
analyzed: adyā cit nu cit tat apaḥ nadīnām yat ābhyaḥ aradaḥ gātum indra
translated: Even now, or rather long ago, O Indra, thou gavest to these rivers a passage for their waters.

original: ni parvatā admasado na sedus tvayā dṛḷhāni sukrato rajāṃsi //
analyzed: ni parvatāḥ adma sadaḥ na seduḥ tvayā dṛḍhāni su krato rajāṃsi
translated: The mountains have sat down as food-eaters; by thee, O wise one, the firm regions are made.

original: satyam it tan na tvāvāṃ anyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān /
analyzed: satyam id tat na tvāvām anyaḥ asti indra devaḥ na martyaḥ jyāyān
translated: This is true; there is none other like thee, O Indra, neither god nor mortal is greater.

original: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇo 'vāsṛjo apo acchā samudram //
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ vā asṛjaḥ apaḥ acchā samudram
translated: Thou slewest Ahi, the surrounding flood, and lettest loose the waters to the sea.

original: tvam apo vi duro viṣūcīr indra dṛḷham arujaḥ parvatasya /
analyzed: tvam apaḥ vi duraḥ viṣūcīḥ indra dṛḍham arujaḥ parvatasya
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast cleft the firm-set doors of the waters and of the mountain asunder.

original: rājābhavo jagataś carṣaṇīnāṃ sākaṃ sūryaṃ janayan dyām uṣāsam //
analyzed: rājā abhavaḥ jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām sākam sūryam janayan dyām uṣāsam
translated: Thou hast become the king of the people of the world, begetting the heaven and the dawn together with the sun.

original: abhūr eko rayipate rayīṇām ā hastayor adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ /
analyzed: abhūḥ ekaḥ rayi pate rayīṇām ā hastayoḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Thou art alone, O Lord of wealth, the wealth of the wealthy; in thy hands, O Indra, are the people laid.

original: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre 'vocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ //
analyzed: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre vocanta carṣaṇayaḥ vivācaḥ
translated: In the offspring, in the waters, in the son, in the sun, the people have uttered various voices.

original: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā cic cyāvayante rajāṃsi /
analyzed: tvat bhiyā indra pārthivāni viśvā acyutā cit cyāvayante rajāṃsi
translated: Through thy fear, O Indra, all earthly things, even the unmoving, move, the regions.

original: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāso vanāni viśvaṃ dṛḷham bhayate ajmann ā te //
analyzed: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāsaḥ vanāni viśvam dṛḍham bhayate ajman ā te
translated: Heaven and earth, the mountains, the woods, all that is firm tremble at thy approach.

original: tvaṃ kutsenābhi śuṣṇam indrāśuṣaṃ yudhya kuyavaṃ gaviṣṭau /
analyzed: tvam kutsena abhi śuṣṇam indra aśuṣam yudhya kuyavam gaviṣṭau
translated: With Kutsa thou, O Indra, hast fought with Sushna, the wicked, the greedy, in the contest for the cow.

original: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaś cakram avive rapāṃsi //
analyzed: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaḥ cakram aviveḥ rapāṃsi
translated: At the tenth libation of the sun thou hast stolen away the demon's wheel and his powers.

original: tvaṃ śatāny ava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni dasyoḥ /
analyzed: tvam śatāni ava śambarasya puraḥ jaghantha apratīni dasyoḥ
translated: Thou hast smitten down the forts of Samvara by hundreds, the unassailable forts of the Dasyu.

original: aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya gṛṇate vasūni //
analyzed: aśikṣaḥ yatra śacyā śacīvas divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya gṛṇate vasūni
translated: Where, O mighty one, thou hast learned the mighty deeds, for Divodasa who presses the Soma, for the singing Bharadvaja, to bestow treasures.

original: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya ratham ā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam /🔽yāhi prapathinn avasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ //🔽apūrvyā purutamāny asmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya /
analyzed: sa satya satvan mahate raṇāya ratham ā tiṣṭha tuvi nṛmṇa bhīmam  yāhi prapathin avasā upa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ  apūrvyā purutamāni asmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya
translated: O true hero, mount thy very strong and terrible chariot for the great battle.🔽Go, O traveller, with wealth and with a good friend. Proclaim and make known to the people.🔽To him, the most ancient, the most excellent, the great hero, the strong, the impetuous,

original: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsy āsā sthavirāya takṣam //
analyzed: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsi āsā sthavirāya takṣam
translated: To the mighty one, to the wielder of the thunderbolt, fashion words of praise.

original: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnām avāsayad rujad adriṃ gṛṇānaḥ /🔽svādhībhir ṛkvabhir vāvaśāna ud usriyāṇām asṛjan nidānam //🔽sa vahnibhir ṛkvabhir goṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jigāya /
analyzed: sa mātarā sūryeṇa kavīnām avāsayat rujat adrim gṛṇānaḥ  su ādhībhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvaśānaḥ ud usriyāṇām asṛjat nidānam  sa vahnibhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ goṣu śaśvat mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jigāya
translated: He, with the mothers, with the sun, the sages, dwelling, singing, splitting the rock.🔽With his own people, with the Rkv-s, eager, he has brought forth the source of the milch-kine.🔽He, with the priests, with the Rkv-s, always among the cows, with the well-kneeling ones, has won great victories.

original: puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san //
analyzed: puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
translated: The breaker of forts, the friend of friends, the strong one, has burst the firm forts, being a sage with the sages.

original: sa nīvyābhir jaritāram acchā maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ /
analyzed: sa nīvyābhiḥ jaritāram acchā mahaḥ vājebhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca śuṣmaiḥ
translated: He, with the Nīvya-s, with the singers, with the great prizes and great powers,

original: puruvīrābhir vṛṣabha kṣitīnām ā girvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi //
analyzed: puru vīrābhiḥ vṛṣabha kṣitīnām ā girvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi
translated: With the many heroes, O bull of the people, O lover of song, go for our welfare.

original: sa sargeṇa śavasā takto atyair apa indro dakṣiṇatas turāṣāṭ /
analyzed: sa sargeṇa śavasā taktaḥ atyaiḥ apa indraḥ dakṣiṇatas turāṣāh
translated: He, with the creation, with the strength, urged on by the horses, Indra, the conqueror, from the right,

original: itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛd arthaṃ divedive viviṣur apramṛṣyam //
analyzed: itthā sṛjānāḥ anapāvṛt artham dive dive viviṣuḥ apramṛṣyam
translated: Thus creating, he has opened the door of wealth, which is to be found day by day, and cannot be taken away.

original: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṃ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭir dāsvān /
analyzed: yaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ indra tam su naḥ dāḥ madaḥ vṛṣan su abhiṣṭiḥ dāsvān
translated: O Indra, give us that most powerful joy, O bull, which is most helpful and bestows gifts,

original: sauvaśvyaṃ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahad amitrān //🔽tvāṃ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau /🔽tvaṃ viprebhir vi paṇīṃr aśāyas tvota it sanitā vājam arvā //
analyzed: sauvaśvyam yaḥ vanavat su aśvaḥ vṛtrā samatsu sāsahat amitrān  tvām hi indra avase vivācaḥ havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau  tvam viprebhiḥ vi paṇīn aśāyaḥ tvotaḥ id sanitā vājam arvā
translated: Which is connected with good horses, which is like a forest, which conquers with good horses, which overcomes enemies in battles.🔽For you, O Indra, the people call out for help in the battle for heroic deeds, with the priests.🔽You have defeated the enemies with the priests. You, the invoked one, bring the prize to us.

original: tvaṃ tāṃ indrobhayāṃ amitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇy āryā ca śūra /
analyzed: tvam tām indra ubhayān amitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇi āryā ca śūra
translated: You, O Indra, have killed those two enemies, the Dasyus and Vr̥itras, and the noble ones, O hero,

original: vadhīr vaneva sudhitebhir atkair ā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṃ nṛtama //
analyzed: vadhīḥ vanā iva sudhitebhiḥ atkaiḥ ā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇām nṛtama
translated: With your well-placed weapons, as if with a forest. You have shown yourself in the battles of men, O best of men.

original: sa tvaṃ na indrākavābhir ūtī sakhā viśvāyur avitā vṛdhe bhūḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra akavābhiḥ ūtī sakhā viśvāyuḥ avitā vṛdhe bhūḥ
translated: You, O Indra, with your helpful aids, be a friend to all, a protector for prosperity.

original: svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitā pṛtsu śūra //
analyzed: svarṣātā yat hvayāmasi tvā yudhyantaḥ nemadhitā pṛtsu śūra
translated: When we praise you, O self-dependent one, fighting, seeking victory in battles, O hero.

original: nūnaṃ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḷīka uta no abhiṣṭau /
analyzed: nūnam naḥ indra aparāya ca syāḥ bhava mṛḍīke uta naḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: Now, O Indra, be good to us in the future, and be gracious to us in the present.

original: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye goṣatamāḥ //
analyzed: itthā gṛṇantaḥ mahinasya śarman divi syāma pārye goṣatamāḥ
translated: Praising thus, may we dwell in the heaven, in the protection of the great one, best in possessing cattle.

original: saṃ ca tve jagmur gira indra pūrvīr vi ca tvad yanti vibhvo manīṣāḥ /
analyzed: sam ca tve jagmuḥ giraḥ indra pūrvīḥ vi ca tvat yanti vibhvaḥ manīṣāḥ
translated: And to thee have come many songs, O Indra, and from thee go forth the thoughts of the All-pervading One.

original: purā nūnaṃ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇām paspṛdhra indre adhy ukthārkā //
analyzed: purā nūnam ca stutayaḥ ṛṣīṇām paspṛdhre indre adhi ukthā arkā
translated: Before this day the praises of the Rishis have contended for the sake of Indra, for the sake of the hymns.

original: puruhūto yaḥ purugūrta ṛbhvāṃ ekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ /
analyzed: puruhūtaḥ yaḥ puru gūrtaḥ ṛbhvān ekaḥ puru praśastaḥ asti yajñaiḥ
translated: He who is invoked by many, praised by many, the mighty one, who alone is extolled by many through sacrifices,

original: ratho na mahe śavase yujāno 'smābhir indro anumādyo bhūt //
analyzed: rathaḥ na mahe śavase yujānaḥ smābhiḥ indraḥ anumādyaḥ bhūt
translated: Like a chariot harnessed for great strength, may Indra be gladdened by us.

original: na yaṃ hiṃsanti dhītayo na vāṇīr indraṃ nakṣantīd abhi vardhayantīḥ /
analyzed: na yam hiṃsanti dhītayaḥ na vāṇīḥ indram nakṣanti id abhi vardhayantīḥ
translated: Whom the hymns and the songs do not injure, whom the praises, coming to him, do not exalt,

original: yadi stotāraḥ śataṃ yat sahasraṃ gṛṇanti girvaṇasaṃ śaṃ tad asmai //
analyzed: yadi stotāraḥ śatam yat sahasram gṛṇanti girvaṇasam śam tat asmai
translated: If a hundred or a thousand praisers sing to the lover of praise, that is good for him.

original: asmā etad divy arceva māsā mimikṣa indre ny ayāmi somaḥ /
analyzed: asmai etat divi arcā iva māsā mimikṣe indre ni ayāmi somaḥ
translated: This Soma I mix for him in the sky, like the monthly oblation, for Indra.

original: janaṃ na dhanvann abhi saṃ yad āpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhur havanāni yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: janam na dhanvan abhi sam yat āpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhuḥ havanāni yajñaiḥ
translated: As the people in the desert come together when the waters have gathered, so by the sacrifices they have always increased the invocations.

original: asmā etan mahy āṅgūṣam asmā indrāya stotram matibhir avāci /
analyzed: asmai etat mahi āṅgūṣam asmai indrāya stotram matibhiḥ avāci
translated: For him I have uttered this eulogy, this praise to Indra with my thoughts.

original: asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyur avitā vṛdhaś ca //
analyzed: asat yathā mahati vṛtratūrye indraḥ viśvāyuḥ avitā vṛdhaḥ ca
translated: Let it be as if for the great victory over Vritra, Indra, the life of all, the protector and the increaser.

original: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyaṃ dāḥ /
analyzed: kadā bhuvan ratha kṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasra poṣyam dāḥ
translated: When will there be chariot-destroying battles? When will you give a thousandfold reward for the praise?

original: kadā stomaṃ vāsayo 'sya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ //
analyzed: kadā stomam vāsayaḥ sya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vāja ratnāḥ
translated: When will you clothe this one with praise and wealth? When will you make his thoughts rich in booty?

original: karhi svit tad indra yan nṛbhir nṝn vīrair vīrān nīḷayāse jayājīn /
analyzed: karhi svid tat indra yat nṛbhiḥ nṝn vīraiḥ vīrān nīḍayāse jaya ājīn
translated: When, O Indra, will you unite men with men, heroes with heroes, the victorious with the unconquered,

original: tridhātu gā adhi jayāsi goṣv indra dyumnaṃ svarvad dhehy asme //
analyzed: tri dhātu gāḥ adhi jayāsi goṣu indra dyumnam svarvat dhehi asme
translated: With the three-fold cattle, O Indra, in the cows? Bring us the glory that is in heaven.

original: karhi svit tad indra yaj jaritre viśvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha /
analyzed: karhi svid tat indra yat jaritre viśvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha
translated: When, O Indra, most powerful, will you do for the singer who worships with all his heart the deed?

original: kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā gomaghā havanāni gacchāḥ //🔽sa gomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ /
