analyzed: kadā dhiyaḥ na niyutaḥ yuvāse kadā go maghā havanāni gacchāḥ  sa go maghāḥ jaritre aśva ścandrāḥ vāja śravasaḥ adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ
translated: When will you yoke your thoughts like teams? When will you come to the offerings rich in cattle?🔽Bestow upon the singer, O Indra, cattle and horses bright as the moon, and food,

original: pīpihīṣaḥ sudughām indra dhenum bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ //
analyzed: pīpihi iṣaḥ su dughām indra dhenum bharadvājeṣu su rucaḥ rurucyāḥ
translated: Milk the milch-cow well for the Bharadvājas, O Indra, make the songs most delightful.

original: tam ā nūnaṃ vṛjanam anyathā cic chūro yac chakra vi duro gṛṇīṣe /
analyzed: tam ā nūnam vṛjanam anyathā cit śūraḥ yat śakra vi duraḥ gṛṇīṣe
translated: That troop, O Indra, which thou, O mighty one, now leadest to the singer, to the house,

original: mā nir araṃ śukradughasya dhenor āṅgirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva //
analyzed: mā niḥ aram śukra dughasya dhenoḥ āṅgirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva
translated: Do not lead away from the bright-milking cow of the Angirases. O Brahmana, quicken the singers with the Brahman.

original: satrā madāsas tava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo 'dha ye pārthivāsaḥ /🔽satrā vājānām abhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam //
analyzed: satrā madāsaḥ tava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyaḥ dha ye pārthivāsaḥ  satrā vājānām abhavaḥ vibhaktā yat deveṣu dhārayathāḥ asuryam
translated: The joys of all men are ever thine, the riches that are on earth are ever thine.🔽Thou art ever the distributor of strength, when thou supportest among the gods the nature of the gods.

original: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya /
analyzed: anu pra yeje janaḥ ojaḥ asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya
translated: The people have ever worshipped his strength, they have ever submitted to him for his hero might.

original: syūmagṛbhe dudhaye 'rvate ca kratuṃ vṛñjanty api vṛtrahatye //
analyzed: syūmagṛbhe dudhaye rvate ca kratum vṛñjanti api vṛtra hatye
translated: They choose his will for the seizing of the steed and the milking of the cow, even for the slaying of Vr̥itra.

original: taṃ sadhrīcīr ūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścur indram /
analyzed: tam sadhrīcīḥ ūtayaḥ vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścuḥ indram
translated: The manly powers, the virile forces, the teams have hastened to Indra, the right-handed.

original: samudraṃ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṃ gira ā viśanti //
analyzed: samudram na sindhavaḥ uktha śuṣmāḥ uru vyacasam giraḥ ā viśanti
translated: As the streams to the ocean, so the hymns of praise enter him who is of wide expanse.

original: sa rāyas khām upa sṛjā gṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvam indra vasvaḥ /
analyzed: sa rāyaḥ khām upa sṛja gṛṇānaḥ puru ścandrasya tvam indra vasvaḥ
translated: Pour out to him the gift of wealth, while thou art praised. Thou, O Indra, art the lord of the wealth of the very glorious one.

original: patir babhūthāsamo janānām eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā //
analyzed: patiḥ babhūtha asamaḥ janānām ekaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translated: Thou hast become the unequalled lord of men, the sole king of all the world.

original: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyur dyaur na bhūmābhi rāyo aryaḥ /
analyzed: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yaḥ duvoyuḥ dyauḥ na bhūmā abhi rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Listen, thou who art to be invoked, to the invocation of him who is fain to serve thee. Let not the noble wealth of the pious be far from us.

original: aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yugeyuge vayasā cekitānaḥ //
analyzed: asaḥ yathā naḥ śavasā cakānaḥ yuge yuge vayasā cekitānaḥ
translated: As thou art fain to do so, O thou who art to be invoked, in every age, O thou who art to be looked to, in every age.

original: arvāg rathaṃ viśvavāraṃ ta ugrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu /
analyzed: arvāk ratham viśva vāram te ugra indra yuktāsaḥ harayaḥ vahantu
translated: O Indra, let thy bay steeds, yoked, bring hitherward the car that gives all boons, O mighty one.

original: kīriś cid dhi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādas te adya //
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādaḥ te adya
translated: For even the Kirin calls on thee, O thou who lovest light: may we this day rejoice with thee.

original: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāgman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan /
analyzed: pra u droṇe harayaḥ karma agman punānāsaḥ ṛjyantaḥ abhūvan
translated: The tawny ones have come to the trough, purified, they have become straight.

original: indro no asya pūrvyaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā //
analyzed: indraḥ naḥ asya pūrvyaḥ papīyāt dyukṣaḥ madasya somyasya rājā
translated: Indra is the first to enjoy this, O bountiful one; he is the king of the heavenly, of the Soma-drink.

original: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānam acchendraṃ sucakre rathyāso aśvāḥ /
analyzed: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānam acchā indram su cakre rathyāsaḥ aśvāḥ
translated: The well-wheeled horses, going straight, have approached Indra, the powerful one.

original: abhi śrava ṛjyanto vaheyur nū cin nu vāyor amṛtaṃ vi dasyet //
analyzed: abhi śravaḥ ṛjyantaḥ vaheyuḥ nu cit nu vāyoḥ amṛtam vi dasyet
translated: They should carry him to glory, made straight; would he not give up the immortal of Vayu?

original: variṣṭho asya dakṣiṇām iyartīndro maghonāṃ tuvikūrmitamaḥ /🔽yayā vajrivaḥ pariyāsy aṃho maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn //🔽indro vājasya sthavirasya dātendro gīrbhir vardhatāṃ vṛddhamahāḥ /
analyzed: variṣṭhaḥ asya dakṣiṇām iyarti indraḥ maghonām tuvikūrmitamaḥ  yayā vajrivas pariyāsi aṃhaḥ maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn  indraḥ vājasya sthavirasya dātā indraḥ gīrbhiḥ vardhatām vṛddha mahāḥ
translated: He directs the most excellent gift to the south, Indra, most powerful of the bountiful ones.🔽By which, O wielder of the thunderbolt, thou hast overcome this misfortune, and, O daring one, thou bestowest riches and honourest the princes.🔽Indra, the giver of mighty strength, may Indra, of increased greatness, be exalted by the songs.

original: indro vṛtraṃ haniṣṭho astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram haniṣṭhaḥ astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ
translated: May Indra be the best slayer of Vritra, the prince satisfies the eager one.

original: apād ita ud u naś citratamo mahīm bharṣad dyumatīm indrahūtim /
analyzed: apāt itas ud u naḥ citratamaḥ mahīm bharṣat dyumatīm indra hūtim
translated: From here he has risen, the most wonderful one, bearing the great, glorious call to Indra.

original: panyasīṃ dhītiṃ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṃ vanate sudānuḥ //
analyzed: panyasīm dhītim daivyasya yāmam janasya rātim vanate sudānuḥ
translated: The bountiful one obtains the most excellent thought of the divine one, the gift of the people.

original: dūrāc cid ā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣād indrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ /
analyzed: dūrāt cit ā vasataḥ asya karṇā ghoṣāt indrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ
translated: Even from afar his ears hear the voice of him who speaks, the voice of Indra, from afar.

original: eyam enaṃ devahūtir vavṛtyān madryag indram iyam ṛcyamānā //
analyzed: ā iyam enam deva hūtiḥ vavṛtyāt madryak indram iyam ṛcyamānā
translated: Let this invocation of the gods turn him hither, this hymn of mine turn hither Indra.

original: taṃ vo dhiyā paramayā purājām ajaram indram abhy anūṣy arkaiḥ /🔽brahmā ca giro dadhire sam asmin mahāṃś ca stomo adhi vardhad indre //
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā paramayā purājām ajaram indram abhī anūṣi arkaiḥ  brahmā ca giraḥ dadhire sam asmin mahān ca stomaḥ adhi vardhat indre
translated: Him, the ancient, whom you have with highest thought, Indra, whom you have with hymns, the undecaying,🔽Him have the prayers and hymns of praise laid hold of, and the great laudation hath increased in Indra.

original: vardhād yaṃ yajña uta soma indraṃ vardhād brahma gira ukthā ca manma /
analyzed: vardhāt yam yajñaḥ uta somaḥ indram vardhāt brahma giraḥ ukthā ca manma
translated: Let sacrifice, and Soma, and Indra increase; let prayer, and hymns, and holy verse increase.

original: vardhāhainam uṣaso yāmann aktor vardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram //🔽evā jajñānaṃ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṃ rādhase ca śrutāya /
analyzed: vardha aha enam uṣasaḥ yāman aktoḥ vardhān māsāḥ śaradaḥ dyāvaḥ indram  eva jajñānam sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānam rādhase ca śrutāya
translated: Let the dawns increase him in the way of the sun; let the months, the autumns, the heavens increase Indra.🔽So may we serve the mighty one, born for strength, grown great for bounty and for fame, O Indra,

original: mahām ugram avase vipra nūnam ā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu //🔽mandrasya kaver divyasya vahner vipramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ /
analyzed: mahām ugram avase vipra nūnam ā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu  mandrasya kaveḥ divyasya vahneḥ vipra manmanaḥ vacanasya madhvaḥ
translated: The great one, the strong one, for help, O sage, in battles where spoil is won.🔽Of the sweet voice of the delightful sage, of the divine carrier, of the sage, of the sweet speech,

original: apā nas tasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva gṛṇate goagrāḥ //
analyzed: apāḥ naḥ tasya sacanasya deva iṣaḥ yuvasva gṛṇate go agrāḥ
translated: Of that song of his, O God, do thou, O Indra, the winner of the spoil, be the partaker, the singer's.

original: ayam uśānaḥ pary adrim usrā ṛtadhītibhir ṛtayug yujānaḥ /
analyzed: ayam uśānaḥ pari adrim usrāḥ ṛta dhītibhiḥ ṛta yuj yujānaḥ
translated: This Uśanâ, yoking with those who have the law of truth, hath gone round the mountain with the cows,

original: rujad arugṇaṃ vi valasya sānum paṇīṃr vacobhir abhi yodhad indraḥ //🔽ayaṃ dyotayad adyuto vy aktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indur indra /
analyzed: rujat a rugṇam vi valasya sānum paṇīn vacobhiḥ abhi yodhat indraḥ  ayam dyotayat adyutaḥ vi aktūn doṣā vastoḥ śaradaḥ induḥ indra
translated: This one hath shone forth, the shining one, the lights, the dawns, the nights, the autumn, the moon, O Indra.🔽This one have they set as the sign of the days: he hath made the dawns, born of the pure one.🔽This one hath shone forth, the shining one, the lights, the dawns, the nights, the autumn, the moon, O Indra.🔽This one hath shone forth, the shining one, the lights, the dawns, the nights, the autumn, the moon, O Indra.

original: imaṃ ketum adadhur nū cid ahnāṃ śucijanmana uṣasaś cakāra //🔽ayaṃ rocayad aruco rucāno 'yaṃ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrvīḥ /

analyzed: tam u te gāvaḥ naraḥ āpaḥ adriḥ indum sam ahyan pītaye sam asmai

original: samiddhe agnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: samiddhe agnau sute indra some ā tvā vahantu harayaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ
translated: In the well-kindled fire, O Indra, the pressed Soma, let thy swiftest steeds bring thee.

original: tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ //
analyzed: tvāyatā manasā johavīmi indra ā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ
translated: I invoke thee with this thought, O Indra, come to us for great prosperity.

original: ā yāhi śaśvad uśatā yayāthendra mahā manasā somapeyam /
analyzed: ā yāhi śaśvat uśatā yayātha indra mahā manasā soma peyam
translated: Come hither, as thou lovest, thou hast ever come, O Indra, with great spirit to the Soma feast.

original: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā no 'thā te yajñas tanve vayo dhāt //
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇave imā naḥ thā te yajñaḥ tanve vayaḥ dhāt
translated: Listen to our prayers, and let thy sacrifice give strength to thy body.

original: yad indra divi pārye yad ṛdhag yad vā sve sadane yatra vāsi /
analyzed: yat indra divi pārye yat ṛdhak yat vā sve sadane yatra vā asi
translated: If thou art in the heaven, O Indra, in the firmament, or in thy own abode, wherever thou mayest be,

original: ato no yajñam avase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ //🔽aheḷamāna upa yāhi yajñaṃ tubhyam pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ /
analyzed: atas naḥ yajñam avase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ  a heḍamānaḥ upa yāhi yajñam tubhyam pavante indavaḥ sutāsaḥ
translated: From thence, O thou of the team, come thou to our sacrifice, protect it, O thou that lovest the song, in harmony with the Maruts.🔽Come to the sacrifice unwearied: for thee the drops, the pressed (Soma), are purified.

original: gāvo na vajrin svam oko acchendrā gahi prathamo yajñiyānām //
analyzed: gāvaḥ na vajrin svam okaḥ acchā indra ā gahi prathamaḥ yajñiyānām
translated: O Indra, the cows have come to their own stall: O Indra, come as the first of those worthy of sacrifice.

original: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim /🔽tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryur asthāt saṃ te vajro vartatām indra gavyuḥ //
analyzed: yā te kākud su kṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhvaḥ ūrmim  tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryuḥ asthāt sam te vajraḥ vartatām indra gavyuḥ
translated: O thou of the beautiful gait, that best, that most excellent of thy deeds, whereby thou ever drinkest the wave of mead,🔽With that (deed) protect us: the Adhvaryu hath sat down for thee: let thy thunderbolt, O Indra, that bringeth kine, turn hitherward.

original: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe sam akāri somaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa drapsaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ viśva rūpaḥ indrāya vṛṣṇe sam akāri somaḥ
translated: This drop, the bull, of all forms, hath been made ready for Indra the mighty, the Soma.

original: etam piba hariva sthātar ugra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yas te annam //
analyzed: etam piba harivas sthātar ugra yasya īśiṣe pradivi yaḥ te annam
translated: Drink this, O mighty one, O Lord of bays, of which thou hast the lordship, which is thy food on earth.

original: sutaḥ somo asutād indra vasyān ayaṃ śreyāñ cikituṣe raṇāya /
analyzed: sutaḥ somaḥ a sutāt indra vasyān ayam śreyān cikituṣe raṇāya
translated: The pressed Soma is better than the unpressed, O Indra, this is more excellent for the wise one to enjoy.

original: etaṃ titirva upa yāhi yajñaṃ tena viśvās taviṣīr ā pṛṇasva //
analyzed: etam titirvaḥ upa yāhi yajñam tena viśvāḥ taviṣīḥ ā pṛṇasva
translated: Come to this sacrifice, O Tirtīvr, fill thyself with all powers by this (sacrifice).

original: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhy arvāṅ araṃ te somas tanve bhavāti /
analyzed: hvayāmasi tvā indra yāhi arvāṅ aram te somaḥ tanve bhavāti
translated: We invoke thee, O Indra, come hither on the swift one; this Soma shall be agreeable to thy body.

original: śatakrato mādayasvā suteṣu prāsmāṃ ava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu //
analyzed: śatakrato mādayasva suteṣu pra asmān ava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu
translated: O thou of a hundred powers, rejoice in the juices; protect us in battles and in contests.

original: praty asmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara /
analyzed: prati asmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara
translated: Bring to this wise one who longs for it all the treasures,

original: araṅgamāya jagmaye 'paścāddaghvane nare //
analyzed: araṅgamāya jagmaye paścāddaghvane nare
translated: to the man who goes to the distant noise, to the one who goes to the far-off.

original: em enam pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam /
analyzed: ā īm enam pratyetana somebhiḥ soma pātamam
translated: Come to him with the Somas, to the one who drinks the Somas,

original: amatrebhir ṛjīṣiṇam indraṃ sutebhir indubhiḥ //
analyzed: amatrebhiḥ ṛjīṣiṇam indram sutebhiḥ indubhiḥ
translated: to Indra with the Amātras, the vigorous one, with the pressed Indras.

original: yadī sutebhir indubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha /
analyzed: yadī sutebhiḥ indubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha
translated: When you are adorned with the pressed Indras, with the Somas,

original: vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṃtam id eṣate //
analyzed: veda viśvasya medhiraḥ dhṛṣat taṃtam id eṣate
translated: the wise one knows all, the bold one seeks him out.

original: asmāasmā id andhaso 'dhvaryo pra bharā sutam /
analyzed: asmai asmai id andhasaḥ dhvaryo pra bhara sutam
translated: O Adhvaryu, bring to him, to him, this pressed Soma.

original: kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato 'bhiśaster avasparat //
analyzed: kuvid samasya jenyasya śardhataḥ bhiśasteḥ avasparat
translated: Will he not ward off the curse of this noble one, of the impetuous one?

original: yasya tyac chambaram made divodāsāya randhayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya tyad śambaram made divodāsāya randhayaḥ
translated: Whose, O Indra, thou madest to tremble in thy joy, and didst give up to Divodasa,

original: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba //
analyzed: ayam sa somaḥ indra te sutaḥ piba
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, drink!

original: yasya tīvrasutam madam madhyam antaṃ ca rakṣase /
analyzed: yasya tīvra sutam madam madhyam antam ca rakṣase
translated: Whose strong-pressed rapture thou guardest in the middle and at the end,

original: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba //
analyzed: ayam sa somaḥ indra te sutaḥ piba
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, drink!

analyzed: yasya gāḥ antar aśmanaḥ made dṛḍhāḥ avāsṛjaḥ
translated: Whose cows, in the rapture of the stone, thou didst loose from the firm bonds,

original: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba //
analyzed: ayam sa somaḥ indra te sutaḥ piba
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, drink!

original: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṃ dadhiṣe śavaḥ /
analyzed: yasya mandānaḥ andhasaḥ māghonam dadhiṣe śavaḥ
translated: Whose, rejoicing in the juice, thou dost lay up the strength of the Maghavan,

original: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba //
analyzed: ayam sa somaḥ indra te sutaḥ piba
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, drink!

original: yo rayivo rayintamo yo dyumnair dyumnavattamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rayivas rayintamaḥ yaḥ dyumnaiḥ dyumnavattamaḥ
translated: Who is most wealthy of the wealthy, who is most glorious of the glorious,

analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ saḥ indra te sti svadhā pate madaḥ
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, the gladdening drink, O Lord of the Swift Ones!

analyzed: yaḥ śagmaḥ tuvi śagma te rāyaḥ dāmā matīnām
translated: Who is the most prosperous of thy prosperous, the best giver of wealth of thy thoughts,

analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ saḥ indra te sti svadhā pate madaḥ
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra, the gladdening drink, O Lord of the Swift Ones!

analyzed: yena vṛddhaḥ na śavasā turaḥ na svābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ

original: indraṃ viśvāsāhaṃ naram maṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim //🔽yaṃ vardhayantīd giraḥ patiṃ turasya rādhasaḥ /
analyzed: indram viśvāsāham naram maṃhiṣṭham viśvacarṣaṇim  yam vardhayanti id giraḥ patim turasya rādhasaḥ
translated: Indra, the all-supporting man, the most bountiful, the all-impelling.🔽Him whom these songs exalt, the lord of swift bounty,

original: tam in nv asya rodasī devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ //🔽tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi /
analyzed: tam id nu asya rodasī devī śuṣmam saparyataḥ  tat vaḥ ukthasya barhaṇā indrāya upastṛṇīṣaṇi
translated: Him, verily, these two divine worlds worship for his strength.🔽That I may spread out for Indra the hymn's praise,

original: vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ //
analyzed: vipaḥ na yasya ūtayaḥ vi yat rohanti sakṣitaḥ
translated: Whose thoughts, like birds, fly forth from him who is exalted.

original: avidad dakṣam mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait /🔽sasavān staulābhir dhautarībhir uruṣyā pāyur abhavat sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: avidat dakṣam mitraḥ navīyān papānaḥ devebhyaḥ vasyaḥ acait  sasavān staulābhiḥ dhautarībhiḥ uruṣyā pāyuḥ abhavat sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Mitra has found the newer skill, and, drinking, has become most dear to the gods.🔽With the strong-flowing, the purifying, he has become a protector to his friends.

original: ṛtasya pathi vedhā apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāso akran /
analyzed: ṛtasya pathi vedhāḥ apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāsaḥ akran
translated: The gods have made their minds ready for glory, on the path of holy order, in the place of worship.

original: dadhāno nāma maho vacobhir vapur dṛśaye venyo vy āvaḥ //🔽dyumattamaṃ dakṣaṃ dhehy asme sedhā janānām pūrvīr arātīḥ /🔽varṣīyo vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhir dhanasya sātāv asmāṃ aviḍḍhi //
analyzed: dadhānaḥ nāma mahaḥ vacobhiḥ vapuḥ dṛśaye venyaḥ vi āvaḥ  dyumattamam dakṣam dhehi asme sedha janānām pūrvīḥ arātīḥ  varṣīyaḥ vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhiḥ dhanasya sātau asmān aviḍḍhi
translated: The son of Vena has disclosed his form, bearing his great name by his words.🔽Bestow on us the most glorious skill, restrain the many hostilities of men.🔽Make our life longer by thy powers, help us to gain wealth.

original: indra tubhyam in maghavann abhūma vayaṃ dātre harivo mā vi venaḥ /
analyzed: indra tubhyam id maghavan abhūma vayam dātre harivas mā vi venaḥ
translated: O Indra, Maghavan, we are thine, thine to give, O thou of Bay steeds: be not thou forgetful.

original: nakir āpir dadṛśe martyatrā kim aṅga radhracodanaṃ tvāhuḥ //
analyzed: nakir āpiḥ dadṛśe martyatrā kim aṅga radhra codanam tvā āhuḥ
translated: No one has seen the mortal who has deceived you, why then do they call you the punisher of the niggard?

original: mā jasvane vṛṣabha no rarīthā mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma /🔽pūrvīṣ ṭa indra niṣṣidho janeṣu jahy asuṣvīn pra vṛhāpṛṇataḥ //
analyzed: mā jasvane vṛṣabha naḥ rarīthāḥ mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma  pūrvīḥ te indra niṣṣidhaḥ janeṣu jahi a suṣvīn pra vṛha apṛṇataḥ
translated: Do not be angry, O bull, in the battle, do not let us be harmed in your friendship, O wealthy one.🔽You have many barriers among the people, kill the sluggish, expand the generous.

original: ud abhrāṇīva stanayann iyartīndro rādhāṃsy aśvyāni gavyā /
analyzed: ud abhrāṇi iva stanayan iyarti indraḥ rādhāṃsi aśvyāni gavyā
translated: Like clouds, Indra moves, thundering, bringing gifts of horses and cattle.

original: tvam asi pradivaḥ kārudhāyā mā tvādāmāna ā dabhan maghonaḥ //
analyzed: tvam asi pradivaḥ kāru dhāyāḥ mā tvā adāmānaḥ ā dabhan maghonaḥ
translated: You are the giver of wealth, the supporter; let not the niggardly overcome you, O wealthy one.

original: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānām indrāya bhara sa hy asya rājā /
analyzed: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānām indrāya bhara sa hi asya rājā
translated: O Adhvaryu, O hero, bring forth the great Soma juices for Indra, for he is his king,

original: yaḥ pūrvyābhir uta nūtanābhir gīrbhir vāvṛdhe gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām //
analyzed: yaḥ pūrvyābhiḥ uta nūtanābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ vāvṛdhe gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
translated: Who has grown by the ancient and the new praises of the singing sages.

original: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvān indro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghāna /
analyzed: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvān indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghāna
translated: Knowing his many forms in this rapture, Indra has slain the unconquerable Vr̥itras.

original: tam u pra hoṣi madhumantam asmai somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai //
analyzed: tam u pra hoṣi madhumantam asmai somam vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai
translated: Bring forth that sweet one to him, the Soma to the hero with the beautiful teeth to drink.

original: pātā sutam indro astu somaṃ hantā vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ /
analyzed: pātā sutam indraḥ astu somam hantā vṛtram vajreṇa mandasānaḥ
translated: Let Indra drink the pressed Soma, the juice, slaying Vr̥itra with his thunderbolt, rejoicing.

original: gantā yajñam parāvataś cid acchā vasur dhīnām avitā kārudhāyāḥ //
analyzed: gantā yajñam parāvataḥ cit acchā vasuḥ dhīnām avitā kāru dhāyāḥ
translated: He comes to the sacrifice even from afar, the good protector of thoughts, the supporter of the poor.

original: idaṃ tyat pātram indrapānam indrasya priyam amṛtam apāyi /
analyzed: idam tyad pātram indra pānam indrasya priyam amṛtam apāyi
translated: This is the cup, dear to Indra, which Indra has drunk, the immortal drink.

original: matsad yathā saumanasāya devaṃ vy asmad dveṣo yuyavad vy aṃhaḥ //🔽enā mandāno jahi śūra śatrūñ jāmim ajāmim maghavann amitrān /
analyzed: matsat yathā saumanasāya devam vi asmat dveṣaḥ yuyavat vi aṃhaḥ  enā mandānaḥ jahi śūra śatrūm jāmim ajāmim maghavan amitrān
translated: Be thou with us, that we may delight in the God. Drive away from us hatred, drive away affliction.🔽Rejoicing in this, O Hero, slay the foes, the kinsman and the stranger, O bountiful one.🔽The invaders who come against us, O Indra, crush them down and slay them.🔽In these battles, O bountiful Indra, for us, make wide room for us, and easy access.

original: abhiṣeṇāṃ abhy ādediśānān parāca indra pra mṛṇā jahī ca //🔽āsu ṣmā ṇo maghavann indra pṛtsv asmabhyam mahi varivaḥ sugaṃ kaḥ /🔽apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣa indra sūrīn kṛṇuhi smā no ardham //
analyzed: abhiṣeṇām abhī ādediśānān parācaḥ indra pra mṛṇa jahi ca  āsu sma naḥ maghavan indra pṛtsu asmabhyam mahi varivaḥ su gam kaḥ  apām tokasya tanayasya jeṣe indra sūrīn kṛṇuhi smā naḥ ardham
translated: Be thou the victor of the offspring of the waters, of the son, O Indra. Make the princes our allies.

original: ā tvā harayo vṛṣaṇo yujānā vṛṣarathāso vṛṣaraśmayo 'tyāḥ /🔽asmatrāñco vṛṣaṇo vajravāho vṛṣṇe madāya suyujo vahantu //🔽ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇo droṇam asthur ghṛtapruṣo normayo madantaḥ /🔽indra pra tubhyaṃ vṛṣabhiḥ sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe bharanti vṛṣabhāya somam //

original: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśaṃ yadum /

analyzed: indraḥ jetā hitam dhanam

analyzed: na asya kṣīyante ūtayaḥ

analyzed: tvam ekasya vṛtrahan avitā dvayoḥ asi

original: utedṛśe yathā vayam //
analyzed: uta īdṛśe yathā vayam

analyzed: nṛbhiḥ su vīraḥ ucyase

original: sa rathena rathītamo 'smākenābhiyugvanā /
analyzed: sa rathena rathītamaḥ smākena abhiyugvanā
translated: That best of charioteers, with your chariot, O you who yoke your own,

original: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṃ dhanam //
analyzed: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitam dhanam
translated: you will win the wealth that is to be won, O victorious one.

original: ya eka it tam u ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṃ vicarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id tam u stuhi kṛṣṭīnām vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Sing praise to him who is alone, the most active of the people,

original: patir jajñe vṛṣakratuḥ //
analyzed: patiḥ jajñe vṛṣa kratuḥ
translated: the lord who is born with the strength of a bull.

original: yo gṛṇatām id āsithāpir ūtī śivaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: yaḥ gṛṇatām id āsitha āpiḥ ūtī śivaḥ sakhā
translated: He who is the protector and helper of those who sing his praises, the auspicious friend,

original: sa tvaṃ na indra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra mṛḍaya
translated: be gracious to us, O Indra.

original: dhiṣva vajraṃ gabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ /
analyzed: dhiṣva vajram gabhastyoḥ rakṣaḥ hatyāya vajrivas
translated: Sharpen the thunderbolt, O you whose hand wields the thunderbolt, for the slaying of the Rakshas,

original: sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: sāsahīṣṭhāḥ abhi spṛdhaḥ
translated: overcome the enemies.

original: pratnaṃ rayīṇāṃ yujaṃ sakhāyaṃ kīricodanam /
analyzed: pratnam rayīṇām yujam sakhāyam kīri codanam
translated: I invoke the ancient ally of the riches, the friend who is urged on by the Kīras,

original: brahmavāhastamaṃ huve //
analyzed: brahma vāhastamam huve
translated: the most excellent bearer of prayers.

original: sa hi viśvāni pārthivāṃ eko vasūni patyate /
analyzed: sa hi viśvāni pārthivān ekaḥ vasūni patyate
translated: For he alone rules over all the earthly treasures,

original: girvaṇastamo adhriguḥ //
analyzed: girvaṇastamaḥ adhriguḥ
translated: the most delightful in song, the unhindered.

original: sa no niyudbhir ā pṛṇa kāmaṃ vājebhir aśvibhiḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ ā pṛṇa kāmam vājebhiḥ aśvibhiḥ
translated: With your yokes, O lord of the people, fill our desire with strength, with horses,

original: gomadbhir gopate dhṛṣat //
analyzed: gomadbhiḥ gopate dhṛṣat
translated: with cattle, O bold one, O lord of cattle.

original: tad vo gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane /🔽śaṃ yad gave na śākine //
analyzed: tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane  śam yat gave na śākine
translated: Sing that to him, O friend, to the invoked, the strong one, when he is pressed,🔽when he is gracious to the cow, to the powerful one.

original: na ghā vasur ni yamate dānaṃ vājasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ
translated: No, the good one does not delay the gift of strength, of cattle,

original: yat sīm upa śravad giraḥ //
analyzed: yat sīm upa śravat giraḥ
translated: when he listens to our songs.

original: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṃ gomantaṃ dasyuhā gamat /
analyzed: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat
translated: May he, with his might, go to the cattle-rich abode of the Dasyu-slayer,

original: śacībhir apa no varat //
analyzed: śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat
translated: may he favor us with his favors.

original: imā u tvā śatakrato 'bhi pra ṇonuvur giraḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā śatakrato bhi pra nonuvuḥ giraḥ
translated: These songs, O Shatakratu, have resounded forth to thee,

original: indra vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ //
analyzed: indra vatsam na mātaraḥ
translated: Like mothers to their calf, O Indra.

original: dūṇāśaṃ sakhyaṃ tava gaur asi vīra gavyate /
analyzed: dūṇāśam sakhyam tava gauḥ asi vīra gavyate
translated: You are the cow, O hero, for the one who desires cattle, for your friendship is bountiful.

original: aśvo aśvāyate bhava //
analyzed: aśvaḥ aśvāyate bhava
translated: Be a horse for the one who desires horses.

original: sa mandasvā hy andhaso rādhase tanvā mahe /
analyzed: sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ rādhase tanvā mahe
translated: Do you rejoice in the juice, in the gift, with your body for the great,

original: na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ //
analyzed: na stotāram nide karaḥ
translated: Do not injure the praiser.

original: imā u tvā sutesute nakṣante girvaṇo giraḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā sute sute nakṣante girvaṇaḥ giraḥ
translated: These songs, O you who delight in praise, are longing for you, O you who are pressed well,

original: vatsaṃ gāvo na dhenavaḥ //
analyzed: vatsam gāvaḥ na dhenavaḥ
translated: Like cows for their calf.

original: purūtamam purūṇāṃ stotṝṇāṃ vivāci /
analyzed: purūtamam purūṇām stotṝṇām vivāci
translated: Most abundant of the many, in the songs of the singers,

original: vājebhir vājayatām //
analyzed: vājebhiḥ vājayatām
translated: Of those who delight in strength with their powers.

original: asmākam indra bhūtu te stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam indra bhūtu te stomaḥ vāhiṣṭhaḥ antamaḥ
translated: May your praise, O Indra, be most excellent and final for us,

original: asmān rāye mahe hinu //
analyzed: asmān rāye mahe hinu
translated: Lead us to great riches.

original: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnāṃ varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhann asthāt /🔽uruḥ kakṣo na gāṅgyaḥ //
analyzed: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnām varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhan asthāt  uruḥ kakṣaḥ na gāṅgyaḥ
translated: Bṛbu has stood on the highest head of the Paṇis,🔽Like the wide-spreading tree of the Ganges.

original: yasya vāyor iva dravad bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī /
analyzed: yasya vāyoḥ iva dravat bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī
translated: Whose bounty, like that of Vāyu, is swift, and excellent, and thousandfold,

original: sadyo dānāya maṃhate //
analyzed: sadyas dānāya maṃhate
translated: He is ready to give immediately.

original: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ /
analyzed: tat su naḥ viśve aryaḥ ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
translated: That, O all you Aryas, the singers always sing to us,

original: bṛbuṃ sahasradātamaṃ sūriṃ sahasrasātamam //
analyzed: bṛbum sahasra dātamam sūrim sahasra sātamam
translated: Bṛbu, the most bountiful giver of a thousand, the lord, the most bountiful giver of a thousand.

original: tvām id dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ /
analyzed: tvām id hi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ
translated: We indeed call upon you, O you who delight in the good, the singers,

original: tvāṃ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṃ naras tvāṃ kāṣṭhāsv arvataḥ //
analyzed: tvām vṛtreṣu indra satpatim naraḥ tvām kāṣṭhāsu arvataḥ
translated: You, O Indra, the lord of the brave in battles, you in the contests of the swift steed.

original: sa tvaṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ /🔽gām aśvaṃ rathyam indra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jigyuṣe //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ citra vajra hasta dhṛṣṇuyā mahaḥ stavānaḥ adrivas  gām aśvam rathyam indra sam kira satrā vājam na jigyuṣe
translated: You, O wondrous one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O bold one, O you who have mountains for your food,🔽Pour out for us, O Indra, the wealth that is to be won, the cow, the horse, the chariot, O you who are to be praised.

original: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇir indraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam /
analyzed: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇiḥ indram tam hūmahe vayam
translated: We invoke that Indra who is ever victorious, who is very active.

original: sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe //
analyzed: sahasra muṣka tuvi nṛmṇa satpate bhava samatsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: O you who have a thousand testicles, O you who are irresistible, O lord of the brave, be for our prosperity in battles.

original: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḷha ṛcīṣama /
analyzed: bādhase janān vṛṣabhā iva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḍhe ṛcīṣama
translated: You overpower the people with anger like a bull, O you who are impetuous and full of desire, O you who are full of energy.

original: asmākam bodhy avitā mahādhane tanūṣv apsu sūrye //
analyzed: asmākam bodhi avitā mahādhane tanūṣu apsu sūrye
translated: Be our protector in the great battle, in our bodies, in the waters, in the sun.

original: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharaṃ ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bhara ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ
translated: O Indra, bring us the most excellent, the most powerful, the most famous glory,

original: yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ //
analyzed: yena ime citra vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra prāḥ
translated: By which, O wondrous one, O you who have a beautiful brow and hold the thunderbolt in your hand, you have filled both these worlds.

original: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe /
analyzed: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇī saham rājan deveṣu hūmahe
translated: We invoke you, O mighty one, who are able to conquer the people, O king, among the gods.

original: viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso 'mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi //
analyzed: viśvā su naḥ vithurā pibdanā vaso mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
translated: O good one, crush all our misfortunes and difficulties, make our enemies easy to conquer.

original: yad indra nāhuṣīṣv āṃ ojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: yat indra nāhuṣīṣu ām ojaḥ nṛmṇam ca kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: O Indra, the strength and valor that you have among the sons of Nahusha and among the people,

original: yad vā pañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnam ā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā //
analyzed: yat vā pañca kṣitīnām dyumnam ā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā
translated: Or bring the splendour of the five earths, all manly powers in every contest.

original: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāv ā jane yat pūrau kac ca vṛṣṇyam /
analyzed: yat vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyau ā jane yat pūrau kad ca vṛṣṇyam
translated: Or what, O Maghavan, is in the two Tṛkṣus, in the people, in the two Pūraus, and in the two Vṛṣṇyaus,

original: asmabhyaṃ tad rirīhi saṃ nṛṣāhye 'mitrān pṛtsu turvaṇe //
analyzed: asmabhyam tat rirīhi sam nṛṣāhye mitrān pṛtsu turvaṇe
translated: Bestow that on us for the battle of men, in the contests, O Turvaṇa, against the enemies.

original: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat /
analyzed: indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastimat
translated: O Indra, the threefold refuge, with three protections, and prosperity,

original: chardir yaccha maghavadbhyaś ca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyum ebhyaḥ //
analyzed: chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyum ebhyaḥ
translated: Grant us shelter, O Maghavan, and drive away the lightning from these (men) and from me.

original: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhur abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā /🔽adha smā no maghavann indra girvaṇas tanūpā antamo bhava //
analyzed: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhuḥ abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā  adha smā naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ tanū pāḥ antamaḥ bhava
translated: Those who have attacked the enemy with a mind eager for cattle, who strike him down with daring,🔽Then, O Indra, O Maghavan, O you who love the song, be nearest to protect our bodies.

original: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyam avā yudhi /🔽yad antarikṣe patayanti parṇino didyavas tigmamūrdhānaḥ //
analyzed: adha smā naḥ vṛdhe bhava indra na ayam ava yudhi  yat antarikṣe patayanti parṇinaḥ didyavaḥ tigma mūrdhānaḥ
translated: Then be thou to increase our wealth, O Indra, this (man) to lead in the battle.🔽When the winged darts, with sharp heads, fly through the air.

original: yatra śūrāsas tanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām /
analyzed: yatra śūrāsaḥ tanvaḥ vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām
translated: Where the heroes spread out their bodies, the dear protection of the fathers,

original: adha smā yaccha tanve tane ca chardir acittaṃ yāvaya dveṣaḥ //
analyzed: adha smā yaccha tanve tane ca chardiḥ acittam yāvaya dveṣaḥ
translated: Then grant shelter to this body and to that, drive away the unmindful hatred.

original: yad indra sarge arvataś codayāse mahādhane /
analyzed: yat indra sarge arvataḥ codayāse mahādhane
translated: When, O Indra, thou drivest the horses in the creation, in the great wealth,

original: asamane adhvani vṛjine pathi śyenāṃ iva śravasyataḥ //🔽sindhūṃr iva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośam anu ṣvaṇi /
analyzed: asamane adhvani vṛjine pathi śyenām iva śravasyataḥ  sindhūṃr iva pravaṇaḥ āśuyā yataḥ yadi klośam anu svani
translated: On the uneven path, on the crooked way, like hawks eager for fame.🔽Like rivers rushing down a slope, if they go to a place of distress, to a narrow passage.

original: ā ye vayo na varvṛtaty āmiṣi gṛbhītā bāhvor gavi //
analyzed: ā ye vayaḥ na varvṛtati āmiṣi gṛbhītāḥ bāhvoḥ gavi
translated: Those who are seized by the arms, as if by a bird's wings, in the battle.

original: svāduṣ kilāyam madhumāṃ utāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavāṃ utāyam /
analyzed: svāduḥ kila ayam madhumān uta ayam tīvraḥ kila ayam rasavān uta ayam
translated: This one is indeed sweet, this one is full of honey, this one is indeed strong, this one is full of juice.

original: uto nv asya papivāṃsam indraṃ na kaś cana sahata āhaveṣu //
analyzed: uta u nu asya papivāṃsam indram na kaḥ cana sahate āhaveṣu
translated: And no one can withstand Indra, the drinker of this, in battles.

original: ayaṃ svādur iha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda /
analyzed: ayam svāduḥ iha madiṣṭhaḥ āsa yasya indraḥ vṛtra hatye mamāda
translated: This one, the sweetest, is here, the most intoxicating, whose Indra drank at the slaying of Vṛtra.

original: purūṇi yaś cyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṃ nava ca dehyo han //
analyzed: purūṇi yaḥ cyautnā śambarasya vi navatim nava ca dehyaḥ han
translated: And he who struck down many forts of Śambara, nine-and-ninety and nine.

original: ayam me pīta ud iyarti vācam ayam manīṣām uśatīm ajīgaḥ /
analyzed: ayam me pītaḥ ud iyarti vācam ayam manīṣām uśatīm ajīgaḥ
translated: This one, when drunk, raises up my speech; this one has brought to me the longing thought.

original: ayaṃ ṣaḷ urvīr amimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṃ kac canāre //
analyzed: ayam ṣaḍ urvīḥ amimīta dhīraḥ na yābhyaḥ bhuvanam kad cana āre
translated: This wise one has measured out the three wide realms, from which the world has never departed.

original: ayaṃ sa yo varimāṇam pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṃ divo akṛṇod ayaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa yaḥ varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ varṣmāṇam divaḥ akṛṇot ayam saḥ
translated: This is he who has made the extent of the earth and the height of the sky. This is he.

original: ayam pīyūṣaṃ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorv antarikṣam //
analyzed: ayam pīyūṣam tisṛṣu pravatsu somaḥ dādhāra uru antarikṣam
translated: This one, the milk, in the three far-extended worlds, the Soma, has upheld the wide atmosphere.

original: ayaṃ vidac citradṛśīkam arṇaḥ śukrasadmanām uṣasām anīke /
analyzed: ayam vidat citra dṛśīkam arṇaḥ śukra sadmanām uṣasām anīke
translated: This one has found the variegated-looking ocean, in the light of the dawns that have bright abodes.

original: ayam mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyām astabhnād vṛṣabho marutvān //
analyzed: ayam mahān mahatā skambhanena ud dyām astabhnāt vṛṣabhaḥ marutvān
translated: This great one, the Bull accompanied by the Maruts, has propped up the sky with great support.

original: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām /🔽mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayim asmāsu dhehi //
analyzed: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtra hā śūra samare vasūnām  mādhyandine savane ā vṛṣasva rayi sthānaḥ rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: Drink boldly from the jar, O Indra, the Soma, O hero, slayer of Vrtra, in the battle for treasures.🔽Be strong at the midday libation, O Indra, bestow wealth on us, O abode of wealth.

original: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṃ vasyo accha /🔽bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītir uta vāmanītiḥ //
analyzed: indra pra naḥ puraetā iva paśya pra naḥ naya prataram vasyaḥ accha  bhava su pāraḥ atipārayaḥ naḥ bhava su nītiḥ uta vāma nītiḥ
translated: O Indra, look upon us as one who goes before, lead us to a better place to cross over.🔽Be a good leader to us, a leader to cross over, be a good guide and a good leader.

original: uruṃ no lokam anu neṣi vidvān svarvaj jyotir abhayaṃ svasti /🔽ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā //
analyzed: urum naḥ lokam anu neṣi vidvān svarvat jyotiḥ abhayam svasti  ṛṣvā te indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā
translated: O wise one, lead us to a wide world, to the heavenly light, to safety and well-being.🔽O Indra, we will come to the lap of your lofty and mighty arms, O you of great power.

original: variṣṭhe na indra vandhure dhā vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvann aśvayor ā /
analyzed: variṣṭhe naḥ indra vandhure dhāḥ vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvan aśvayoḥ ā
translated: O Indra, place us on the best of yokes, O you of a hundred powers, on the best of yokes, on the two best horses.

original: iṣam ā vakṣīṣāṃ varṣiṣṭhām mā nas tārīn maghavan rāyo aryaḥ //
analyzed: iṣam ā vakṣi iṣām varṣiṣṭhām mā naḥ tārīt maghavan rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Bring us the most abundant food. Do not abandon us, O bountiful one, to the enemy's wealth.

original: indra mṛḷa mahyaṃ jīvātum iccha codaya dhiyam ayaso na dhārām /
analyzed: indra mṛḍa mahyam jīvātum iccha codaya dhiyam ayasaḥ na dhārām
translated: O Indra, be gracious to me, desire my life, impel my thought like a stream of iron.

original: yat kiṃ cāhaṃ tvāyur idaṃ vadāmi taj juṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam //
analyzed: yat kim ca aham tvāyuḥ idam vadāmi tat juṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam
translated: Whatever I say to you, O Indra, for this life, accept it and make me one who has the gods.

original: trātāram indram avitāram indraṃ havehave suhavaṃ śūram indram /🔽hvayāmi śakram puruhūtam indraṃ svasti no maghavā dhātv indraḥ //
analyzed: trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave su havam śūram indram  hvayāmi śakram puru hūtam indram svasti naḥ maghavā dhātu indraḥ
translated: Indra the saviour, Indra the protector, Indra the hero, swift to listen, in every need,🔽I call on Indra, the mighty, invoked by many. May Indra the bountiful grant us welfare.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavāṃ avobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā svavān avobhiḥ su mṛḷīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, be gracious to us with his favours, the all-knowing.

original: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //
analyzed: bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May he drive away hatred, may he make us fearless. May we be lords of good heroism.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma /🔽sa sutrāmā svavāṃ indro asme ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu //🔽ava tve indra pravato normir giro brahmāṇi niyuto dhavante /
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asme ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu  ava tve indra pravataḥ nā ūrmiḥ giraḥ brahmāṇi niyutaḥ dhavante
translated: May we enjoy the favour of that adorable one, and may we enjoy his gracious love.🔽May that good protector, that mighty Indra, drive away hatred from us even from afar.🔽O Indra, the wave of your inspiration, the prayers, the holy hymns, the teams of horses, come to you.

original: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇy apo gā vajrin yuvase sam indūn //
analyzed: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇi apaḥ gāḥ vajrin yuvase sam indūn
translated: You, O bountiful one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, take away the many libations, the waters, and the juices.

original: ka īṃ stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt ko yajāte yad ugram in maghavā viśvahāvet /
analyzed: kaḥ īm stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt kaḥ yajāte yat ugram id maghavā viśvahā avet
translated: Who will praise him? Who will satisfy him? Who will worship him, when the mighty Maghavan is so terrible to all?

original: pādāv iva praharann anyamanyaṃ kṛṇoti pūrvam aparaṃ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: pādau iva praharan anyam anyam kṛṇoti pūrvam aparam śacībhiḥ
translated: Like two feet he strikes one against the other, the former against the latter, with his powers.

original: śṛṇve vīra ugramugraṃ damāyann anyamanyam atinenīyamānaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇve vīraḥ ugram ugram damāyan anyam anyam atinenīyamānaḥ
translated: I hear the hero, the terrible one, subduing the terrible one, leading one against the other.

original: edhamānadviḷ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśa indro manuṣyān //
analyzed: edhamāna dviṣ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśaḥ indraḥ manuṣyān
translated: The King of both, he who waxes strong, is honoured by the people, Indra by men.

original: parā pūrveṣāṃ sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇo aparebhir eti /
analyzed: parā pūrveṣām sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇaḥ aparebhiḥ eti
translated: He rejects the friendship of the former, and with the latter comes, eager to destroy.

original: anānubhūtīr avadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīr indraḥ śaradas tartarīti //
analyzed: anānubhūtīḥ avadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīḥ indraḥ śaradaḥ tartarīti
translated: Shaking off the unapproachable, Indra passes over many autumns.

original: rūpaṃrūpam pratirūpo babhūva tad asya rūpam praticakṣaṇāya /
analyzed: rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ babhūva tat asya rūpam praticakṣaṇāya
translated: He became the counterpart of every form, that is his form for recognition.

original: indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate yuktā hy asya harayaḥ śatā daśa //
analyzed: indraḥ māyābhiḥ puru rūpaḥ īyate yuktāḥ hi asya harayaḥ śatāḥ daśa
translated: Indra moves with his illusions in many forms, for ten and hundred are his harnessed bays.

original: yujāno haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭeha rājati /
analyzed: yujānaḥ haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭā iha rājati
translated: Harnessing the two bays to the chariot, Tvastr shines here as king.

original: ko viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣa āsata utāsīneṣu sūriṣu //
analyzed: kaḥ viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣe āsate uta āsīneṣu sūriṣu
translated: Who is the friend of all the people, even of the seated princes?

original: agavyūti kṣetram āganma devā urvī satī bhūmir aṃhūraṇābhūt /
analyzed: agavyūti kṣetram āganma devāḥ urvī satī bhūmiḥ aṃhūraṇā abhūt
translated: We have come to the field of the battle of the gods, the earth, being wide, has become a place of slaughter.

original: bṛhaspate pra cikitsā gaviṣṭāv itthā sate jaritra indra panthām //
analyzed: bṛhaspate pra cikitsa gaviṣṭau itthā sate jaritre indra panthām
translated: O Brihaspati, show the way in the battle for the cows; O Indra, show the path to the sacrificer here.

original: divedive sadṛśīr anyam ardhaṃ kṛṣṇā asedhad apa sadmano jāḥ /
analyzed: dive dive sadṛśīḥ anyam ardham kṛṣṇāḥ asedhat apa sadmanaḥ jāḥ
translated: Day by day, the other half is like the black ones; she has driven away the children from their homes.

original: ahan dāsā vṛṣabho vasnayantodavraje varcinaṃ śambaraṃ ca //
analyzed: ahan dāsā vṛṣabhaḥ vasnayantā udavraje varcinam śambaram ca
translated: The bull has slain the Dasyus, the Vasnis, in the Udvara, Varchin and Sambara.

original: prastoka in nu rādhasas ta indra daśa kośayīr daśa vājino 'dāt /
analyzed: prastokaḥ id nu rādhasaḥ te indra daśa kośayīḥ daśa vājinaḥ dāt
translated: Indra, from Prastoka have I gained ten treasures, ten strong horses,

original: divodāsād atithigvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaraṃ vasu praty agrabhīṣma //
analyzed: divodāsāt atithigvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaram vasu prati agrabhīṣma
translated: And from Divodasa have I received the gift of Atithigva, the wealth of Sambara.

original: daśāśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrādhibhojanā /
analyzed: daśa aśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrā adhibhojanā
translated: Ten chariots, ten treasures, ten garments and provisions,

original: daśo hiraṇyapiṇḍān divodāsād asāniṣam //
analyzed: daśa u hiraṇya piṇḍān divodāsāt asāniṣam
translated: Ten lumps of gold have I gained from Divodasa.

original: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śataṃ gā atharvabhyaḥ /
analyzed: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śatam gāḥ atharvabhyaḥ
translated: Ten chariots with yokes, a hundred cows for the Atharvans,

original: aśvathaḥ pāyave 'dāt //
analyzed: aśvathaḥ pāyave dāt
translated: Ashvatha gave to Payayu.

original: mahi rādho viśvajanyaṃ dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayo abhy ayaṣṭa //
analyzed: mahi rādhaḥ viśvajanyam dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayaḥ abhī ayaṣṭa
translated: The Sarngas, bearing great wealth common to all men, have worshipped the Bharadvajas.

original: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgo hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: O tree, be strong-limbed, a friend to us, a good deliverer of brave men.

original: gobhiḥ saṃnaddho asi vīḷayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni //
analyzed: gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni
translated: You are bound with cows, be strong. Let him who stands by you win victories.

original: divas pṛthivyāḥ pary oja udbhṛtaṃ vanaspatibhyaḥ pary ābhṛtaṃ sahaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ pari ābhṛtam sahaḥ
translated: The strength gathered from heaven and earth, the might brought from the trees,

original: apām ojmānam pari gobhir āvṛtam indrasya vajraṃ haviṣā rathaṃ yaja //
analyzed: apām ojmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja
translated: The strength of the waters, surrounded by cows, Indra's thunderbolt, I worship with oblations as a chariot.

original: indrasya vajro marutām anīkam mitrasya garbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ
translated: The thunderbolt of Indra, the vanguard of the Maruts, the embryo of Mitra, the navel of Varuna,

original: semāṃ no havyadātiṃ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya //
analyzed: sa imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya
translated: Accept this offering of ours, O God-borne One, and take the oblations to the Gods.

original: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyām purutrā te manutāṃ viṣṭhitaṃ jagat /
analyzed: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyām purutrā te manutām viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Bellow to the earth and to the sky. Let the world that is spread out in many places know thee.

original: sa dundubhe sajūr indreṇa devair dūrād davīyo apa sedha śatrūn //
analyzed: sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn
translated: Thou, O drum, in unison with Indra and the Gods, drive away the enemies from afar, even from afar.

original: ā krandaya balam ojo na ā dhā ni ṣṭanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ ni stanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ
translated: Send forth thy voice, O drum, give us strength and vigour. Beat out the evil things that afflict us.

original: apa protha dundubhe ducchunā ita indrasya muṣṭir asi vīḷayasva //
analyzed: apa protha dundubhe ducchunāḥ itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva
translated: Roar forth, O drum, drive away evil. Thou art Indra's fist. Make it roar.

original: āmūr aja pratyāvartayemāḥ ketumad dundubhir vāvadīti /
analyzed: ā amūḥ aja pratyāvartaya imāḥ ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadīti
translated: Turn back these enemies, O drum. The drum sounds with a banner.

original: sam aśvaparṇāś caranti no naro 'smākam indra rathino jayantu //
analyzed: sam aśva parṇāḥ caranti naḥ naraḥ smākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu
translated: The men with winged horses move about for us. Let our chariot-warriors, O Indra, be victorious.

original: yajñāyajñā vo agnaye girāgirā ca dakṣase /🔽prapra vayam amṛtaṃ jātavedasam priyam mitraṃ na śaṃsiṣam //
analyzed: yajñāyajñāḥ vaḥ agnaye girā girā ca dakṣase  pra pra vayam amṛtam jātavedasam priyam mitram na śaṃsiṣam
translated: To the sacrifice of sacrifice, to your Agni, to Daksha, with each hymn, with each hymn,🔽We will extol the immortal, the all-knowing one, the dear friend.

original: ūrjo napātaṃ sa hināyam asmayur dāśema havyadātaye /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam sa hina ayam asmayuḥ dāśema havya dātaye
translated: The son of strength, for he is the protector of this people, we will serve him as one who brings oblations.

original: bhuvad vājeṣv avitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām //
analyzed: bhuvat vājeṣu avitā bhuvat vṛdhaḥ uta trātā tanūnām
translated: Be thou a helper in battles, be thou a prosperer, and a protector of our bodies.

original: vṛṣā hy agne ajaro mahān vibhāsy arciṣā /
analyzed: vṛṣā hi agne ajaraḥ mahān vibhāsi arciṣā
translated: For thou, O Agni, art a bull, undecaying, great, shining with thy flame,

original: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucac chuce sudītibhiḥ su dīdihi //
analyzed: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucat śuce su dītibhiḥ su dīdihi
translated: Shining with unwearied radiance, shine thou, O pure one, with fair splendours.

original: maho devān yajasi yakṣy ānuṣak tava kratvota daṃsanā /
analyzed: mahaḥ devān yajasi yakṣi ānuṣak tava kratvā uta daṃsanā
translated: Thou, O great one, worshippest the gods, thou shalt worship in due order. Thy wisdom and thy might

original: arvācaḥ sīṃ kṛṇuhy agne 'vase rāsva vājota vaṃsva //🔽yam āpo adrayo vanā garbham ṛtasya piprati /
analyzed: arvācaḥ sīm kṛṇuhi agne vase rāsva vājā uta vaṃsva  yam āpaḥ adrayaḥ vanā garbham ṛtasya piprati
translated: Turn hither to us, O Agni, for help. Give us wealth and food.🔽Whom the waters, the mountains, and the woods cherish as the germ of truth,

original: sahasā yo mathito jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyā adhi sānavi //
analyzed: sahasā yaḥ mathitaḥ jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyāḥ adhi sānavi
translated: Who is born by the men with violence, on the ridge of the earth, rubbed (produced)

original: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi /
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi
translated: Who hath filled with his light both the worlds, who with smoke goeth to the sky.

original: tiras tamo dadṛśa ūrmyāsv ā śyāvāsv aruṣo vṛṣā śyāvā aruṣo vṛṣā //
analyzed: tiras tamaḥ dadṛśe ūrmyāsu ā śyāvāsu aruṣaḥ vṛṣā śyāvāḥ aruṣaḥ vṛṣā
translated: He hath pierced through the darkness, he is seen in the waves, the ruddy bull in the dark-coloured (waters), the ruddy bull in the dark-coloured (waters).

original: bṛhadbhir agne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā /
analyzed: bṛhadbhiḥ agne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā
translated: With thy great flames, O Agni, with thy bright, O god, with thy shining (flame),

original: bharadvāje samidhāno yaviṣṭhya revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi //
analyzed: bharadvāje samidhānaḥ yaviṣṭhya revat naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
translated: Enkindled by Bharadvaja, O youngest (Agni), shine thou bright for us, O rich one, shine with thy radiant (flame), shine with thy glorious (flame).

original: viśvāsāṃ gṛhapatir viśām asi tvam agne mānuṣīṇām /
analyzed: viśvāsām gṛhapatiḥ viśām asi tvam agne mānuṣīṇām
translated: Thou art the lord of all the people, thou, O Agni, of the human (people).

original: śatam pūrbhir yaviṣṭha pāhy aṃhasaḥ sameddhāraṃ śataṃ himā stotṛbhyo ye ca dadati //
analyzed: śatam pūrbhiḥ yaviṣṭha pāhi aṃhasaḥ sameddhāram śatam himā stotṛbhyaḥ ye ca dadati
translated: Protect with a hundred ramparts from distress, O youngest (Agni), a hundred winters, him who kindles (the fire), and those who give to the praisers.

original: tvaṃ naś citra ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya /
analyzed: tvam naḥ citraḥ ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya
translated: Thou, O wondrous one, O good one, impel the gifts and the help (which we ask of thee).

original: asya rāyas tvam agne rathīr asi vidā gādhaṃ tuce tu naḥ //
analyzed: asya rāyaḥ tvam agne rathīḥ asi vida gādham tuce tu naḥ
translated: Thou art the charioteer of this wealth, O Agni; find the ford for our desire.

original: parṣi tokaṃ tanayam partṛbhiṣ ṭvam adabdhair aprayutvabhiḥ /
analyzed: parṣi tokam tanayam partṛbhiḥ tvam adabdhaiḥ aprayutvabhiḥ
translated: Thou carriest the child and offspring with thy saviour deities, infallible, unerring.

original: agne heḷāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi no 'devāni hvarāṃsi ca //
analyzed: agne heḍāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi naḥ devāni hvarāṃsi ca
translated: O Agni, keep from us the divine deceits and the human snares.

original: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughāṃ dhenum ajadhvam upa navyasā vacaḥ /
analyzed: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughām dhenum ajadhvam upa navyasā vacaḥ
translated: O friends, yoke ye the milch-cow who yields abundant milk; come nigh with a new song.

original: sṛjadhvam anapasphurām //🔽yā śardhāya mārutāya svabhānave śravo 'mṛtyu dhukṣata /
analyzed: sṛjadhvam an apasphurām  yā śardhāya mārutāya sva bhānave śravaḥ mṛtyu dhukṣata
translated: Unite ye the cow who never fails.🔽She who hath been milked for glory to the Marut host of splendid light,

original: yā mṛḷīke marutāṃ turāṇāṃ yā sumnair evayāvarī //🔽bharadvājāyāva dhukṣata dvitā /
analyzed: yā mṛḍīke marutām turāṇām yā sumnaiḥ eva yāvarī  bharadvājāya ava dhukṣata dvitā
translated: She who for the swift Maruts, for Mṛḷaka, who goeth his way with bliss,

original: dhenuṃ ca viśvadohasam iṣaṃ ca viśvabhojasam //
analyzed: dhenum ca viśva dohasam iṣam ca viśva bhojasam
translated: For Bharadvāja they have milked the cow who giveth all, and food that giveth all.

original: taṃ va indraṃ na sukratuṃ varuṇam iva māyinam /
analyzed: tam vaḥ indram na su kratum varuṇam iva māyinam
translated: We will praise that Indra, the wise, like Varuna the magician,

original: aryamaṇaṃ na mandraṃ sṛprabhojasaṃ viṣṇuṃ na stuṣa ādiśe //🔽tveṣaṃ śardho na mārutaṃ tuviṣvaṇy anarvāṇam pūṣaṇaṃ saṃ yathā śatā /
analyzed: aryamaṇam na mandram sṛpra bhojasam viṣṇum na stuṣe ādiśe  tveṣam śardhaḥ na mārutam tuviṣvaṇi anarvāṇam pūṣaṇam sam yathā śatā
translated: Like the delightful Aryaman, the bountiful, like Vishnu, we will praise.🔽The impetuous host like the Maruts, the irresistible Pūṣan, like a hundred,

original: saṃ sahasrā kāriṣac carṣaṇibhya āṃ āvir gūḷhā vasū karat suvedā no vasū karat //
analyzed: sam sahasrā kāriṣat carṣaṇibhyaḥ ām āvis gūḍhā vasū karat su vedā naḥ vasū karat
translated: Like a thousand, I will make to act for the men. He will make manifest the hidden treasures. He will make the treasures easy to find for us.

original: ā mā pūṣann upa drava śaṃsiṣaṃ nu te apikarṇa āghṛṇe /
analyzed: ā mā pūṣan upa drava śaṃsiṣam nu te apikarṇe āghṛṇe
translated: Come to me, O Pusan, I will praise thee, I will sing to thee, O thou who art to be sung, O thou who art to be praised.

original: aghā aryo arātayaḥ //🔽mā kākambīram ud vṛho vanaspatim aśastīr vi hi nīnaśaḥ /
analyzed: aghāḥ aryaḥ arātayaḥ  mā kākambīram ud vṛhaḥ vanaspatim aśastīḥ vi hi nīnaśaḥ
translated: Let the wicked, the evil-minded, be far away from us.🔽Do not destroy the Kakambīra tree, the lord of the forest. Drive away the curses.

original: mota sūro aha evā cana grīvā ādadhate veḥ //
analyzed: mā uta sūraḥ aha evā cana grīvāḥ ādadhate veḥ
translated: Let not the sun, nor even the wind, put its neck into the yoke.

original: dṛter iva te 'vṛkam astu sakhyam /
analyzed: dṛteḥ iva te vṛkam astu sakhyam
translated: Let thy friendship be like a shield, O thou who art to be praised.

original: acchidrasya dadhanvataḥ supūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ //
analyzed: acchidrasya dadhanvataḥ su pūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ
translated: Of the one without a flaw, the one who is full, the one who is very full.

original: paro hi martyair asi samo devair uta śriyā /
analyzed: paraḥ hi martyaiḥ asi samaḥ devaiḥ uta śriyā
translated: For thou art higher than mortals, and equal to the gods in glory.

original: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu nas tvam avā nūnaṃ yathā purā //🔽vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītir astu sūnṛtā /🔽devasya vā maruto martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ //🔽sadyaś cid yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyāṃ devo naiti sūryaḥ /🔽tveṣaṃ śavo dadhire nāma yajñiyam maruto vṛtrahaṃ śavo jyeṣṭhaṃ vṛtrahaṃ śavaḥ //
analyzed: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu naḥ tvam avāḥ nūnam yathā purā  vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītiḥ astu sūnṛtā  devasya vā marutaḥ martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ  sadyas cit yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyām devaḥ nā eti sūryaḥ  tveṣam śavaḥ dadhire nāma yajñiyam marutaḥ vṛtraham śavaḥ jyeṣṭham vṛtraham śavaḥ
translated: Be thou, O Pusan, a helper to us in battles. Now, indeed, as formerly.

original: sakṛd dha dyaur ajāyata sakṛd bhūmir ajāyata /🔽pṛśnyā dugdhaṃ sakṛt payas tad anyo nānu jāyate //
analyzed: sakṛt ha dyauḥ ajāyata sakṛt bhūmiḥ ajāyata 🔽pṛśnyāḥ dugdham sakṛt payaḥ tat anyaḥ na anu jāyate
translated: The left, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the left's, the

original: stuṣe janaṃ suvrataṃ navyasībhir gīrbhir mitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā /
analyzed: stuṣe janam suvratam navyasībhiḥ gīrbhiḥ mitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā
translated: I praise the people of good vows with new songs, propitiating Mitra-Varuṇa.

original: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro agniḥ //🔽viśoviśa īḍyam adhvareṣv adṛptakratum aratiṃ yuvatyoḥ /
analyzed: te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu su kṣatrāsaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ  viśoviśaḥ īḍyam adhvareṣu adṛpta kratum aratim yuvatyoḥ
translated: May they come here and listen, the mighty ones, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni.🔽The one to be worshipped in every clan at sacrifices, whose mind is not haughty, the companion of the two young maidens,

original: divaḥ śiśuṃ sahasaḥ sūnum agniṃ yajñasya ketum aruṣaṃ yajadhyai //
analyzed: divaḥ śiśum sahasaḥ sūnum agnim yajñasya ketum aruṣam yajadhyai
translated: The child of the sky, the son of strength, Agni, the banner of the sacrifice, the red one, I worship.

original: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhir anyā pipiśe sūro anyā /
analyzed: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhiḥ anyā pipiśe sūraḥ anyā
translated: The two daughters of the red one, the two dissimilar ones, one is nourished by the rays, the other by the sun.

original: mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutaṃ nakṣata ṛcyamāne //
analyzed: mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutam nakṣataḥ ṛcyamāne
translated: The two who move together, the two who shine, the two who are to be remembered, are heard when praised.

original: pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavāraṃ rathaprām /
analyzed: pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhat rayim viśva vāram ratha prām
translated: The lofty thought goes forth to Vayu, to the one with great wealth, the one who has all good things, the one who rides in a chariot,

original: dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavim iyakṣasi prayajyo //
analyzed: dyutat yāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavim iyakṣasi prayajyo
translated: The one who rules the rays, the one who is to be worshipped, the wise one, you worship the wise one.

original: sa me vapuś chadayad aśvinor yo ratho virukmān manasā yujānaḥ /
analyzed: sa me vapuḥ chadayat aśvinoḥ yaḥ rathaḥ virukmān manasā yujānaḥ
translated: That form of the two Ashvins, the chariot which is well-equipped, which is yoked with the mind,

original: yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartir yāthas tanayāya tmane ca //
analyzed: yena narā nāsatyā iṣayadhyai vartiḥ yāthaḥ tanayāya tmane ca
translated: By which, O Nâsatyas, you go on your way to the dwelling of the son and of yourself.

original: parjanyavātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatam apyāni /
analyzed: parjanya vātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatam apyāni
translated: O Vâyu and Parjanya, ye bulls of the earth, quicken the regions and the waters' fulness.

original: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yasya gīrbhir jagata sthātar jagad ā kṛṇudhvam //
analyzed: satya śrutaḥ kavayaḥ yasya gīrbhiḥ jagataḥ sthātar jagat ā kṛṇudhvam
translated: Whose truth and fame the wise ones with their songs have made, O ye that stand in the world, make the world to be.

original: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṃ dhāt /
analyzed: pāvīravī kanyā citra āyuḥ sarasvatī vīra patnī dhiyam dhāt
translated: The daughter of the Pāvirs, the maiden of wondrous life, Sarasvatī, the wife of heroes, grant thought.

original: gnābhir acchidraṃ śaraṇaṃ sajoṣā durādharṣaṃ gṛṇate śarma yaṃsat //
analyzed: gnābhiḥ acchidram śaraṇam sajoṣāḥ durādharṣam gṛṇate śarma yaṃsat
translated: With the wives, the faultless shelter, of one accord, grant the singer protection hard to assail.

original: pathaspathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhy ānaḷ arkam /🔽sa no rāsac churudhaś candrāgrā dhiyaṃdhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā //
analyzed: pathaspathaḥ paripatim vacasyā kāmena kṛtaḥ abhī ānaṭ arkam  sa naḥ rāsat śurudhaḥ candra agrāḥ dhiyam dhiyam sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā
translated: The path, the path, the follower of speech, made by desire, hath come to the sun.🔽May he give us the bright, the beautiful, Pūṣan, the god with fair hands, the mighty, shall further each thought.

original: prathamabhājaṃ yaśasaṃ vayodhāṃ supāṇiṃ devaṃ sugabhastim ṛbhvam /
analyzed: prathama bhājam yaśasam vayaḥ dhām su pāṇim devam su gabhastim ṛbhvam
translated: The first to enjoy, the famous, the life-giving, the god with fair hands, the mighty, the well-wishing.

original: hotā yakṣad yajatam pastyānām agnis tvaṣṭāraṃ suhavaṃ vibhāvā //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat yajatam pastyānām agniḥ tvaṣṭāram su havam vibhāvā
translated: Let the priest worship Tvaṣṭar, the easy to invoke, the radiant, the priest of the people, the sacrificer.

original: bhuvanasya pitaraṃ gīrbhir ābhī rudraṃ divā vardhayā rudram aktau /
analyzed: bhuvanasya pitaram gīrbhiḥ ābhiḥ rudram divā vardhaya rudram aktau
translated: The father of the world, with hymns, let us invoke, Rudra in the day, let us strengthen Rudra in the night.

original: bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṃ suṣumnam ṛdhag ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram suṣumnam ṛdhak ghuvema kavinā iṣitāsaḥ
translated: The lofty, the tall, the undecaying, the very prosperous, we will invoke the wise one, urged on by the mind.

original: ā yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso maruto ganta gṛṇato varasyām /
analyzed: ā yuvānaḥ kavayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ marutaḥ ganta gṛṇataḥ varasyām
translated: The young, the wise, the worthy of sacrifice, the Maruts, come to the singer's best.

original: acitraṃ cid dhi jinvathā vṛdhanta itthā nakṣanto naro aṅgirasvat //
analyzed: acitram cit hi jinvatha vṛdhantaḥ itthā nakṣantaḥ naraḥ aṅgirasvat
translated: For, though wonderful, ye quicken and make to grow, as men longing for this (world), in the manner of Angiras.

original: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāyājā yūtheva paśurakṣir astam /🔽sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhir na nākaṃ vacanasya vipaḥ //
analyzed: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāya ajā yūthā iva paśurakṣiḥ astam  sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhiḥ na nākam vacanasya vipaḥ
translated: To the hero, to the strong, to the impetuous one, offer, as a herd of cattle to a guardian, (him) who is to be worshipped.🔽He touches with his rays the back of the famous one, as with the rays of the sun the vault of the sky.

original: yo rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni triś cid viṣṇur manave bādhitāya /
analyzed: yaḥ rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni tris cit viṣṇuḥ manave bādhitāya
translated: He who measured out the earthly regions, even Vishnu for Manu who was oppressed, three times.

original: tasya te śarmann upadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca //🔽tan no 'hir budhnyo adbhir arkais tat parvatas tat savitā cano dhāt /
analyzed: tasya te śarman upadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca  tat naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ adbhiḥ arkaiḥ tat parvataḥ tat savitā canaḥ dhāt
translated: In that (act) of his, O ye two, who bestow protection, may we rejoice in wealth, in body and in offspring.🔽May the serpent Budhnya with the waters and the rays, may the mountain, may Savitar grant us that favour.

original: tad oṣadhībhir abhi rātiṣāco bhagaḥ purandhir jinvatu pra rāye //🔽nu no rayiṃ rathyaṃ carṣaṇiprām puruvīram maha ṛtasya gopām /
analyzed: tat oṣadhībhiḥ abhi rātiṣācaḥ bhagaḥ purandhiḥ jinvatu pra rāye  nu naḥ rayim rathyam carṣaṇi prām puru vīram mahaḥ ṛtasya gopām
translated: May that (favour) which the plants love, and Bhaga with Purandhi, impel for us to wealth.🔽Grant us that wealth, borne on chariots, which is the leader of men, which is very mighty, the guardian of great truth,

original: kṣayaṃ dātājaraṃ yena janān spṛdho adevīr abhi ca kramāma viśa ādevīr abhy aśnavāma //
analyzed: kṣayam dāta ajaram yena janān spṛdhaḥ adevīḥ abhi ca kramāma viśaḥ ādevīḥ abhī aśnavāma
translated: The inexhaustible abode, by which we may overcome the godless tribes in battle, and may win the clans of the godly.

original: huve vo devīm aditiṃ namobhir mṛḷīkāya varuṇam mitram agnim /
analyzed: huve vaḥ devīm aditim namobhiḥ mṛḷīkāya varuṇam mitram agnim
translated: I call on you with adorations to the Goddess Aditi, to Varuna, to Mitra, to Agni, for favour.

original: abhikṣadām aryamaṇaṃ suśevaṃ trātṝn devān savitāram bhagaṃ ca //
analyzed: abhikṣa dām aryamaṇam su śevam trātṝn devān savitāram bhagam ca
translated: The Ābhikṣadas, Aryaman, the good protector, the gods, Savitar, and Bhaga.

original: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝn anāgāstve sumaho vīhi devān /
analyzed: su jyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣa pitṝn anāgāstve su mahaḥ vīhi devān
translated: O Sun, with good light, the fathers, Daksha, for non-injury, come to the gods, O great one.

original: dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvanto yajatā agnijihvāḥ //
analyzed: dvi janmānaḥ ye ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvantaḥ yajatāḥ agni jihvāḥ
translated: The twice-born ones who are the guardians of truth, the true ones, who have heaven, who sacrifice with Agni as their tongue,

original: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatram uru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṃ suṣumne /
analyzed: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatram uru bṛhat rodasī śaraṇam suṣumne
translated: And the vast realm of heaven and earth, the two wide worlds, the shelter, the very gracious one,

original: mahas karatho varivo yathā no 'sme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ //
analyzed: mahaḥ karathaḥ varivaḥ yathā naḥ sme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ
translated: Make a great space for us, O you two invincible supporters, for our dwelling.

original: ā no rudrasya sūnavo namantām adyā hūtāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ rudrasya sūnavaḥ namantām adyā hūtāsaḥ vasavaḥ dhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: May the sons of Rudra, the Vasus, the invoked ones, the invincible ones, be gracious to us today.

original: yad īm arbhe mahati vā hitāso bādhe maruto ahvāma devān //
analyzed: yat īm arbhe mahati vā hitāsaḥ bādhe marutaḥ ahvāma devān
translated: When we call the Maruts, the gods, in a small or great calamity, O you who are placed in the sacrifice.

original: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardhayajvā /
analyzed: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardha yajvā
translated: In whom the divine heaven and earth are measured, in whom Pūṣan, the one who offers the foremost sacrifice,

original: śrutvā havam maruto yad dha yātha bhūmā rejante adhvani pravikte //
analyzed: śrutvā havam marutaḥ yat ha yātha bhūmāḥ rejante adhvani pravikte
translated: Having heard the call, O Maruts, when you come, in the wide-spread path, all tremble.

original: abhi tyaṃ vīraṃ girvaṇasam arcendram brahmaṇā jaritar navena /
analyzed: abhi tyam vīram girvaṇasam arca indram brahmaṇā jaritar navena
translated: Praise that hero, the lover of praise, Indra, O worshipper, with new prayer.

original: śravad id dhavam upa ca stavāno rāsad vājāṃ upa maho gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: śravat id havam upa ca stavānaḥ rāsat vājān upa mahaḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: May he listen to the call and be satisfied with the praise, may he sit down to the food, being praised, for the great (wealth).

original: omānam āpo mānuṣīr amṛktaṃ dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ /
analyzed: omānam āpaḥ mānuṣīḥ amṛktam dhāta tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: The waters, the human ones, bestow the uninjured, for the child and offspring, the blessing of the house.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajo mātṛtamā viśvasya sthātur jagato janitrīḥ //
analyzed: yūyam hi stha bhiṣajaḥ mātṛtamāḥ viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ janitrīḥ
translated: For ye are the most motherly of physicians, the creators of all that stands and moves.

original: ā no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇo hiraṇyapāṇir yajato jagamyāt /
analyzed: ā naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ hiraṇya pāṇiḥ yajataḥ jagamyāt
translated: May the god Savitar, the protector, the golden-handed, come to the worshipper.

original: yo datravāṃ uṣaso na pratīkaṃ vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi //
analyzed: yaḥ datravān uṣasaḥ na pratīkam vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
translated: Who spreads out for the worshipper the good things of life, like the face of the dawns.

original: uta tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adyā devāṃ asminn adhvare vavṛtyāḥ /🔽syām ahaṃ te sadam id rātau tava syām agne 'vasā suvīraḥ //
analyzed: uta tvam sūno sahasaḥ naḥ adyā devān asmin adhvare vavṛtyāḥ  syām aham te sadam id rātau tava syām agne vasā su vīraḥ
translated: And thou also, O son of strength, turn hither to us today, to the gods, at this sacrifice.🔽May I be always in thy favour, O Agni, may I be in thy protection, rich in good heroes.

original: uta tyā me havam ā jagmyātaṃ nāsatyā dhībhir yuvam aṅga viprā /
analyzed: uta tyā me havam ā jagmyātam nāsatyā dhībhiḥ yuvam aṅga viprā
translated: And may ye also, O Nâsatyas, come to my invocation, ye who are sages by your thoughts.

original: atriṃ na mahas tamaso 'mumuktaṃ tūrvataṃ narā duritād abhīke //
analyzed: atrim na mahaḥ tamasaḥ mumuktam tūrvatam narā duritāt abhīke
translated: Ye have delivered Atri from the great darkness, ye have brought him from misfortune, O heroes.

original: te no rāyo dyumato vājavato dātāro bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ /
analyzed: te naḥ rāyaḥ dyumataḥ vājavataḥ dātāraḥ bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
translated: Be ye givers to us of wealth that shines, that is strong, that is full of men, of plenteous food.

original: daśasyanto divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā apyā mṛḷatā ca devāḥ //
analyzed: daśasyantaḥ divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ apyāḥ mṛḍatā ca devāḥ
translated: Favouring us, O ye heavenly ones, ye earthly ones, ye born of the cow, be gracious, O ye gods.

original: te no rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣā mīḷhuṣmanto viṣṇur mṛḷantu vāyuḥ /
analyzed: te naḥ rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣāḥ mīḷhuṣmantaḥ viṣṇuḥ mṛḍantu vāyuḥ
translated: May Rudra, Sarasvatî, of one accord, the bountiful, Vishnu, Vâyu, be gracious to us.

original: ṛbhukṣā vājo daivyo vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatām iṣaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ daivyaḥ vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatām iṣam naḥ
translated: May Rbhukṣan, Vāja, the divine Ordainer, Parjanya and Vāta increase our food.

original: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhago no 'pāṃ napād avatu dānu papriḥ /
analyzed: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhagaḥ naḥ pām napāt avatu dānu papriḥ
translated: And may that god Savitar, and Bhaga, the swift one of the waters, protect us, the bountiful one.

original: tvaṣṭā devebhir janibhiḥ sajoṣā dyaur devebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā devebhiḥ janibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ dyauḥ devebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ, in accord with the gods and the clans, Dyaus with the gods and the oceans, and Pṛthivī.

original: uta no 'hir budhnyaḥ śṛṇotv aja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ śṛṇotu ajaḥ eka pād pṛthivī samudraḥ
translated: May the Ahi Budhnya, the one-footed goat, the earth, and the ocean listen to us.

original: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ huvānāḥ stutāḥ mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ avantu
translated: May all the gods who uphold truth, when called upon, and the hymns praised by the wise, protect us.

original: evā napāto mama tasya dhībhir bharadvājā abhy arcanty arkaiḥ /
analyzed: eva napātaḥ mama tasya dhībhiḥ bharadvājāḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ
translated: Thus the sons of Bharadvāja praise me with their thoughts and hymns, O son of Napat.

original: gnā hutāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭā viśve stutāso bhūtā yajatrāḥ //
analyzed: gnāḥ hutāsaḥ vasavaḥ dhṛṣṭāḥ viśve stutāsaḥ bhūtāḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: The Gnas, the Hutas, the Vasus, the unassailable ones, all the worshipped ones, the righteous ones.

original: ud u tyac cakṣur mahi mitrayor āṃ eti priyaṃ varuṇayor adabdham /
analyzed: ud u tyad cakṣuḥ mahi mitrayoḥ ām eti priyam varuṇayoḥ adabdham
translated: That great eye of Mitra and Varuṇa rises up, the dear, infallible one.

original: ṛtasya śuci darśatam anīkaṃ rukmo na diva uditā vy adyaut //
analyzed: ṛtasya śuci darśatam anīkam rukmaḥ na divaḥ uditā vi adyaut
translated: The shining face of truth, the radiant one, shines forth like the sun risen in the sky.

original: veda yas trīṇi vidathāny eṣāṃ devānāṃ janma sanutar ā ca vipraḥ /
analyzed: veda yaḥ trīṇi vidathāni eṣām devānām janma sanutar ā ca vipraḥ
translated: The sage who knows the three gatherings of these gods, and their origin, and the distant ones,

original: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyann abhi caṣṭe sūro arya evān //
analyzed: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan abhi caṣṭe sūraḥ aryaḥ evān
translated: Seeing the upright and the crooked among mortals, the sun observes the noble and the ignoble.

original: stuṣa u vo maha ṛtasya gopān aditim mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sujātān /
analyzed: stuṣe u vaḥ mahaḥ ṛtasya gopān aditim mitram varuṇam sujātān
translated: I praise for you the great guardians of truth, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, of good birth,

original: aryamaṇam bhagam adabdhadhītīn acchā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān //
analyzed: aryamaṇam bhagam adabdha dhītīn acchā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān
translated: I call to you the unerring-minded Āryaman, Bhaga, the purifying ones who share the same wealth.

original: riśādasaḥ satpatīṃr adabdhān maho rājñaḥ suvasanasya dātṝn /
analyzed: riśādasaḥ sat patīn adabdhān mahaḥ rājñaḥ su vasanasya dātṝn
translated: The R̥ishis, the lords of truth, the undeceiving ones, the great kings who bestow fine garments,

original: yūnaḥ sukṣatrān kṣayato divo nṝn ādityān yāmy aditiṃ duvoyu //
analyzed: yūnaḥ su kṣatrān kṣayataḥ divaḥ nṝn ādityān yāmi aditim duvoyu
translated: The young men of good rule, the men of heaven's abode, the Ādityas, I call Aditi, ready for service.

original: dyauṣ pitaḥ pṛthivi mātar adhrug agne bhrātar vasavo mṛḷatā naḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ pitar pṛthivi mātar adruh agne bhrātar vasavaḥ mṛḍata naḥ
translated: You, O father Dyaus, and you, O mother earth, be not inconstant, O brother Agni, be gracious to us, O Vasus.

original: viśva ādityā adite sajoṣā asmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yanta //
analyzed: viśve ādityāḥ adite sajoṣāḥ asmabhyam śarma bahulam vi yanta
translated: All Ādityas, O Aditi, of one accord, grant us abundant protection.

original: mā no vṛkāya vṛkye samasmā aghāyate rīradhatā yajatrāḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ vṛkāya vṛkye samasmai aghāyate rīradhata yajatrāḥ
translated: Do not deliver us to the wolf, to the she-wolf, to the wicked one, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā rathyo nas tanūnāṃ yūyaṃ dakṣasya vacaso babhūva //
analyzed: yūyam hi stha rathyaḥ naḥ tanūnām yūyam dakṣasya vacasaḥ babhūva
translated: For you are the charioteers of our bodies, you have become the speakers of Dakṣa's word.

original: mā va eno anyakṛtam bhujema mā tat karma vasavo yac cayadhve /
analyzed: mā vaḥ enaḥ anya kṛtam bhujema mā tat karma vasavaḥ yat cayadhve
translated: May we not experience the sin committed by another, O Vasus, that deed which you punish.

original: viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśvadevāḥ svayaṃ ripus tanvaṃ rīriṣīṣṭa //
analyzed: viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśva devāḥ svayam ripuḥ tanvam rīriṣīṣṭa
translated: For you are the all-gods of all, the enemy himself should injure his own body.
