original: nama id ugraṃ nama ā vivāse namo dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām /
analyzed: namaḥ id ugram namaḥ ā vivāse namaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: I offer homage to the fierce one, I offer homage to the one who spreads out, homage supports the earth and the sky.

original: namo devebhyo nama īśa eṣāṃ kṛtaṃ cid eno namasā vivāse //
analyzed: namaḥ devebhyaḥ namaḥ īśe eṣām kṛtam cit enaḥ namasā vivāse
translated: Homage to the gods, homage to their lord. With homage I remove whatever sin we have committed.

original: ṛtasya vo rathyaḥ pūtadakṣān ṛtasya pastyasado adabdhān /
analyzed: ṛtasya vaḥ rathyaḥ pūta dakṣān ṛtasya pastyasadaḥ adabdhān
translated: The charioteers of truth, of pure strength, the guardians of the house of truth, the unshaken,

original: tāṃ ā namobhir urucakṣaso nṝn viśvān va ā name maho yajatrāḥ //
analyzed: tām ā namobhiḥ uru cakṣasaḥ nṝn viśvān vaḥ ā name mahaḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: To them, the far-seeing men, with homage, to all of you, O great ones, I bow down.

original: te hi śreṣṭhavarcasas ta u nas tiro viśvāni duritā nayanti /
analyzed: te hi śreṣṭha varcasaḥ te u naḥ tiras viśvāni duritā nayanti
translated: For they are of the most excellent glory, they lead us beyond all misfortunes.

original: sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro agnir ṛtadhītayo vakmarājasatyāḥ //
analyzed: su kṣatrāsaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ ṛta dhītayaḥ vakma rāja satyāḥ
translated: The powerful, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, the true ones who uphold the laws of truth.

original: te na indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhago aditiḥ pañca janāḥ /
analyzed: te naḥ indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhagaḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ
translated: May Indra, the earth, the wide one, increase us, Pusan, Bhaga, Aditi, the five peoples.

original: suśarmāṇaḥ svavasaḥ sunīthā bhavantu naḥ sutrātrāsaḥ sugopāḥ //🔽nū sadmānaṃ divyaṃ naṃśi devā bhāradvājaḥ sumatiṃ yāti hotā /
analyzed: su śarmāṇaḥ su avasaḥ su nīthāḥ bhavantu naḥ su trātrāsaḥ su gopāḥ  nu sadmānam divyam naṃśi devāḥ bhāradvājaḥ sumatim yāti hotā
translated: May they be our good protectors, our good saviors, our good guides, our good guardians.🔽Now let the divine abode of the gods be filled, the Bharadvaja priest goes to the favor of the gods.

original: āsānebhir yajamāno miyedhair devānāṃ janma vasūyur vavanda //
analyzed: āsānebhiḥ yajamānaḥ miyedhaiḥ devānām janma vasūyuḥ vavanda
translated: With these offerings, the sacrificer, seeking wealth, has worshipped the birth of the gods.

original: apa tyaṃ vṛjinaṃ ripuṃ stenam agne durādhyam /
analyzed: apa tyam vṛjinam ripum stenam agne durādhyam
translated: Drive away, O Agni, the wicked foe, the thief, the one who is difficult to subdue.

original: daviṣṭham asya satpate kṛdhī sugam //
analyzed: daviṣṭham asya satpate kṛdhī sugam
translated: Make him most hateful to his own lord, make him easy to be subdued.

original: grāvāṇaḥ soma no hi kaṃ sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ /
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ soma naḥ hi kam sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ
translated: The pressing-stones, O Soma, have called to us, to be friends, to the oblations.🔽The sacrificer, seeking wealth, has worshipped the birth of the gods.

original: jahī ny atriṇam paṇiṃ vṛko hi ṣaḥ //
analyzed: jahi ni atriṇam paṇim vṛkaḥ hi saḥ
translated: Destroy the greedy one, the robber, for he is a wolf.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ /
analyzed: yūyam hi stha sudānavaḥ indra jyeṣṭhāḥ abhidyavaḥ
translated: For you are givers of good gifts, O Indra's most powerful ones, you who overcome.

original: kartā no adhvann ā sugaṃ gopā amā //
analyzed: karta naḥ adhvan ā sugam gopāḥ amā
translated: Be our protector on the path, O you who make it easy to travel.

original: api panthām aganmahi svastigām anehasam /
analyzed: api panthām aganmahi svasti gām anehasam
translated: We have found the path that leads to welfare, that is free from danger,

original: yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu //
analyzed: yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣaḥ vṛṇakti vindate vasu
translated: By which one avoids all enemies and obtains wealth.

original: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhir ābhiḥ /
analyzed: na tat divā na pṛthivyā anu manye na yajñena na uta śamībhiḥ ābhiḥ
translated: I do not think that is possible by day or by the earth, or by sacrifice or by these offerings.

original: ubjantu taṃ subhvaḥ parvatāso ni hīyatām atiyājasya yaṣṭā //
analyzed: ubjantu tam su bhvaḥ parvatāsaḥ ni hīyatām atiyājasya yaṣṭā
translated: Let the mighty mountains crush him, let the sacrificer of the one who sacrifices too much be destroyed.

original: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṃ ninitsāt /
analyzed: ati vā yaḥ marutaḥ manyate naḥ brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇam ninitsāt
translated: Or if anyone thinks of us as Maruts, or if anyone despises the Brahman that is being performed,

original: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣam abhi taṃ śocatu dyauḥ //
analyzed: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahma dviṣam abhi tam śocatu dyauḥ
translated: Let burning coals and tangled vines be for him, and let the sky burn with anger against the one who hates the Brahman.

original: kim aṅga tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma gopāṃ kim aṅga tvāhur abhiśastipāṃ naḥ /
analyzed: kim aṅga tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma gopām kim aṅga tvā āhuḥ abhiśasti pām naḥ
translated: Why do they call you, O Soma, the guardian of the Brahman, why do they call you the protector of our curse?

original: kim aṅga naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetim asya //
analyzed: kim aṅga naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahma dviṣe tapuṣim hetim asya
translated: Why do you see us being oppressed? Let the weapon of burning coals be for the one who hates the Brahman.

original: avantu mām uṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ /
analyzed: avantu mām uṣasaḥ jāyamānāḥ avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ
translated: May the dawns rising, may the swelling rivers protect me.

original: avantu mā parvatāso dhruvāso 'vantu mā pitaro devahūtau //
analyzed: avantu mā parvatāsaḥ dhruvāsaḥ vantu mā pitaraḥ deva hūtau
translated: May the firm mountains protect me, may the fathers protect me at the invocation of the gods.

original: viśvadānīṃ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam /
analyzed: viśvadānīm su manasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam
translated: May we be of good cheer at all times, and may we behold the sun rising.

original: tathā karad vasupatir vasūnāṃ devāṃ ohāno 'vasāgamiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: tathā karat vasu patiḥ vasūnām devān ohānaḥ vasā āgamiṣṭhaḥ
translated: May the lord of treasures, the most accessible of the gods, do this.

original: indro nediṣṭham avasāgamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā /
analyzed: indraḥ nediṣṭham avasā āgamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā
translated: May Indra, the most accessible through his grace, Sarasvatī swelling with the rivers,

original: parjanyo na oṣadhībhir mayobhur agniḥ suśaṃsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva //
analyzed: parjanyaḥ naḥ oṣadhībhiḥ mayobhuḥ agniḥ su śaṃsaḥ su havaḥ pitā iva
translated: Parjanya with the plants that bring joy, and Agni, well-praised and easily invoked, like a father.

original: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam /
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ ā gata śṛṇutā me imam havam
translated: O all ye gods, come hither, listen to this my invocation.

original: edam barhir ni ṣīdata //
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ ni sīdata
translated: Sit ye down upon this sacred grass.

original: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ devāḥ ghṛta snunā havyena pratibhūṣati
translated: O ye gods, whomsoever ye favour with sacrificial offerings accompanied by ghee,

original: taṃ viśva upa gacchatha //
analyzed: tam viśve upa gacchatha
translated: To him do ye all come.

original: upa naḥ sūnavo giraḥ śṛṇvantv amṛtasya ye /
analyzed: upa naḥ sūnavaḥ giraḥ śṛṇvantu amṛtasya ye
translated: May the sons of the immortal one listen to our songs and hymns.

original: sumṛḷīkā bhavantu naḥ //
analyzed: su mṛḍīkāḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: May they be very gracious unto us.

original: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhir havanaśrutaḥ /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtubhiḥ havana śrutaḥ
translated: O all ye gods, increasers of truth, who listen to the invocation,

original: juṣantāṃ yujyam payaḥ //
analyzed: juṣantām yujyam payaḥ
translated: Do ye accept the proper food.

original: stotram indro marudgaṇas tvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā /
analyzed: stotram indraḥ marut gaṇaḥ tvaṣṭṛmān mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May Indra, the host of Maruts, Tvastr, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ //
analyzed: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ
translated: Accept these offerings of ours.

original: imaṃ no agne adhvaraṃ hotar vayunaśo yaja /
analyzed: imam naḥ agne adhvaram hotar vayunaśas yaja
translated: O Agni, O Hotar, offer this sacrifice of ours, O thou who art skilled in the sacrifice.

original: cikitvān daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: cikitvān daivyam janam
translated: The wise one, the divine people.

original: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ havam me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ śṛṇuta imam havam me ye antarikṣe yaḥ upa dyavi ṣṭha
translated: All the gods, listen to this call of mine, those who are in the atmosphere and those who are in the sky,

original: ye agnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam //
analyzed: ye agni jihvāḥ uta vā yajatrāḥ āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
translated: Those whose tongue is Agni, or who are worthy of sacrifice, sit on this sacred grass and rejoice!

original: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṃ napāc ca manma /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyāḥ ubhe rodasī apām napāt ca manma
translated: May all the gods who are worthy of sacrifice listen to my sacrifice, and the two world-halves and the overlord of the waters, and my thought.

original: mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣv id vo antamā madema //🔽ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṃ sadhasthe /
analyzed: mā vaḥ vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocam sumneṣu id vaḥ antamāḥ madema  ye ke ca jmā mahinaḥ ahi māyāḥ divaḥ jajñire apām sadhasthe
translated: I will not speak words that are to be despised among you. May we delight in your favors.🔽Those who are great and mighty, born from the serpent, born from the waters' abode in the sky,

original: te asmabhyam iṣaye viśvam āyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantu devāḥ //
analyzed: te asmabhyam iṣaye viśvam āyuḥ kṣapaḥ usrāḥ varivasyantu devāḥ
translated: May they grant us life with food for all our days. May the gods favor us with cattle and horses.

original: agnīparjanyāv avataṃ dhiyam me 'smin have suhavā suṣṭutiṃ naḥ /
analyzed: agnīparjanyau avatam dhiyam me smin have su havā suṣṭutim naḥ
translated: O Agni and Parjanya, help my thought, O you who are easily entreated, our praise in this invocation.

original: iḷām anyo janayad garbham anyaḥ prajāvatīr iṣa ā dhattam asme //
analyzed: iḷām anyaḥ janayat garbham anyaḥ prajāvatīḥ iṣaḥ ā dhattam asme
translated: Let one generate the seed, let the other grant us abundant food.

original: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse /
analyzed: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau su uktena mahā namasā vivāse
translated: On the strewn sacred grass, in the kindled fire, I worship with a hymn and great reverence.

original: asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam //
analyzed: asmin naḥ adya vidathe yajatrāḥ viśve devāḥ haviṣi mādayadhvam
translated: O you who are worthy of sacrifice, all gods, rejoice in the oblation in this our assembly today.

original: vayam u tvā pathas pate rathaṃ na vājasātaye /
analyzed: vayam u tvā pathaḥ pate ratham na vājasātaye
translated: We invoke you, O lord of the path, like a chariot, to win strength.

original: dhiye pūṣann ayujmahi //
analyzed: dhiye pūṣan ayujmahi
translated: We have yoked ourselves to your thought, O Pūṣan.

original: abhi no naryaṃ vasu vīram prayatadakṣiṇam /
analyzed: abhi naḥ naryam vasu vīram prayata dakṣiṇam
translated: Bring to us, O Narya, wealth, a hero with well-directed gifts,

original: vāmaṃ gṛhapatiṃ naya //🔽aditsantaṃ cid āghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya /
analyzed: vāmam gṛhapatim naya  a ditsantam cit āghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya
translated: A desirable master of the house.🔽Even the niggard, O wrathful one, O Pūṣan, urge to give gifts,

original: paṇeś cid vi mradā manaḥ //
analyzed: paṇeḥ cit vi mrada manaḥ
translated: Even from the lord of wealth loosen the mind.

original: vi patho vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdho jahi /
analyzed: vi pathaḥ vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: Open the paths for the winning of strength, destroy the obstacles,

original: sādhantām ugra no dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: sādhantām ugra naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Make our thoughts successful, O mighty one.

original: pari tṛndhi paṇīnām ārayā hṛdayā kave /
analyzed: pari tṛndhi paṇīnām ārayā hṛdayā kave
translated: Twist around the hearts of the Pāṇis, O wise one, with the arrow,

original: athem asmabhyaṃ randhaya //
analyzed: atha īm asmabhyam randhaya
translated: Then give them to us as a present.

original: vi pūṣann ārayā tuda paṇer iccha hṛdi priyam /
analyzed: vi pūṣan ārayā tuda paṇeḥ iccha hṛdi priyam
translated: With the arrow, O Pūṣan, pierce the heart of the niggardly one, find what is dear to him in his heart,

original: athem asmabhyaṃ randhaya //
analyzed: atha īm asmabhyam randhaya
translated: Then give it to us as a present.

original: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnāṃ hṛdayā kave /
analyzed: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnām hṛdayā kave
translated: Break, O Kikirā, the hearts of the Pāṇis, O wise one,

original: athem asmabhyaṃ randhaya //
analyzed: atha īm asmabhyam randhaya
translated: Then give them to us as a present.

original: yām pūṣan brahmacodanīm ārām bibharṣy āghṛṇe /
analyzed: yām pūṣan brahma codanīm ārām bibharṣi āghṛṇe
translated: That arrow, O Pūṣan, which you bear, O wrathful one, which urges the Brahmans,

original: tayā samasya hṛdayam ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu //
analyzed: tayā samasya hṛdayam ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu
translated: With that pierce his heart, O Kikirā.

original: yā te aṣṭrā goopaśāghṛṇe paśusādhanī /
analyzed: yā te aṣṭrā goopaśā aghṛṇe paśu sādhanī
translated: That arrow of yours, O wrathful one, which is guarded by cows and wins cattle for us,

original: tasyās te sumnam īmahe //
analyzed: tasyāḥ te sumnam īmahe
translated: Of that we seek your favor.

original: uta no goṣaṇiṃ dhiyam aśvasāṃ vājasām uta /
analyzed: uta naḥ goṣaṇim dhiyam aśva sām vāja sām uta
translated: And for us the thought that seeks cows, that seeks horses, that seeks strength,

original: nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye //
analyzed: nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye
translated: Make it like a man for enjoyment.

original: sam pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati /
analyzed: sam pūṣan viduṣā naya yaḥ añjasā anuśāsati
translated: O Pūṣan, lead us together with the wise one who rules righteously,

original: ya evedam iti bravat //
analyzed: yaḥ eva idam iti bravat
translated: Saying, 'He who is this...'

original: sam u pūṣṇā gamemahi yo gṛhāṃ abhiśāsati /
analyzed: sam u pūṣṇā gamemahi yaḥ gṛhān abhiśāsati
translated: May we go together with Pūṣan, who rules over the houses,

original: ima eveti ca bravat //
analyzed: ime eva iti ca bravat
translated: Saying, 'These very...'

original: pūṣṇaś cakraṃ na riṣyati na kośo 'va padyate /
analyzed: pūṣṇaḥ cakram na riṣyati na kośaḥ padyate
translated: Pūṣan's wheel is not harmed, the shaft does not break,

original: no asya vyathate paviḥ //
analyzed: na u asya vyathate paviḥ
translated: His axle does not wear out.

original: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na tam pūṣāpi mṛṣyate /
analyzed: yaḥ asmai haviṣā avidhat na tam pūṣā api mṛṣyate
translated: He whom Pūṣan favors with an oblation, he Pūṣan does not forgive,

original: prathamo vindate vasu //🔽pūṣā gā anv etu naḥ pūṣā rakṣatv arvataḥ /
analyzed: prathamaḥ vindate vasu  pūṣā gāḥ anu etu naḥ pūṣā rakṣatu arvataḥ
translated: The first finds wealth.🔽May Pūṣan follow our cows, may Pūṣan protect our horses,

original: pūṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ //
analyzed: pūṣā vājam sanotu naḥ
translated: May Pūṣan win strength for us.

original: pūṣann anu pra gā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ /
analyzed: pūṣan anu pra gāḥ ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ
translated: O Pūṣan, follow the cows of the sacrificer who presses (Soma),

original: asmākaṃ stuvatām uta //
analyzed: asmākam stuvatām uta
translated: And of us who praise you.

original: mākir neśan mākīṃ riṣan mākīṃ saṃ śāri kevaṭe /
analyzed: mākir neśat mākīm riṣat mākīm sam śāri kevaṭe
translated: Do not stumble, do not be hurt, do not be injured on the stump,

original: athāriṣṭābhir ā gahi //
analyzed: atha ariṣṭābhiḥ ā gahi
translated: Then come to us with the uninjured (cows).

original: śṛṇvantam pūṣaṇaṃ vayam iryam anaṣṭavedasam /
analyzed: śṛṇvantam pūṣaṇam vayam iryam a naṣṭa vedasam
translated: We call upon Pūṣan, the watchful one, whose wealth is not lost,

original: īśānaṃ rāya īmahe //
analyzed: īśānam rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: The lord of wealth, we call upon.

original: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana /
analyzed: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana
translated: O Pūṣan, may we never be harmed in your vow,

original: stotāras ta iha smasi //
analyzed: stotāraḥ te iha smasi
translated: We are the praisers here of you.

original: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṃ dadhātu dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam
translated: May Pūṣan place his right hand over there,

original: punar no naṣṭam ājatu //🔽ehi vāṃ vimuco napād āghṛṇe saṃ sacāvahai /
analyzed: punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu 🔽ehi vām vimucaḥ napāt āghṛṇe sam sacāvahai
translated: May he return to us what is lost.🔽Come, let us meet together, O Pūṣan, the uninjured one, the swift one,

original: rathīr ṛtasya no bhava //
analyzed: rathīḥ ṛtasya naḥ bhava
translated: Be thou a charioteer for us of holy order.

original: rathītamaṃ kapardinam īśānaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ /
analyzed: rathītamam kapardinam īśānam rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The best of charioteers, the curly-haired, the lord of great bounty,

original: rāyaḥ sakhāyam īmahe //
analyzed: rāyaḥ sakhāyam īmahe
translated: We seek as a friend for wealth.

original: rāyo dhārāsy āghṛṇe vaso rāśir ajāśva /
analyzed: rāyaḥ dhārā asi āghṛṇe vasoḥ rāśiḥ ajāśva
translated: O Vasu, with the stream of wealth, with the beard, with the goats and horses,

original: dhīvatodhīvataḥ sakhā //
analyzed: dhīvataḥ dhīvataḥ sakhā
translated: A friend to the thoughtful, to the thoughtful.

original: pūṣaṇaṃ nv ajāśvam upa stoṣāma vājinam /
analyzed: pūṣaṇam nu ajāśvam upa stoṣāma vājinam
translated: We will praise the strong Pusan, with the goats and horses,

original: svasur yo jāra ucyate //
analyzed: svasuḥ yaḥ jāraḥ ucyate
translated: Who is called the brother-in-law of his sister.

original: mātur didhiṣum abravaṃ svasur jāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ /
analyzed: mātuḥ didhiṣum abravam svasuḥ jāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: I have spoken to the brother-in-law of my mother, may the brother-in-law of my sister listen to us,

original: bhrātendrasya sakhā mama //
analyzed: bhrātā indrasya sakhā mama
translated: The friend of Indra, my friend.

original: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇaṃ rathe niśṛmbhās te janaśriyam /
analyzed: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇam rathe niśṛmbhāḥ te jana śriyam
translated: May the goats, the bearers, carry Pusan on the chariot, the one who is the glory of the people,

original: devaṃ vahantu bibhrataḥ //
analyzed: devam vahantu bibhrataḥ
translated: The god, the bearer.

original: ya enam ādideśati karambhād iti pūṣaṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ enam ādideśati karambhāt iti pūṣaṇam
translated: He who points to him, saying, Pusan, from the mixture,

original: na tena deva ādiśe //
analyzed: na tena devaḥ ādiśe
translated: One should not point to the god with that.

original: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatir yujā /
analyzed: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiḥ yujā
translated: And he, the best of charioteers, the lord of heroes, the friend,

original: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate //🔽utādaḥ paruṣe gavi sūraś cakraṃ hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate  uta adaḥ paruṣe gavi sūraḥ cakram hiraṇyayam
translated: Indra, slays the Vr̥itras.🔽And the sun, the best of charioteers, has set the golden wheel

original: ny airayad rathītamaḥ //
analyzed: ni airayat rathītamaḥ
translated: In the eastern cow.

original: yad adya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ /
analyzed: yat adya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumas
translated: What we now say to thee, O thou who art much praised, O wondrous one, most wise,

original: tat su no manma sādhaya //
analyzed: tat su naḥ manma sādhaya
translated: Make that prayer of ours successful.

original: imaṃ ca no gaveṣaṇaṃ sātaye sīṣadho gaṇam /
analyzed: imam ca naḥ gaveṣaṇam sātaye sīṣadhaḥ gaṇam
translated: And this troop of ours, O thou who seekest cattle, do thou further for our gain.

original: ārāt pūṣann asi śrutaḥ //🔽ā te svastim īmaha āreaghām upāvasum /
analyzed: ārāt pūṣan asi śrutaḥ  ā te svastim īmahe āreaghām upāvasum
translated: You are far away, O Pusan, you are renowned.🔽We invoke your well-being, your protection from misfortune, your assistance.

original: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvaś ca sarvatātaye //🔽indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṃ sakhyāya svastaye /
analyzed: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvas ca sarvatātaye  indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayam sakhyāya svastaye
translated: For today's prosperity and for tomorrow's prosperity.🔽O Indra and Pusan, we invoke you for friendship and well-being.

original: huvema vājasātaye //
analyzed: huvema vājasātaye
translated: For the sake of gaining strength.

original: somam anya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam /
analyzed: somam anyaḥ upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam
translated: One has approached the Soma to drink, the juice pressed out in the bowls.

original: karambham anya icchati //
analyzed: karambham anyaḥ icchati
translated: Another desires the Karambha.

original: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā /
analyzed: ajāḥ anyasya vahnayaḥ harī anyasya sambhṛtā
translated: The goats are the carriers of one, the two bay horses are harnessed to the other.

original: tābhyāṃ vṛtrāṇi jighnate //
analyzed: tābhyām vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: With them he slays the Vrtras.

original: yad indro anayad rito mahīr apo vṛṣantamaḥ /
analyzed: yat indraḥ anayat ritaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vṛṣantamaḥ
translated: When Indra brought the great waters from afar, the most powerful,

original: tatra pūṣābhavat sacā //
analyzed: tatra pūṣā abhavat sacā
translated: There Pusan became his companion.

original: tām pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṃ vayaṃ vṛkṣasya pra vayām iva /
analyzed: tām pūṣṇaḥ sumatim vayam vṛkṣasya pra vayām iva
translated: That favor of Pusan, like the top of a tree,

original: indrasya cā rabhāmahe //
analyzed: indrasya ca ā rabhāmahe
translated: We obtain from Indra.

original: ut pūṣaṇaṃ yuvāmahe 'bhīśūṃr iva sārathiḥ /
analyzed: ud pūṣaṇam yuvāmahe bhīśūn iva sārathiḥ
translated: We exalt Pusan, like a charioteer his reins,

original: mahyā indraṃ svastaye //
analyzed: mahyai indram svastaye
translated: For great prosperity, for the sake of Indra.

original: śukraṃ te anyad yajataṃ te anyad viṣurūpe ahanī dyaur ivāsi /
analyzed: śukram te anyat yajatam te anyat viṣurūpe ahanī dyauḥ iva asi
translated: One of your forms is bright, another is to be worshipped. You have various forms, like day and night. You are like the sky.

original: viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣann iha rātir astu //
analyzed: viśvāḥ hi māyāḥ avasi svadhāvas bhadrā te pūṣan iha rātiḥ astu
translated: For you possess all magical powers by your own nature. O Pusan, may your bounty be good here for us.

original: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyañjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ /
analyzed: aja aśvaḥ paśu pāḥ vāja pastyaḥ dhiyañjinvaḥ bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ
translated: The one with goats for horses, the protector of cattle, the one who delights in strength, the one who inspires thought, is entrusted to all the worlds.

original: aṣṭrām pūṣā śithirām udvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇo bhuvanā deva īyate //
analyzed: aṣṭrām pūṣā śithirām udvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇaḥ bhuvanā devaḥ īyate
translated: Pūṣan hath loosed the firmly-fastened chariot, looking on all the worlds, the God is moving.

original: yās te pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīr antarikṣe caranti /
analyzed: yāḥ te pūṣan nāvaḥ antar samudre hiraṇyayīḥ antarikṣe caranti
translated: Those ships of thine, O Pūṣan, which within the sea, golden, move in the air,

original: tābhir yāsi dūtyāṃ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava icchamānaḥ //
analyzed: tābhiḥ yāsi dūtyām sūryasya kāmena kṛta śravaḥ icchamānaḥ
translated: With them thou goest on an embassy, O thou who art made by the will of Sūrya, seeking glory.

original: pūṣā subandhur diva ā pṛthivyā iḷas patir maghavā dasmavarcāḥ /🔽yaṃ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṃ tavasaṃ svañcam //
analyzed: pūṣā su bandhuḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ iḷaḥ patiḥ maghavā dasma varcāḥ  yam devāsaḥ adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtam tavasam svañcam
translated: Pūṣan, the kinsman, is on high from the earth, the lord of wealth, the bountiful, of wondrous might,🔽Whom the gods have given to Sūrya, the strong, self-moving, made by the will of thee.

original: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṃ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ /
analyzed: pra nu vocā suteṣu vām vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ
translated: Now will I tell of your deeds among the pressed (juices), the hero deeds which ye have done.

original: hatāso vām pitaro devaśatrava indrāgnī jīvatho yuvam //
analyzed: hatāsaḥ vām pitaraḥ deva śatravaḥ indra agnī jīvathaḥ yuvam
translated: Your fathers are slain, the enemies of the gods; ye two, O Indra and Agni, live.

original: baḷ itthā mahimā vām indrāgnī paniṣṭha ā /
analyzed: baḷ itthā mahimā vām indra agnī paniṣṭhaḥ ā
translated: So great is your majesty, O Indra and Agni, in the highest place.

original: samāno vāṃ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṃ yamāv ihehamātarā //🔽okivāṃsā sute sacāṃ aśvā saptī ivādane /
analyzed: samānaḥ vām janitā bhrātarā yuvam yamau iha iha mātarā  okivāṃsā sute sacā am aśvā saptī iva adane
translated: One is your begetter, ye are brothers, twins are ye here, O ye two mothers.🔽Ye two, looking on, are seated at the pressed (juice), as two horses in the stable.

original: indrā nv agnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṃ devā havāmahe //
analyzed: indrā nu agnī avasā iha vajriṇā vayam devā havāmahe
translated: O Indra and Agni, we invoke you, O ye two who have the thunderbolt, O ye two gods, for help.

original: ya indrāgnī suteṣu vāṃ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: yaḥ indra agnī suteṣu vām stavat teṣu ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Ye, Indra and Agni, who are to be praised at your libations, ye who are the increasers of holy order,

original: joṣavākaṃ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaś cana //
analyzed: joṣavākam vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaḥ cana
translated: Ye do not accept the oblation of the godless, of him who speaks with disfavour, who is hostile to the Pāñktis.

original: indrāgnī ko asya vāṃ devau martaś ciketati /
analyzed: indra agnī kaḥ asya vām devau martaḥ ciketati
translated: Indra and Agni, what mortal can understand your ways, O Gods?

original: viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe //
analyzed: viṣūcaḥ aśvān yuyujānaḥ īyate ekaḥ samānaḥ ā rathe
translated: One yokes the horses to the chariot, and they go to the same goal.

original: indrāgnī apād iyam pūrvāgāt padvatībhyaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī apāt iyam pūrvā āgāt padvatībhyaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, this foot has come first from the many-footed ones.

original: hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadac carat triṃśat padā ny akramīt //
analyzed: hitvī śiraḥ jihvayā vāvadat carat triṃśat padā ni akramīt
translated: The tongue, licking the head, has moved along the thirty steps.

original: indrāgnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī ā hi tanvate naraḥ dhanvāni bāhvoḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, men stretch out their bows in your arms.

original: mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṃ gaviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: mā naḥ asmin mahādhane parā varktam gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: Do not abandon us in this great contest, in the battles for cattle.

original: indrāgnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī tapanti mā aghāḥ aryaḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, the wicked, the enemies, the evil spirits torment me.

original: apa dveṣāṃsy ā kṛtaṃ yuyutaṃ sūryād adhi //
analyzed: apa dveṣāṃsi ā kṛtam yuyutam sūryāt adhi
translated: You have driven away the hostilities from above the sun.

original: indrāgnī yuvor api vasu divyāni pārthivā /
analyzed: indra agnī yuvoḥ api vasu divyāni pārthivā
translated: Indra and Agni, yours are the treasures, both of heaven and earth.

original: ā na iha pra yacchataṃ rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam //
analyzed: ā naḥ iha pra yacchatam rayim viśvāyu poṣasam
translated: Bestow them here upon us, wealth that supports all life.

original: indrāgnī ukthavāhasā stomebhir havanaśrutā /
analyzed: indra agnī uktha vāhasā stomebhiḥ havana śrutā
translated: Indra and Agni, who carry the praises, who hear the invocations through the hymns,

original: viśvābhir gīrbhir ā gatam asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ ā gatam asya somasya pītaye
translated: Come with all the songs to drink this Soma.

original: śnathad vṛtram uta sanoti vājam indrā yo agnī sahurī saparyāt /
analyzed: śnathat vṛtram uta sanoti vājam indrā yaḥ agnī sahurī saparyāt
translated: He who serves Indra and Agni, the strong, shatters Vrtra and wins strength.

original: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā //
analyzed: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā
translated: Ruling over the wide wealth of possessions, most powerful, bestowing strength.

original: tā yodhiṣṭam abhi gā indra nūnam apaḥ svar uṣaso agna ūḷhāḥ /
analyzed: tā yodhiṣṭam abhi gāḥ indra nūnam apaḥ svar uṣasaḥ agne ūḍhāḥ
translated: So fight for the sake of the cows, O Indra, now, O Agni, for the sake of the waters, the heaven, the dawns, the obstacles.

original: diśaḥ svar uṣasa indra citrā apo gā agne yuvase niyutvān //🔽ā vṛtrahaṇā vṛtrahabhiḥ śuṣmair indra yātaṃ namobhir agne arvāk /
analyzed: diśaḥ svar uṣasaḥ indra citrāḥ apaḥ gāḥ agne yuvase niyutvān  ā vṛtra haṇā vṛtra habhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ indra yātam namobhiḥ agne arvāk
translated: The quarters, the heaven, the dawns, O Indra, the wondrous waters, the cows, O Agni, you win with your team.🔽Come, O Indra, with your Vritra-killing powers, with your Vritra-killing strengths, with your salutations, O Agni, come hither.

original: yuvaṃ rādhobhir akavebhir indrāgne asme bhavatam uttamebhiḥ //
analyzed: yuvam rādhobhiḥ akavebhiḥ indra agne asme bhavatam uttamebhiḥ
translated: With your gifts, O Indra and Agni, be with us with your best gifts.

original: tā huve yayor idam papne viśvam purā kṛtam /
analyzed: tā huve yayoḥ idam papne viśvam purā kṛtam
translated: To those two I call, by whom this all was made in the beginning.

original: indrāgnī na mardhataḥ //
analyzed: indra agnī na mardhataḥ
translated: To Indra and Agni, not to be thwarted.

original: ugrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāgnī havāmahe /
analyzed: ugrā vighaninā mṛdhaḥ indra agnī havāmahe
translated: We invoke Indra and Agni, the terrible, the destroyers of enemies.

original: tā no mṛḷāta īdṛśe //🔽hato vṛtrāṇy āryā hato dāsāni satpatī /
analyzed: tā naḥ mṛḷātaḥ īdṛśe  hataḥ vṛtrāṇi āryā hataḥ dāsāni sat patī
translated: May they be gracious to us in this matter.🔽Slain are the Vr̥itras, O you noble ones, slain are the Dasyus, O you lords of the brave.

original: hato viśvā apa dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: hataḥ viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ
translated: Slain are all the haters.

original: indrāgnī yuvām ime 'bhi stomā anūṣata /
analyzed: indra agnī yuvām ime bhiḥ stomāḥ anūṣata
translated: O Indra and Agni, these praises of yours have been sung.

original: pibataṃ śambhuvā sutam //
analyzed: pibatam śambhuvā sutam
translated: Drink the well-being-bringing Soma that is pressed.

original: yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā /
analyzed: yāḥ vām santi puruspṛhaḥ niyutaḥ dāśuṣe narā
translated: Those teams of yours, O heroes, which are much desired by the worshipper,

original: indrāgnī tābhir ā gatam //
analyzed: indra agnī tābhiḥ ā gatam
translated: O Indra and Agni, come hither with them.

original: tābhir ā gacchataṃ naropedaṃ savanaṃ sutam /
analyzed: tābhiḥ ā gacchatam narā upa idam savanam sutam
translated: With them come hither, O heroes, to this pressed juice.

original: indrāgnī somapītaye //
analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to drink the Soma.

original: tam īḷiṣva yo arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat /
analyzed: tam īḍiṣva yaḥ arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat
translated: Impel him who with his flame surrounds all the woods.

original: kṛṣṇā kṛṇoti jihvayā //
analyzed: kṛṣṇā kṛṇoti jihvayā
translated: Krishna makes with his tongue.

original: ya iddha āvivāsati sumnam indrasya martyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ iddhe āvivāsati sumnam indrasya martyaḥ
translated: The mortal who, being kindled, seeks Indra's favor,

original: dyumnāya sutarā apaḥ //
analyzed: dyumnāya su tarāḥ apaḥ
translated: For glory, the waters more swiftly.

original: tā no vājavatīr iṣa āśūn pipṛtam arvataḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ vājavatīḥ iṣaḥ āśūn pipṛtam arvataḥ
translated: Those for us, full of strength, fill the horses with food,

original: indram agniṃ ca voḷhave //🔽ubhā vām indrāgnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai /
analyzed: indram agnim ca voḷhave  ubhā vām indra agnī āhuvadhyai ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai
translated: Indra and Agni for the race.🔽Both of you, O Indra and Agni, are to be invoked; both of you should rejoice together in the gifts.

original: ubhā dātārāv iṣāṃ rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām //
analyzed: ubhā dātārau iṣām rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām
translated: Both of you are givers of food and wealth; both of you I invoke for the winning of strength.

original: ā no gavyebhir aśvyair vasavyair upa gacchatam /🔽sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvendrāgnī tā havāmahe //
analyzed: ā naḥ gavyebhiḥ aśvyaiḥ vasavyaiḥ upa gacchatam  sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvā indra agnī tā havāmahe
translated: Come to us with your gifts of cattle, horses, and wealth.🔽O Indra and Agni, you two friends, we invoke you for friendship and well-being.

original: indrāgnī śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yajamānasya sunvataḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī śṛṇutam havam yajamānasya sunvataḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, listen to the call of the sacrificer who presses the Soma.

original: vītaṃ havyāny ā gatam pibataṃ somyam madhu //
analyzed: vītam havyāni ā gatam pibatam somyam madhu
translated: Accept the offered oblations and drink the Soma-mixed honey.

original: iyam adadād rabhasam ṛṇacyutaṃ divodāsaṃ vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: iyam adadāt rabhasam ṛṇa cyutam divodāsam vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe
translated: She gave the swift one, the debtor, Divodasa, to Vadhryashva, the worshipper.

original: yā śaśvantam ācakhādāvasam paṇiṃ tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati //
analyzed: yā śaśvantam ācakhāda avasam paṇim tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati
translated: She who always devoured the poor, the helpless debtor, O Sarasvati, those powerful gifts of yours.

original: iyaṃ śuṣmebhir bisakhā ivārujat sānu girīṇāṃ taviṣebhir ūrmibhiḥ /
analyzed: iyam śuṣmebhiḥ bisakhā iva arujat sānu girīṇām taviṣebhiḥ ūrmibhiḥ
translated: She, with her powers, breaks through like one cutting reeds, with the powerful waves of the mountains.

original: pārāvataghnīm avase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīm ā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ //
analyzed: pārāvata ghnīm avase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīm ā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ
translated: With good hymns we will invite Sarasvatī, the destroyer of the Pārāvata, to our aid, and with our thoughts will entertain her.

original: sarasvati devanido ni barhaya prajāṃ viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ /
analyzed: sarasvati deva nidaḥ ni barhaya prajām viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ
translated: O Sarasvatī, drive away the divine slayers, the offspring of the all-devouring one, the deceitful.

original: uta kṣitibhyo 'vanīr avindo viṣam ebhyo asravo vājinīvati //
analyzed: uta kṣitibhyaḥ vanīḥ avindaḥ viṣam ebhyaḥ asravaḥ vājinīvati
translated: And thou hast found the waters for the dwellers on earth; thou hast sent forth poison to them, O thou rich in treasure.

original: pra ṇo devī sarasvatī vājebhir vājinīvatī /
analyzed: pra naḥ devī sarasvatī vājebhiḥ vājinīvatī
translated: O goddess Sarasvatī, rich in treasures, do thou help us with strength in the contests.

original: dhīnām avitry avatu //
analyzed: dhīnām avitrī avatu
translated: Do thou, the inspirer of holy thoughts, protect us.

original: yas tvā devi sarasvaty upabrūte dhane hite /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā devi sarasvati upabrūte dhane hite
translated: O goddess Sarasvatī, he who invokes thee when wealth is at stake,

original: indraṃ na vṛtratūrye //
analyzed: indram na vṛtratūrye
translated: (is like) Indra in the battle with Vṛtra.

original: tvaṃ devi sarasvaty avā vājeṣu vājini /
analyzed: tvam devi sarasvati avāḥ vājeṣu vājini
translated: Thou, O goddess Sarasvatī, art to be invoked in contests, O thou rich in treasures.

original: radā pūṣeva naḥ sanim //
analyzed: rada pūṣā iva naḥ sanim
translated: Grant us gain, as (thou grantest) Pūṣan.

original: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇyavartaniḥ /
analyzed: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇya vartaniḥ
translated: And may that terrible Sarasvatī, whose path is golden,

original: vṛtraghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim //
analyzed: vṛtra ghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim
translated: the slayer of Vrtra, accept our praise.

original: yasyā ananto ahrutas tveṣaś cariṣṇur arṇavaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ anantaḥ ahrutaḥ tveṣaḥ cariṣṇuḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: Whose endless, unerring, flashing, moving flood,

original: amaś carati roruvat //🔽sā no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ svasṝr anyā ṛtāvarī /
analyzed: amaḥ carati roruvat  sā naḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ svasṝḥ anyāḥ ṛtāvarī
translated: the immortal one, moves, roaring.

original: atann aheva sūryaḥ //🔽uta naḥ priyā priyāsu saptasvasā sujuṣṭā /
analyzed: atan ahā iva sūryaḥ  uta naḥ priyā priyāsu sapta svasā su juṣṭā
translated: May she, like the sun, carry us beyond all our enemies, beyond our other sisters, O thou who art rich in truth.🔽And may Sarasvatī, the beloved one among the beloved, the well-honoured one, the seven-sistered one,

original: sarasvatī stomyā bhūt //
analyzed: sarasvatī stomyā bhūt
translated: be worthy of our praise.

original: āpapruṣī pārthivāny uru rajo antarikṣam /
analyzed: āpapruṣī pārthivāni uru rajaḥ antarikṣam
translated: She who rains down upon the wide earthly expanse, the atmosphere,

original: sarasvatī nidas pātu //
analyzed: sarasvatī nidaḥ pātu
translated: May Sarasvati protect from behind.

original: triṣadhasthā saptadhātuḥ pañca jātā vardhayantī /
analyzed: triṣadhasthā sapta dhātuḥ pañca jātā vardhayantī
translated: She who is in the three realms, of seven elements, born of five, increasing,

original: vājevāje havyā bhūt //
analyzed: vājevāje havyā bhūt
translated: May she be the offering in every contest.

original: pra yā mahimnā mahināsu cekite dyumnebhir anyā apasām apastamā /
analyzed: pra yā mahimnā mahināsu cekite dyumnebhiḥ anyāḥ apasām apastamā
translated: You who are distinguished among the great by your greatness, by your glories, most skillful of the skillful,

original: ratha iva bṛhatī vibhvane kṛtopastutyā cikituṣā sarasvatī //🔽sarasvaty abhi no neṣi vasyo māpa spharīḥ payasā mā na ā dhak /
analyzed: rathaḥ iva bṛhatī vibhvane kṛtā upastutyā cikituṣā sarasvatī  sarasvati abhi naḥ neṣi vasyaḥ mā apa spharīḥ payasā mā naḥ ā dhak
translated: Like a chariot, made for the vast one to be praised, is Sarasvati, the discerning one.🔽O Sarasvati, lead us to what is better, do not leave us in misery, do not deprive us of nourishment.🔽Accept our friendship and our offerings, and may we not go to your fields and deserts.

original: juṣasva naḥ sakhyā veśyā ca mā tvat kṣetrāṇy araṇāni ganma //🔽stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ /🔽yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ pary urū varāṃsi //🔽tā yajñam ā śucibhiś cakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṃ rurucū rajobhiḥ /
analyzed: juṣasva naḥ sakhyā veśyā ca mā tvat kṣetrāṇi araṇāni ganma  stuṣe narā divaḥ asya prasantā aśvinā huve jaramāṇaḥ arkaiḥ  yā sadyas usrā vyuṣi jmaḥ antān yuyūṣataḥ pari urū varāṃsi  tāḥ yajñam ā śucibhiḥ cakramāṇāḥ rathasya bhānum rurucuḥ rajobhiḥ
translated: I praise you, O heroes, I call upon you, O Asvins, with glowing hymns, O you who are pleased with this my song.

original: purū varāṃsy amitā mimānāpo dhanvāny ati yātho ajrān //🔽tā ha tyad vartir yad aradhram ugretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvad aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: purū varāṃsi amitā mimānā apaḥ dhanvāni ati yāthaḥ ajrān 🔽tā ha tyad vartiḥ yat aradhram ugrā itthā dhiyaḥ ūhathuḥ śaśvat aśvaiḥ
translated: You who in the morning, in the night, in the day, in the evening, in the morning, in the dawn, in the twilight, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in the day, in the morning, in the evening, in the night, in

original: manojavebhir iṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathir dāśuṣo martyasya //🔽tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī /
analyzed: manaḥ javebhiḥ iṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathiḥ dāśuṣaḥ martyasya  tā navyasaḥ jaramāṇasya manma upa bhūṣataḥ yuyujāna saptī
translated: With swift, mind-swift, flying steeds, to rest. Drive away the trouble of the mortal worshipper.🔽Those two, the new and the old, of the one who is purified, come to the one who is purifying, yoking the seven.

original: śubham pṛkṣam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantā hotā yakṣat pratno adhrug yuvānā //
analyzed: śubham pṛkṣam iṣam ūrjam vahantā hotā yakṣat pratnaḥ adruh yuvānā
translated: Bringing auspicious food, strength, the ancient priest, unerring, young, shall worship.

original: tā valgū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse /
analyzed: tā valgū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse
translated: Those two, the beautiful, the wondrous, most powerful, by the ancient and the new hymn I invite.

original: yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvatur gṛṇate citrarātī //🔽tā bhujyuṃ vibhir adbhyaḥ samudrāt tugrasya sūnum ūhathū rajobhiḥ /
analyzed: yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvatuḥ gṛṇate citra rātī  tā bhujyum vibhiḥ adbhyaḥ samudrāt tugrasya sūnum ūhathuḥ rajobhiḥ
translated: Who are most auspicious to the one who praises, to the one who sings, they have become the two with wondrous gifts.🔽Those two brought Bhujyu from the waters, from the ocean, from the sky, the son of Tugra,

original: areṇubhir yojanebhir bhujantā patatribhir arṇaso nir upasthāt //🔽vi jayuṣā rathyā yātam adriṃ śrutaṃ havaṃ vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ /
analyzed: areṇubhiḥ yojanebhiḥ bhujantā patatribhiḥ arṇasaḥ niḥ upasthāt  vi jayuṣā rathyā yātam adrim śrutam havam vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ
translated: With dustless, yoked, flying paths, enjoying, from the water's place, from the flood.🔽With the victorious chariot, go to the mountain, O mighty ones, to the call of the one with the weak husband.

original: daśasyantā śayave pipyathur gām iti cyavānā sumatim bhuraṇyū //
analyzed: daśasyantā śayave pipyathuḥ gām iti cyavānā sumatim bhuraṇyū
translated: Favoring Shaya, you two have filled the cow, the two who are moving, the two who are very wise.

original: yad rodasī pradivo asti bhūmā heḷo devānām uta martyatrā /
analyzed: yat rodasī pradivaḥ asti bhūmā heḍaḥ devānām uta martyatrā
translated: Whatever space there is in the two worlds, in the sky, in the earth, in the abode of the gods and of mortals,

original: tad ādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyuje tapur aghaṃ dadhāta //
analyzed: tat ādityāḥ vasavaḥ rudriyāsaḥ rakṣaḥ yuje tapuḥ agham dadhāta
translated: O Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, place upon the one who is joined with the Rakshas the burning sin.

original: ya īṃ rājānāv ṛtuthā vidadhad rajaso mitro varuṇaś ciketat /
analyzed: yaḥ īm rājānau ṛtuthā vidadhat rajasaḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ ciketat
translated: He who, as King, the two of you, in due season, ordains, as Mitra and Varuna, discerns.

original: gambhīrāya rakṣase hetim asya droghāya cid vacasa ānavāya //
analyzed: gambhīrāya rakṣase hetim asya droghāya cit vacase ānavāya
translated: For the deep-lying demon, for his dart, for his deceitful word, for the deceiver.

original: antaraiś cakrais tanayāya vartir dyumatā yātaṃ nṛvatā rathena /
analyzed: antaraiḥ cakraiḥ tanayāya vartiḥ dyumatā yātam nṛvatā rathena
translated: With wheels that move between, for your son's protection, come with your radiant car, with men to aid.

original: sanutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatām api śīrṣā vavṛktam //
analyzed: sa nutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatām api śīrṣā vavṛktam
translated: With the eternal, with the cast-off garment of mortality, with the desire of the worshipper, crush the head of him who hates.

original: ā paramābhir uta madhyamābhir niyudbhir yātam avamābhir arvāk /
analyzed: ā paramābhiḥ uta madhyamābhiḥ niyudbhiḥ yātam avamābhiḥ arvāk
translated: With your highest, with your midmost, with your lowest summons come hitherward.

original: dṛḷhasya cid gomato vi vrajasya duro vartaṃ gṛṇate citrarātī //🔽kva tyā valgū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo 'vidan namasvān /
analyzed: dṛḷhasya cit gomataḥ vi vrajasya duraḥ vartam gṛṇate citra rātī  kva tyā valgū puru hūtā adya dūtaḥ na stomaḥ vidat namasvān
translated: Open the door of the firm-closed stall of him who hath the cattle, for the singer, O ye of wondrous help.🔽Where are your two swift messengers, O ye much-invoked, today? The hymn hath found them not, with reverence.

original: ā yo arvāṅ nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hy asatho asya manman //
analyzed: ā yaḥ arvāk nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hi asathaḥ asya manman
translated: He who hath turned hitherward, O Nâsatyas, for he is dear to you in his devotion.

original: aram me gantaṃ havanāyāsmai gṛṇānā yathā pibātho andhaḥ /
analyzed: aram me gantam havanāya asmai gṛṇānā yathā pibāthaḥ andhaḥ
translated: Come easily to this invocation of mine, that I may sing, that ye may drink the juice.

original: pari ha tyad vartir yātho riṣo na yat paro nāntaras tuturyāt //
analyzed: pari ha tyad vartiḥ yāthaḥ riṣaḥ na yat paraḥ na antaraḥ tuturyāt
translated: Ye pass by that which is to be avoided, that ye may not be passed by, neither from without nor from within.

original: akāri vām andhaso varīmann astāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam /
analyzed: akāri vām andhasaḥ varīman astāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam
translated: I have made ready for you, O ye of the juice, a gift, I have strewn the sacrificial grass, most easy to approach.

original: uttānahasto yuvayur vavandā vāṃ nakṣanto adraya āñjan //
analyzed: uttāna hastaḥ yuvayuḥ vavanda vām nakṣantaḥ adrayaḥ āñjan
translated: With uplifted hands, young, they have worshipped you, besmearing you with oil, longing for the stones.

original: ūrdhvo vām agnir adhvareṣv asthāt pra rātir eti jūrṇinī ghṛtācī /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ vām agniḥ adhvareṣu asthāt pra rātiḥ eti jūrṇinī ghṛtācī
translated: Your Agni stands erect in the sacrifices, your gift goes forth, the well-oiled one, the worn-out one.

original: pra hotā gūrtamanā urāṇo 'yukta yo nāsatyā havīman //
analyzed: pra hotā gūrta manāḥ urāṇaḥ yukta yaḥ nāsatyā havīman
translated: The priest, of lofty mind, mounted, yoked by our invocation, O Nâsatyas.

original: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya rathaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatotim /
analyzed: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya ratham tasthau puru bhujā śata ūtim
translated: The daughter of Sûrya, for glory's sake, hath mounted the car, the car of many gifts, of a hundred aids.

original: pra māyābhir māyinā bhūtam atra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām //
analyzed: pra māyābhiḥ māyinā bhūtam atra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām
translated: By your powers, O ye wonder-workers, be ye present here, O ye Heroes, at the birth of the holy ones.

original: yuvaṃ śrībhir darśatābhir ābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭim ūhathuḥ sūryāyāḥ /🔽pra vāṃ vayo vapuṣe 'nu paptan nakṣad vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām //🔽ā vāṃ vayo 'śvāso vahiṣṭhā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahantu /
analyzed: yuvam śrībhiḥ darśatābhiḥ ābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭim ūhathuḥ sūryāyāḥ  pra vām vayaḥ vapuṣe nu paptan nakṣat vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām  ā vām vayaḥ śvāsaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ abhi prayaḥ nāsatyā vahantu
translated: With these your most splendid glories ye have brought to Sûryâ prosperity, O ye auspicious ones.🔽Your bird hath flown away for its adornment: our well-praised speech hath reached you, O ye adorable ones.🔽Let your most excellent birds, O Nâsatyas, carry you hitherward on your errand.

original: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā asarjīṣaḥ pṛkṣa iṣidho anu pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: pra vām rathaḥ manaḥ javāḥ asarji iṣaḥ pṛkṣaḥ iṣidhaḥ anu pūrvīḥ
translated: Your chariot, swift as thought, hath come, O ye Wonder-Workers, with its teams, with its food, with its early gifts.

original: puru hi vām purubhujā deṣṇaṃ dhenuṃ na iṣam pinvatam asakrām /
analyzed: puru hi vām puru bhujā deṣṇam dhenum naḥ iṣam pinvatam asakrām
translated: For you have many gifts, O ye Lords of much: make ye our food to swell like a milch-cow that never fails.

original: stutaś ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutiś ca rasāś ca ye vām anu rātim agman //
analyzed: stutaḥ ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutiḥ ca rasāḥ ca ye vām anu rātim agman
translated: And your praise, O ye lovers of sweetness, and your eulogy, and the juices that have come to you in due season.

original: uta ma ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śatam peruke ca pakvā /
analyzed: uta me ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śatam peruke ca pakvā
translated: And to me, O you of the wide house, a hundred fat sheep and ten fat cows,

original: śāṇḍo dād dhiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāso abhiṣāca ṛṣvān //
analyzed: śāṇḍaḥ dāt hiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāsaḥ abhiṣācaḥ ṛṣvān
translated: Sanda gave, of the tawny ones, those who are to be pointed out, ten tall and mighty bulls.

original: saṃ vāṃ śatā nāsatyā sahasrāśvānām purupanthā gire dāt /
analyzed: sam vām śatā nāsatyā sahasrā aśvānām purupanthāḥ gire dāt
translated: The mountain gave you, O Nāsatyas, a hundred thousand horses, O you who go by the path of men.

original: bharadvājāya vīra nū gire dād dhatā rakṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ //
analyzed: bharadvājāya vīra nu gire dāt hatā rakṣāṃsi puru daṃsasā syuḥ
translated: To Bharadvāja, O hero, he gave the mountain, he who destroys the Rākṣasas, he who has great power.

original: ā vāṃ sumne variman sūribhiḥ ṣyām //🔽ud u śriya uṣaso rocamānā asthur apāṃ normayo ruśantaḥ /
analyzed: ā vām sumne variman sūribhiḥ syām  ud u śriyaḥ uṣasaḥ rocamānāḥ asthuḥ apām na ūrmayaḥ ruśantaḥ
translated: May I be in your favor, O you who have wide space, with the nobles.🔽The shining lights of the dawn have risen, the shining waves of the waters.

original: kṛṇoti viśvā supathā sugāny abhūd u vasvī dakṣiṇā maghonī //🔽bhadrā dadṛkṣa urviyā vi bhāsy ut te śocir bhānavo dyām apaptan /🔽āvir vakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānoṣo devi rocamānā mahobhiḥ //
analyzed: kṛṇoti viśvā su pathā sugāni abhūt u vasvī dakṣiṇā maghonī  bhadrā dadṛkṣe urviyā vi bhāsi ud te śociḥ bhānavaḥ dyām apaptan  āvis vakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānā uṣaḥ devi rocamānā mahobhiḥ
translated: She makes all the good paths and easy passages, she has become the wealthy and generous Dakṣiṇā.🔽Auspicious is she to be seen with her wide light, your radiance has reached the sky, O shining one.🔽You make your breast appear, O shining dawn, O goddess, with your great lights.

original: vahanti sīm aruṇāso ruśanto gāvaḥ subhagām urviyā prathānām /
analyzed: vahanti sīm aruṇāsaḥ ruśantaḥ gāvaḥ subhagām urviyā prathānām
translated: The ruddy ones, the shining ones, carry you, the fortunate one, who spreads out with your wide space.

original: apejate śūro asteva śatrūn bādhate tamo ajiro na voḷhā //
analyzed: apejate śūraḥ astā iva śatrūn bādhate tamaḥ ajiraḥ na voḷhā
translated: The hero moves like a charioteer, he drives away the enemies, the swift one drives away the darkness as if it were a great cloud.

original: sugota te supathā parvateṣv avāte apas tarasi svabhāno /
analyzed: sugā uta te supathā parvateṣu avāte apaḥ tarasi sva bhāno
translated: You have good paths, good passages on the mountains, you cross the waters, O you of your own light.

original: sā na ā vaha pṛthuyāmann ṛṣve rayiṃ divo duhitar iṣayadhyai //🔽sā vaha yokṣabhir avātoṣo varaṃ vahasi joṣam anu /
analyzed: sā naḥ ā vaha pṛthu yāman ṛṣve rayim divaḥ duhitar iṣayadhyai  sā vaha yā ukṣabhiḥ avātā uṣaḥ varam vahasi joṣam anu
translated: O thou of wide dominion, O thou of lofty sway, O thou, O Daughter of the sky, bring us wealth to be desired.🔽Thou, O Dawn, with thy yoking, with thy driving, bearest away the best gift, according to thy will.

original: tvaṃ divo duhitar yā ha devī pūrvahūtau maṃhanā darśatā bhūḥ //
analyzed: tvam divaḥ duhitar yā ha devī pūrva hūtau maṃhanā darśatā bhūḥ
translated: Thou, O Goddess, O Daughter of the sky, who art the first to be invoked, art seen with favour.

original: ut te vayaś cid vasater apaptan naraś ca ye pitubhājo vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: ud te vayaḥ cit vasateḥ apaptan naraḥ ca ye pitu bhājaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: Thy birds have flown forth from thy dwelling, and the men who have a share in the father's inheritance at the dawn.

original: amā sate vahasi bhūri vāmam uṣo devi dāśuṣe martyāya //
analyzed: amā sate vahasi bhūri vāmam uṣaḥ devi dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: To the worshipper, O Dawn, O Goddess, thou bearest much good to the mortal man.

original: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīr ucchantī mānuṣīr ajīgaḥ /🔽yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsv ajñāyi tiras tamasaś cid aktūn //
analyzed: eṣā syā naḥ duhitā divaḥ jāḥ kṣitīḥ ucchantī mānuṣīḥ ajīgaḥ  yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsu ajñāyi tiras tamasaḥ cit aktūn
translated: This daughter of the sky hath risen to us, and hath reached the human habitations.🔽She who with her ruddy light hath been seen in the bright places, beyond even the ends of the darkness.

original: vi tad yayur aruṇayugbhir aśvaiś citram bhānty uṣasaś candrarathāḥ /🔽agraṃ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīr vi tā bādhante tama ūrmyāyāḥ //🔽śravo vājam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantīr ni dāśuṣa uṣaso martyāya /
analyzed: vi tat yayuḥ aruṇa yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ citram bhānti uṣasaḥ candra rathāḥ  agram yajñasya bṛhataḥ nayantīḥ vi tāḥ bādhante tamaḥ ūrmyāyāḥ  śravaḥ vājam iṣam ūrjam vahantīḥ ni dāśuṣe uṣasaḥ martyāya
translated: They have gone forth with their ruddy-yoked horses; the Dawns shine brightly, with their chariots of light.🔽Leading the foremost part of the great sacrifice, they drive away the darkness of the deep gloom.🔽Bringing glory, strength, food, and vigour, the Dawns bring to the worshipper, to the mortal man,

original: maghonīr vīravat patyamānā avo dhāta vidhate ratnam adya //
analyzed: maghonīḥ vīravat patyamānāḥ avaḥ dhāta vidhate ratnam adya
translated: The bountiful ones, rejoicing in a hero husband, grant to the man who hath served you a treasure this day.

original: idā hi vo vidhate ratnam astīdā vīrāya dāśuṣa uṣāsaḥ /
analyzed: idā hi vaḥ vidhate ratnam asti idā vīrāya dāśuṣe uṣāsaḥ
translated: For this is the treasure that ye have for him who serves you, for the hero who offers, O Ushas.

original: idā viprāya jarate yad ukthā ni ṣma māvate vahathā purā cit //
analyzed: idā viprāya jarate yat ukthā ni sma māvate vahathā purā cit
translated: For this the singer sings your praise, O Angiras, and brings you the oblation, even from of old.

original: idā hi ta uṣo adrisāno gotrā gavām aṅgiraso gṛṇanti /
analyzed: idā hi te uṣaḥ adri sāno gotrā gavām aṅgirasaḥ gṛṇanti
translated: For this, O Ushas, the son of the mountain, the Angirases sing the stalls of cattle.

original: vy arkeṇa bibhidur brahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇām abhavad devahūtiḥ //🔽ucchā divo duhitaḥ pratnavan no bharadvājavad vidhate maghoni /
analyzed: vi arkeṇa bibhiduḥ brahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇām abhavat deva hūtiḥ  uccha divaḥ duhitaḥ pratna vat naḥ bharadvājavat vidhate maghoni
translated: With the light and with prayer they have cleft the cloud: the invocation of the gods hath been true to men.🔽Rise up, O Daughter of the sky, as of old, O bountiful one, for the worshipper, as for Bharadvaja.

original: suvīraṃ rayiṃ gṛṇate rirīhy urugāyam adhi dhehi śravo naḥ //
analyzed: su vīram rayim gṛṇate rirīhi uru gāyam adhi dhehi śravaḥ naḥ
translated: Bestow on the singer wealth with brave sons: give us wide-spreading fame.

original: vapur nu tac cikituṣe cid astu samānaṃ nāma dhenu patyamānam /
analyzed: vapuḥ nu tat cikituṣe cit astu samānam nāma dhenu patyamānam
translated: Let that be a form to be seen even by the wise, the common name of the milch-cow that is praised.

original: marteṣv anyad dohase pīpāya sakṛc chukraṃ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ //
analyzed: marteṣu anyat dohase pīpāya sakṛt śukram duduhe pṛśniḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: One other hath flowed forth among mortals to be milked: once the dappled one hath yielded the pure milk.

original: ye agnayo na śośucann idhānā dvir yat trir maruto vāvṛdhanta /
analyzed: ye agnayaḥ na śośucan idhānāḥ dvis yat tris marutaḥ vāvṛdhanta
translated: Those fires that are not to be inflamed, O Maruts, that wax strong twice or thrice,

original: areṇavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṃ sākaṃ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiś ca bhūvan //
analyzed: areṇavaḥ hiraṇyayāsaḥ eṣām sākam nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiḥ ca bhūvan
translated: The dust of them, that is made of gold, hath become together with their manliness and their virility.

original: rudrasya ye mīḷhuṣaḥ santi putrā yāṃś co nu dādhṛvir bharadhyai /
analyzed: rudrasya ye mīḍhuṣaḥ santi putrāḥ yān ca u nu dādhṛviḥ bharadhyai
translated: Those who are Rudra's rain-giving sons, and whom Dadhikrâvan bears,

original: vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve garbham ādhāt //
analyzed: vide hi mātā mahaḥ mahī sā sā id pṛśniḥ su bhve garbham ādhāt
translated: For the great mother of many has known him, the dappled one has laid the mighty embryo.

original: na ya īṣante januṣo 'yā nv antaḥ santo 'vadyāni punānāḥ /
analyzed: na ye īṣante januṣaḥ yāḥ nu antar santaḥ vadyāni punānāḥ
translated: Not those who, born from the womb, are not inclined to sin, who purify themselves while dwelling within.

original: nir yad duhre śucayo 'nu joṣam anu śriyā tanvam ukṣamāṇāḥ //🔽makṣū na yeṣu dohase cid ayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutaṃ dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: niḥ yat duhre śucayaḥ nu joṣam anu śriyā tanvam ukṣamāṇāḥ  makṣū na yeṣu dohase cit ayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutam dadhānāḥ
translated: When they, the pure ones, are milked according to their desire, according to their glory, pouring out their bodies.🔽Not those who, even for milking, are not inclined to the name of the powerful Maruts.

original: na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānur ava yāsad ugrān //
analyzed: na ye staunāḥ ayāsaḥ mahnā nu cit sudānuḥ ava yāsat ugrān
translated: Not even the very generous one would approach the mighty ones, who are not lazy in praising with their greatness.

original: ta id ugrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke /🔽adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocir āmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ //
analyzed: te id ugrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇāḥ ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke  adha sma eṣu rodasī sva śociḥ tasthau na rokaḥ
translated: They indeed are mighty, with strength to be bold, they yoke both worlds, well-formed.🔽And now in them, in the self-shining ones, the firm one stands between the two worlds.

original: aneno vo maruto yāmo astv anaśvaś cid yam ajaty arathīḥ /
analyzed: an enaḥ vaḥ marutaḥ yāmaḥ astu an aśvaḥ cit yam ajati a rathīḥ
translated: With this one, O Maruts, let us go, whom even one without a horse, without a chariot, can overtake.

original: anavaso anabhīśū rajastūr vi rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan //
analyzed: an avasaḥ an abhīśuḥ rajastūr vi rodasī pathyāḥ yāti sādhan
translated: Without a good horse, without reins, crossing the path, he goes, accomplishing the two worlds.

original: nāsya vartā na tarutā nv asti maruto yam avatha vājasātau /
analyzed: na asya vartā na tarutā nu asti marutaḥ yam avatha vājasātau
translated: He has no turning back, no failure, O Maruts, whom you help in the winning of booty.

original: toke vā goṣu tanaye yam apsu sa vrajaṃ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ //
analyzed: toke vā goṣu tanaye yam apsu sa vrajam dartā pārye adha dyoḥ
translated: In the young ones, in the cows, in the offspring, in the waters, he, the one to be pierced, stands in the fold at the end of the day.

original: pra citram arkaṃ gṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam /🔽ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate agne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ //
analyzed: pra citram arkam gṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam  ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate agne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ
translated: Bring the wondrous hymn to the strong one who sings, to the Marut company, to him of noble nature.🔽Who with might conquer mighty ones, O Agni, the earth trembles for the sacrifices.

original: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāgneḥ /
analyzed: tviṣīmantaḥ adhvarasya iva didyut tṛṣucyavasaḥ juhvaḥ nā agneḥ
translated: Sparkling like the lightning of the sacrifice, the ladles of Trishtubh metre, like those of Agni.

original: arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: arcatrayaḥ dhunayaḥ na vīrāḥ bhrājat janmānaḥ marutaḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: The Architraves, the Dhunas, like heroes, the Maruts, of resplendent birth, invincible.

original: taṃ vṛdhantam mārutam bhrājadṛṣṭiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā vivāse /
analyzed: tam vṛdhantam mārutam bhrājat ṛṣṭim rudrasya sūnum havasā vivāse
translated: That Marut who waxes strong, whose eye is resplendent, the son of Rudra, I invite with invocation.

original: divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā girayo nāpa ugrā aspṛdhran //
analyzed: divaḥ śardhāya śucayaḥ manīṣāḥ girayaḥ na apaḥ ugrāḥ aspṛdhran
translated: The pure thoughts for the host of heaven, the terrible ones, like mountains, have contended.

original: viśveṣāṃ vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamā gīrbhir mitrāvaruṇā vāvṛdhadhyai /
analyzed: viśveṣām vaḥ satām jyeṣṭhatamāḥ gīrbhiḥ mitrāvaruṇāḥ vāvṛdhadhyai
translated: I would delight with songs, O Mitra-Varuṇa, you who are the most excellent of all existing beings.

original: saṃ yā raśmeva yamatur yamiṣṭhā dvā janāṃ asamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ //🔽iyam mad vām pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhir accha /🔽yantaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāv adhṛṣṭaṃ chardir yad vāṃ varūthyaṃ sudānū //
analyzed: sam yā raśmā iva yamatuḥ yamiṣṭhā dvā janān asamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ  iyam mat vām pra stṛṇīte manīṣā upa priyā namasā barhiḥ accha  yantam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau adhṛṣṭam chardiḥ yat vām varūthyam sudānū
translated: Who have yoked together, like a pair of reins, two unequal peoples with their own arms.🔽This my thought spreads out for you two, I approach with dear homage, with reverence, to the sacred grass.🔽Come to us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, the invincible, the protection which is yours, O bountiful ones, when you are called.

original: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā suśasty upa priyā namasā hūyamānā /
analyzed: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā su śasti upa priyā namasā hūyamānā
translated: Come, O Mitra-Varuṇa, to the fair praise, invoked with dear homage.

original: saṃ yāv apnastho apaseva janāñ chrudhīyataś cid yatatho mahitvā //
analyzed: sam yau apnasthaḥ apasā iva janām śrudhīyataḥ cit yatathaḥ mahitvā
translated: Ye who are seated in the waters, in the floods, and in the people, even more renowned for your greatness.

original: aśvā na yā vājinā pūtabandhū ṛtā yad garbham aditir bharadhyai /
analyzed: aśvā na yā vājinā pūta bandhū ṛtā yat garbham aditiḥ bharadhyai
translated: Like two well-harnessed horses, when Aditi bears the embryo for the sacrifice,

original: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāya ripave ni dīdhaḥ //
analyzed: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāya ripave ni dīdhaḥ
translated: The two terrible ones, who are born as great greatness, extend their glance to the mortal foe.

original: viśve yad vām maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatraṃ devāso adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: viśve yat vām maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatram devāsaḥ adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: When the all-gods, with their approval, the two who are praised, have established their power in unison,

original: pari yad bhūtho rodasī cid urvī santi spaśo adabdhāso amūrāḥ //
analyzed: pari yat bhūthaḥ rodasī cit urvī santi spaśaḥ adabdhāsaḥ amūrāḥ
translated: The two who have become the two extensive worlds, the two who are unerring, unerring, the two who are unerring.

original: tā hi kṣatraṃ dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānum upamād iva dyoḥ /🔽dṛḷho nakṣatra uta viśvadevo bhūmim ātān dyāṃ dhāsināyoḥ //
analyzed: tā hi kṣatram dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānum upamāt iva dyoḥ  dṛḷhaḥ nakṣatraḥ uta viśvadevaḥ bhūmim ātān dyām dhāsinā ayoḥ
translated: For they support the power of the two worlds through the days, they strengthen the ridge as it were from the sky.🔽The firm one, the star, and the all-god, the two who extend the earth and the sky with their spreading.

original: tā vigraṃ dhaithe jaṭharam pṛṇadhyā ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti /🔽na mṛṣyante yuvatayo 'vātā vi yat payo viśvajinvā bharante //
analyzed: tā vigram dhaithe jaṭharam pṛṇadhyai ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti  na mṛṣyante yuvatayaḥ vātāḥ vi yat payaḥ viśva jinvāḥ bharante
translated: The two who make the two worlds, who fill the belly, when the two who are well-prepared fill the house.🔽The two unmarried girls, who are not to be deceived, do not endure it, when the two who stimulate all carry the milk.

original: tā jihvayā sadam edaṃ sumedhā ā yad vāṃ satyo aratir ṛte bhūt /
analyzed: tā jihvayā sadam ā idam sumedhāḥ ā yat vām satyaḥ aratiḥ ṛte bhūt
translated: The two who are wise, with their tongue, always enjoy this, when your true messenger has come through the sacrifice.

original: tad vām mahitvaṃ ghṛtānnāv astu yuvaṃ dāśuṣe vi cayiṣṭam aṃhaḥ //
analyzed: tat vām mahitvam ghṛta annau astu yuvam dāśuṣe vi cayiṣṭam aṃhaḥ
translated: May that greatness of yours, O ye two who are borne on the Ghrt, be to us. Do ye two remove affliction from the worshipper.

original: pra yad vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti /
analyzed: pra yat vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti
translated: When one strives against you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, they who are dear to you, O ye two, who are to be served, destroy his hopes.

original: na ye devāsa ohasā na martā ayajñasāco apyo na putrāḥ //
analyzed: na ye devāsaḥ ohasā na martāḥ ayajñasācaḥ apyaḥ na putrāḥ
translated: Those who are not to be deceived by the gods, nor by men, nor by the Apāyas, nor by the sons, who are not to be deceived by sacrifice.

original: vi yad vācaṃ kīstāso bharante śaṃsanti ke cin nivido manānāḥ /
analyzed: vi yat vācam kīstāsaḥ bharante śaṃsanti ke cit nividaḥ manānāḥ
translated: When the priests bring forth your speech, some praise, some, being angry, censure the enemies.

original: ād vām bravāma satyāny ukthā nakir devebhir yatatho mahitvā //
analyzed: āt vām bravāma satyāni ukthā nakir devebhiḥ yatathaḥ mahitvā
translated: We will speak to you true praises. In no way do you fall short of the gods in greatness.

original: avor itthā vāṃ chardiṣo abhiṣṭau yuvor mitrāvaruṇāv askṛdhoyu /
analyzed: avoḥ itthā vām chardiṣaḥ abhiṣṭau yuvoḥ mitrāvaruṇau
translated: Here, in this place, are your two supports, your two aids, O Mitra-Varuṇa, O ye two who are not to be deceived.

original: anu yad gāva sphurān ṛjipyaṃ dhṛṣṇuṃ yad raṇe vṛṣaṇaṃ yunajan //
analyzed: anu yat gāvaḥ sphurān ṛjipyam dhṛṣṇum yat raṇe vṛṣaṇam yunajan
translated: When they yoke the strong bull in the battle, the swift one who breaks through the fences, the impetuous one.

original: śruṣṭī vāṃ yajña udyataḥ sajoṣā manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣo yajadhyai /
analyzed: śruṣṭī vām yajñaḥ udyataḥ sajoṣāḥ manuṣvat vṛkta barhiṣaḥ yajadhyai
translated: In unison, O ye two who are to be served, the sacrifice is set up for you, for whom the sacrificial grass is strewn, like Manu's,

original: ā ya indrāvaruṇāv iṣe adya mahe sumnāya maha āvavartat //
analyzed: ā yaḥ indrāvaruṇau iṣe adya mahe sumnāya mahe āvavartat
translated: To you, O Indra-Varuṇa, today, for great food, for great bliss, he has turned.

original: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṃ śaviṣṭhā tā hi bhūtam /
analyzed: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇām śaviṣṭhā tā hi bhūtam
translated: For you two are the best of the deities, the strongest of the strong, the most powerful of those who have been.

original: maghonām maṃhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarvasenā //
analyzed: maghonām maṃhiṣṭhā tuvi śuṣmaḥ ṛtena vṛtra turā sarva senā
translated: The most bountiful of the bountiful, the most impetuous, O ye two who conquer Vrtra with the Rta, with all the armies.

original: tā gṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhir indrāvaruṇā cakānā /
analyzed: tā gṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhiḥ indrāvaruṇā cakānā
translated: With praises and adorations and delights, O Indra-Varuṇa, do thou delight them.

original: vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṃ siṣakty anyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ //
analyzed: vajreṇa anyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram siṣakti anyaḥ vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ
translated: One with his thunderbolt, one with his strength, slays Vr̥itra; the other, in the battles, the sage, is active.

original: gnāś ca yan naraś ca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṃ svagūrtāḥ /
analyzed: gnāḥ ca yat naraḥ ca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāsaḥ narām sva gūrtāḥ
translated: When the Dames and the men have waxed strong, all the Gods, the self-dependent of men,

original: praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauś ca pṛthivi bhūtam urvī //
analyzed: pra ebhyaḥ indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauḥ ca pṛthivi bhūtam urvī
translated: Through your greatness, O Indra-Varuṇa, the heaven and the earth have become wide for these.

original: sa it sudānuḥ svavāṃ ṛtāvendrā yo vāṃ varuṇa dāśati tman /
analyzed: saḥ id sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvā indrā yaḥ vām varuṇa dāśati tman
translated: He, O ye bounteous, self-dependent, faithful to the truth, Indra-Varuṇa, who offers you his own self,

original: iṣā sa dviṣas tared dāsvān vaṃsad rayiṃ rayivataś ca janān //
analyzed: iṣā sa dviṣaḥ taret dāsvān vaṃsat rayim rayivataḥ ca janān
translated: May he, the liberal, with food pass over his foes, and win to himself the wealth of wealthy men.

original: yaṃ yuvaṃ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṃ dhattho vasumantam purukṣum /🔽asme sa indrāvaruṇāv api ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣām aśastīḥ //
analyzed: yam yuvam dāśu adhvarāya devā rayim dhatthaḥ vasumantam purukṣum  asme saḥ indrāvaruṇau api syāt pra yaḥ bhanakti vanuṣām aśastīḥ
translated: The wealth which ye, O Gods, bestow on him who offers you the sacrifice, rich in goods and plenteous in food,🔽May that, O Indra-Varuṇa, be ours, he who breaks the curses of the haters of devotion.

original: uta naḥ sutrātro devagopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt /
analyzed: uta naḥ su trātraḥ deva gopāḥ sūribhyaḥ indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ syāt
translated: And may wealth come to our princes, O ye who are good protectors, O ye who are guarded by the Gods, O Indra-Varuṇa,

original: yeṣāṃ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnā tirate taturiḥ //
analyzed: yeṣām śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyas dyumnā tirate taturiḥ
translated: Whose strength, irresistible in battle, the swift one surpasses in a moment, and their glory.

original: nū na indrāvaruṇā gṛṇānā pṛṅktaṃ rayiṃ sauśravasāya devā /
analyzed: nu naḥ indrāvaruṇā gṛṇānā pṛṅktam rayim sauśravasāya devā
translated: Now, O Indra-Varuṇa, when we are singing, grant us wealth for glory, O ye Gods.

original: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śardho 'po na nāvā duritā tarema //
analyzed: itthā gṛṇantaḥ mahinasya śardho paḥ na nāvā duritā tarema
translated: Thus singing the host of the mighty one, may we pass over the troubles as in a boat.

original: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyam arca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ /
analyzed: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyam arca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ
translated: To the great king, to the dear thought, to the god Varuṇa, to the far-reaching one,

original: ayaṃ ya urvī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhāty ajaro na śociṣā //
analyzed: ayam yaḥ urvī mahinā mahi vrataḥ kratvā vibhāti ajaraḥ na śociṣā
translated: He who is vast, mighty by his greatness, shines by his mind, immortal by his radiance.

original: indrāvaruṇā sutapāv imaṃ sutaṃ somam pibatam madyaṃ dhṛtavratā /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā suta pau imam sutam somam pibatam madyam dhṛtavratā
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, you who purify well, drink this pressed Soma, the intoxicating one, you who are firm in your vows.

original: yuvo ratho adhvaraṃ devavītaye prati svasaram upa yāti pītaye //
analyzed: yuvoḥ rathaḥ adhvaram deva vītaye prati svasaram upa yāti pītaye
translated: Your chariot comes to the sacrifice for the delight of the gods, to your own home, to the drinking.

original: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇāḥ madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, you who are bulls, you should enjoy this most sweet and strong Soma, O bulls.

original: idaṃ vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam asme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām //
analyzed: idam vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam asme āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayethām
translated: This Soma has been pressed for you here; sit on this sacred grass and rejoice.

original: saṃ vāṃ karmaṇā sam iṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pāre asya /
analyzed: sam vām karmaṇā sam iṣā hinomi indrāviṣṇū apasaḥ pāre asya
translated: I yoke you with work and food, O Indra and Viṣṇu, on the other side of this.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam ariṣṭair naḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā //
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam draviṇam ca dhattam ariṣṭaiḥ naḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā
translated: Accept the sacrifice and grant wealth, leading us across with your unimpaired paths.

original: yā viśvāsāṃ janitārā matīnām indrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā /
analyzed: yā viśvāsām janitārā matīnām indrāviṣṇū kalaśā soma dhānā
translated: You who are the progenitors of all thoughts, O Indra and Viṣṇu, you who have Soma-filled goblets,

original: pra vāṃ giraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso gīyamānāso arkaiḥ //
analyzed: pra vām giraḥ śasyamānāḥ avantu pra stomāsaḥ gīyamānāsaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: May your praises when being sung help you, and your hymns when being chanted with the Ṛc verses.

original: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānām ā somaṃ yātaṃ draviṇo dadhānā /
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū mada patī madānām ā somam yātam draviṇaḥ dadhānā
translated: Indra and Vishṇu, Lords of rapture, come to the Soma, bestowing wealth, bringing treasures.

original: saṃ vām añjantv aktubhir matīnāṃ saṃ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ //
analyzed: sam vām añjantu aktubhiḥ matīnām sam stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Let your thoughts unite you with the drops, let the chanted praises unite you with the hymns.

original: ā vām aśvāso abhimātiṣāha indrāviṣṇū sadhamādo vahantu /
analyzed: ā vām aśvāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ indrāviṣṇū sadhamādaḥ vahantu
translated: Let your horses, O Indra and Vishṇu, who conquer the enemy, bring you to the feast.

original: juṣethāṃ viśvā havanā matīnām upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ giro me //
analyzed: juṣethām viśvā havanā matīnām upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutam giraḥ me
translated: Accept all the offerings of our thoughts. Listen to our prayers and songs.

original: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyaṃ vāṃ somasya mada uru cakramāthe /
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyam vām somasya made uru cakramāthe
translated: O Indra and Vishṇu, that which is worthy of you, you have made the wide-spreading joy of the Soma.

original: akṛṇutam antarikṣaṃ varīyo 'prathataṃ jīvase no rajāṃsi //
analyzed: akṛṇutam antarikṣam varīyaḥ prathatam jīvase naḥ rajāṃsi
translated: You have made the atmosphere more spacious. You have extended the regions for our life.

original: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānāgrādvānā namasā rātahavyā /
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānā agrādvānā namasā rāta havyā
translated: O Indra and Vishṇu, being exalted by the offering, accepting the prayers, receiving the oblations,

original: ghṛtāsutī draviṇaṃ dhattam asme samudra sthaḥ kalaśaḥ somadhānaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛta āsutī draviṇam dhattam asme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ soma dhānaḥ
translated: Bestow wealth upon us, O you whose paths are in the ghee. O you who are in the ocean, O you who are the vessel for the Soma.

original: indrāviṣṇū pibatam madhvo asya somasya dasrā jaṭharam pṛṇethām /
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū pibatam madhvaḥ asya somasya dasrā jaṭharam pṛṇethām
translated: O Indra and Vishṇu, drink of this sweet Soma. O you two wondrous ones, fill your bellies.

original: ā vām andhāṃsi madirāṇy agmann upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ havam me //
analyzed: ā vām andhāṃsi madirāṇi agman upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutam havam me
translated: The intoxicating juices have come to you. Listen to the prayer and to my call.

original: ubhā jigyathur na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraś canainoḥ /
analyzed: ubhā jigyathuḥ na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraḥ cana enoḥ
translated: You have both conquered, you have not been conquered. No one has conquered either of you in battle.

original: indraś ca viṣṇo yad apaspṛdhethāṃ tredhā sahasraṃ vi tad airayethām //
analyzed: indraḥ ca viṣṇo yat apaspṛdhethām tredhā sahasram vi tat airayethām
translated: And Indra and Vishnu, when ye contended, ye distributed that thousand in three parts.

original: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā /
analyzed: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyā urvī pṛthvī madhu dughe supeśasā
translated: Rich in ghee, the supporter of the worlds, vast, wide, yielding honey, of fair form,

original: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūriretasā //
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūri retasā
translated: Heaven and Earth, by the law of Varuna, are firmly fixed, the two undecaying ones, of abundant seed.

original: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṃ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate /
analyzed: a saścantī bhūri dhāre payasvatī ghṛtam duhāte sukṛte śuci vrate
translated: The two inexhaustible ones, of abundant support, rich in milk, yield ghee to the well-performing one, of pure vow.

original: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃ yan manurhitam //
analyzed: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcatam yat manuḥ hitam
translated: The two worlds of this universe shine forth. Pour into us the seed that is beneficial to Manu.

original: yo vām ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati /
analyzed: yaḥ vām ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī martaḥ dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati
translated: The mortal who, for your straight course, O heaven and earth, gives to you, O two mighty ones, he prospers.

original: pra prajābhir jāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā //
analyzed: pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā
translated: He is born again and again through offspring, by the law, the various forms, of you two of the same vow, are moistened.

original: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛta śriyā ghṛta pṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Heaven and Earth are covered with ghee, with the glory of ghee, with the enjoyment of ghee, with the increase of ghee.

original: urvī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḷate sumnam iṣṭaye //
analyzed: urvī pṛthvī hotṛ vūrye purohite te id viprāḥ īḍate sumnam iṣṭaye
translated: Vast, wide, with the Hotar as their priest, with the priest in front, you two, O you two sages, are invoked for the sake of the desired bliss.

original: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatām madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate /
analyzed: madhu naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatām madhuścutā madhu dughe madhu vrate
