translated: Let Heaven and Earth mix for us the honey, the two honey-dripping ones, the two honey-yielding ones, of the same vow.

original: dadhāne yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca devatā mahi śravo vājam asme suvīryam //
analyzed: dadhāne yajñam draviṇam ca devatā mahi śravaḥ vājam asme su vīryam
translated: Bestowing sacrifice, wealth, and the gods, great fame, strength, and good heroism upon us.

original: ūrjaṃ no dyauś ca pṛthivī ca pinvatām pitā mātā viśvavidā sudaṃsasā /🔽saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśvaśambhuvā saniṃ vājaṃ rayim asme sam invatām //
analyzed: ūrjam naḥ dyauḥ ca pṛthivī ca pinvatām pitā mātā viśva vidā su daṃsasā  saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśva śambhuvā sanim vājam rayim asme sam invatām
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī swell our strength and food, the father and mother, all-knowing, of fair countenance.🔽May the two worlds, bestowing all prosperity, grant us strength, food, and wealth.

original: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāya sukratuḥ /
analyzed: ud u sya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāya su kratuḥ
translated: The god Savitar, the wise, hath lifted up his golden arms to the libation.

original: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi //
analyzed: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makhaḥ yuvā su dakṣaḥ rajasaḥ vidharmaṇi
translated: The sacrifice, the young, the well-formed, with ghee, moistens his hands in the realm of the sky.

original: devasya vayaṃ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaś ca dāvane /
analyzed: devasya vayam savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaḥ ca dāvane
translated: In the impulse of the god Savitar, may we be foremost in obtaining wealth and bestowing it,

original: yo viśvasya dvipado yaś catuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ //🔽adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṃ śivebhir adya pari pāhi no gayam /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ niveśane prasave ca asi bhūmanaḥ  adabdhebhiḥ savitar pāyubhiḥ tvam śivebhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam
translated: Who art in the dwelling and in the birth of all that hath two feet and all that hath four feet.🔽With undeceiving, O Savitar, with protecting helps, with auspicious ones, do thou today guard our dwelling.

original: hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir no aghaśaṃsa īśata //
analyzed: hiraṇya jihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣa mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata
translated: With thy golden tongue, for fresh prosperity, guard us: let not the evil-wisher get the better of us.

original: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣam asthāt /
analyzed: ud u sya devaḥ savitā damūnāḥ hiraṇya pāṇiḥ pratidoṣam asthāt
translated: The god Savitar, the kindly one, hath risen at each evening with his golden hands,

original: ayohanur yajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūri vāmam //
analyzed: ayaḥ hanuḥ yajataḥ mandra jihvaḥ ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūri vāmam
translated: The one with iron jaws, the worshipper with a sweet tongue, bestows abundant good things on the worshipper.

original: ud ū ayāṃ upavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā /🔽divo rohāṃsy aruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kac cid abhvam //🔽vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvo divedive vāmam asmabhyaṃ sāvīḥ /
analyzed: ud u ayām upavaktā iva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā su pratīkā  divaḥ rohāṃsi aruhat pṛthivyāḥ arīramat patayat kad cit abhvam  vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvas dive dive vāmam asmabhyam sāvīḥ
translated: Savitar has risen up like an attendant, with his arms of gold, of fair appearance.🔽He has mounted the heights of heaven and earth, he has moved over the wide expanse, he has flown over every fearful thing.🔽Today, O Savitar, good, tomorrow good, good on every day do thou grant to us.

original: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrer ayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma //
analyzed: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūreḥ ayā dhiyā vāma bhājaḥ syāma
translated: For, O God, by this prayer may we enjoy the possession of good things, of abundant wealth.

original: indrāsomā mahi tad vām mahitvaṃ yuvam mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ mahi tat vām mahi tvam yuvam mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, great is that greatness of yours, great deeds have ye accomplished.

original: yuvaṃ sūryaṃ vividathur yuvaṃ svar viśvā tamāṃsy ahataṃ nidaś ca //
analyzed: yuvam sūryam vividathuḥ yuvam svar viśvā tamāṃsi ahatam nidaḥ ca
translated: Ye have discovered the sun, ye have found the heaven. Ye have destroyed all darkness and the gloom.

original: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsam ut sūryaṃ nayatho jyotiṣā saha /
analyzed: indrāsomā vāsayathaḥ uṣāsam ud sūryam nayathaḥ jyotiṣā saha
translated: O Indra and Soma, ye cause the dawn to shine, ye lead the sun with light.

original: upa dyāṃ skambhathu skambhanenāprathatam pṛthivīm mātaraṃ vi //
analyzed: upa dyām skambhathu skambhanena aprathatam pṛthivīm mātaram vi
translated: Ye have supported the sky with your support, ye have extended the earth, the mother.

original: indrāsomāv ahim apaḥ pariṣṭhāṃ hatho vṛtram anu vāṃ dyaur amanyata /
analyzed: indrāsomau ahim apaḥ pariṣṭhām hathaḥ vṛtram anu vām dyauḥ amanyata
translated: O Indra and Soma, ye have slain the dragon, the foe of the waters. Varuṇa has regarded you as his friends.

original: prārṇāṃsy airayataṃ nadīnām ā samudrāṇi paprathuḥ purūṇi //
analyzed: pra arṇāṃsi airayatam nadīnām ā samudrāṇi paprathuḥ purūṇi
translated: Ye have let loose the waters of the ocean, ye have extended your power in many places.

original: indrāsomā pakvam āmāsv antar ni gavām id dadhathur vakṣaṇāsu /
analyzed: indrāsomā pakvam āmāsu antar ni gavām id dadhathuḥ vakṣaṇāsu
translated: Indra and Soma, ye have placed within the raw the ripe, within the sides of kine.

original: jagṛbhathur anapinaddham āsu ruśac citrāsu jagatīṣv antaḥ //
analyzed: jagṛbhathuḥ an apinaddham āsu ruśat citrāsu jagatīṣu antar
translated: Ye have seized it in the spotted, the swift-moving, the variegated, the unconfined, within the moving ones.

original: indrāsomā yuvam aṅga tarutram apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthe /
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ yuvam aṅga tarutram apatyasācam śrutyam rarāthe
translated: O Indra and Soma, ye have made him, the victorious, the famous, the companion of offspring.

original: yuvaṃ śuṣmaṃ naryaṃ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṃ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāham ugrā //
analyzed: yuvam śuṣmam naryam carṣaṇibhyaḥ sam vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāham ugrā
translated: Ye have distributed the manly strength to men, the mighty, the conqueror in battles.

original: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatir āṅgiraso haviṣmān /
analyzed: yaḥ adri bhid prathama jāḥ ṛtāvā bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ haviṣmān
translated: He who cleft the rock, the first-born, the righteous, Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, the oblation-bearer,

original: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti //
analyzed: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasad pitā naḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: The two-footed, the one who sits in the fore-court, the father, the bull roars to the two world-halves.

original: janāya cid ya īvata u lokam bṛhaspatir devahūtau cakāra /
analyzed: janāya cit yaḥ īvate u lokam bṛhaspatiḥ deva hūtau cakāra
translated: Even for the people, Brihaspati has made a wide world in the invocation of the gods.

original: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañ chatrūṃr amitrān pṛtsu sāhan //🔽bṛhaspatiḥ sam ajayad vasūni maho vrajān gomato deva eṣaḥ /
analyzed: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puraḥ dardarīti jayam śatrūṃr amitrān pṛtsu sāhan  bṛhaspatiḥ sam ajayat vasūni mahaḥ vrajān gomataḥ devaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Slaying the Vrtras, he cleaves the forts asunder, conquering the enemies, the foes, in battles.🔽Brihaspati has won the treasures, the great herds of cattle, the god.

original: apaḥ siṣāsan svar apratīto bṛhaspatir hanty amitram arkaiḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan svar apratītaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ hanti amitram arkaiḥ
translated: Desiring the waters, the heaven, the unconquered, Brihaspati slays the enemy with his rays.

original: somārudrā dhārayethām asuryam pra vām iṣṭayo 'ram aśnuvantu /
analyzed: somārudrā dhārayethām asuryam pra vām iṣṭayaḥ ram aśnuvantu
translated: O Soma and Rudra, uphold the divine power; let your wishes reach their goal.

original: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
analyzed: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānā śam naḥ bhūtam dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: In every place may the seven treasures be bestowed, for our welfare, for our two-footed and four-footed folk.

original: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīm amīvā yā no gayam āviveśa /
analyzed: somārudrā vi vṛhatam viṣūcīm amīvā yā naḥ gayam āviveśa
translated: O Soma and Rudra, drive away the evil disease that hath entered our house.

original: āre bādhethāṃ nirṛtim parācair asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu //
analyzed: āre bādhethām nirṛtim parācais asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu
translated: Keep Nirrti far away from us, and let there be for us good and glorious things.

original: somārudrā yuvam etāny asme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam /
analyzed: somārudrā yuvam etāni asme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam
translated: O Soma and Rudra, bestow on us all these healing remedies in our bodies.

original: ava syatam muñcataṃ yan no asti tanūṣu baddhaṃ kṛtam eno asmat //🔽tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāv iha su mṛḷataṃ naḥ /
analyzed: ava syatam muñcatam yat naḥ asti tanūṣu baddham kṛtam enaḥ asmat  tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ
translated: Loosen and release whatever is bound in our bodies, and whatever sin we have committed.🔽O Soma and Rudra, armed with sharp weapons, with sharp missiles, very gracious, be gracious to us here.

original: pra no muñcataṃ varuṇasya pāśād gopāyataṃ naḥ sumanasyamānā //
analyzed: pra naḥ muñcatam varuṇasya pāśāt gopāyatam naḥ sumanasyamānā
translated: Deliver us from the noose of Varuna, and protect us, well-disposed.

original: jīmūtasyeva bhavati pratīkaṃ yad varmī yāti samadām upasthe /
analyzed: jīmūtasya iva bhavati pratīkam yat varmī yāti samadām upasthe
translated: The appearance of the cloud is like that of the warrior when he goes to the lap of his beloved.

original: anāviddhayā tanvā jaya tvaṃ sa tvā varmaṇo mahimā pipartu //🔽dhanvanā gā dhanvanājiṃ jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samado jayema /
analyzed: an āviddhayā tanvā jaya tvam sa tvā varmaṇaḥ mahimā pipartu  dhanvanā gāḥ dhanvanā ājim jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samadaḥ jayema
translated: Be victorious with an unwounded body, and let the greatness of your armor protect you.🔽With the bow we will win cattle, with the bow we will win the race, with the bow we will win the fierce contests.

original: dhanuḥ śatror apakāmaṃ kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśo jayema //
analyzed: dhanuḥ śatroḥ apakāmam kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśaḥ jayema
translated: The bow makes the enemy's desires fail, with the bow we will win in all directions.

original: vakṣyantīved ā ganīganti karṇam priyaṃ sakhāyam pariṣasvajānā /
analyzed: vakṣyantī iva id ā ganīganti karṇam priyam sakhāyam pariṣasvajānā
translated: As if the two swift-moving (arrows) would speak to the ear, embracing their dear friend.

original: yoṣeva śiṅkte vitatādhi dhanvañ jyā iyaṃ samane pārayantī //
analyzed: yoṣā iva śiṅkte vitatā adhi dhanvam jyā iyam samane pārayantī
translated: She rattles like a woman, stretched over the bow, this bow-string, leading (the arrow) to the encounter.

original: te ācarantī samaneva yoṣā māteva putram bibhṛtām upasthe /
analyzed: te ācarantī samanā iva yoṣā mātā iva putram bibhṛtām upasthe
translated: They move around like two women in a dance, may they carry (him) in their lap like a mother her son.

original: apa śatrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantī amitrān //
analyzed: apa śatrūn vidhyatām saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantī amitrān
translated: May they, agreeing, drive away the enemies; these two quivers, bursting, (drive away) the foes.

original: bahvīnām pitā bahur asya putraś ciścā kṛṇoti samanāvagatya /
analyzed: bahvīnām pitā bahuḥ asya putraḥ kṛṇoti samanā avagatya
translated: The father of many, many are his sons; he, having come together, sharpens (his arrows).

original: iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāś ca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddho jayati prasūtaḥ //
analyzed: iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāḥ ca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddhaḥ jayati prasūtaḥ
translated: The quiver, fastened on the back, victorious, set free, contains all the battles and the skirmishes.

original: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puro yatrayatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ /
analyzed: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puras yatra yatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ
translated: Standing on the chariot, the charioteer leads the strong horses to wherever he desires.

original: abhīśūnām mahimānam panāyata manaḥ paścād anu yacchanti raśmayaḥ //
analyzed: abhīśūnām mahimānam panāyata manaḥ paścāt anu yacchanti raśmayaḥ
translated: They praise the greatness of the reins; the reins are led by the mind from behind.

original: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣapāṇayo 'śvā rathebhiḥ saha vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣa pāṇayaḥ śvā rathebhiḥ saha vājayantaḥ
translated: The bulls make a loud noise, the horses, striving for strength, together with the chariots.

original: avakrāmantaḥ prapadair amitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūṃr anapavyayantaḥ //
analyzed: avakrāmantaḥ prapadaiḥ amitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūṃr an apavyayantaḥ
translated: Stepping on the enemies with their feet, they destroy the foes, not to be deceived.

original: rathavāhanaṃ havir asya nāma yatrāyudhaṃ nihitam asya varma /
analyzed: rathavāhanam haviḥ asya nāma yatra āyudham nihitam asya varma
translated: The chariot-equipment is the name of his oblation, where his weapon and his armour are laid.

original: tatrā ratham upa śagmaṃ sadema viśvāhā vayaṃ sumanasyamānāḥ //
analyzed: tatra ratham upa śagmam sadema viśvāhā vayam sumanasyamānāḥ
translated: There, on the auspicious chariot, may we sit down all our lives, with friendly minds.

original: svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaro vayodhāḥ kṛcchreśritaḥ śaktīvanto gabhīrāḥ /
analyzed: svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaraḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ kṛcchreśritaḥ śaktīvantaḥ gabhīrāḥ
translated: The Fathers who sit in the sweet drink, who give life, who have entered the difficult path, who are powerful, profound,

original: citrasenā iṣubalā amṛdhrāḥ satovīrā uravo vrātasāhāḥ //
analyzed: citra senāḥ iṣu balāḥ amṛdhrāḥ satovīrāḥ uravaḥ vrāta sāhāḥ
translated: With variegated armies, with arrows for their weapons, invincible, with good heroes, with clans that conquer in war.

original: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive no dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā
translated: The Brahman-like Fathers, the Soma-worthy, may the two heavens and earth be auspicious to us, free from affliction.

original: pūṣā naḥ pātu duritād ṛtāvṛdho rakṣā mākir no aghaśaṃsa īśata //
analyzed: pūṣā naḥ pātu duritāt ṛtāvṛdhaḥ rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata
translated: May Pusan, increaser of truth, protect us from evil. Let not the evil-wisher have power over us.

original: suparṇaṃ vaste mṛgo asyā danto gobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā /
analyzed: suparṇam vaste mṛgaḥ asyāḥ dantaḥ gobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā
translated: She wears the bird, her tooth is the deer. Bound with cows, she flies forth, impelled.

original: yatrā naraḥ saṃ ca vi ca dravanti tatrāsmabhyam iṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan //
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ sam ca vi ca dravanti tatra asmabhyam iṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan
translated: Where men run together and scatter, there let the arrows give us protection.

original: ṛjīte pari vṛṅdhi no 'śmā bhavatu nas tanūḥ /
analyzed: ṛjīte pari vṛṅdhi naḥ śmā bhavatu naḥ tanūḥ
translated: O sharp one, turn away from us. Let our body be like a stone.

original: somo adhi bravītu no 'ditiḥ śarma yacchatu //
analyzed: somaḥ adhi bravītu naḥ ditiḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: May Soma speak to us. May Aditi grant us protection.

original: ā jaṅghanti sānv eṣāṃ jaghanāṃ upa jighnate /🔽aśvājani pracetaso 'śvān samatsu codaya //
analyzed: ā jaṅghanti sānū eṣām jaghanām upa jighnate  aśvājani pracetasaḥ śvān samatsu codaya
translated: They strike the hips of these, he strikes the buttocks.🔽O horse-womb, O wise one, urge the horses in the battles.

original: ahir iva bhogaiḥ pary eti bāhuṃ jyāyā hetim paribādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: ahiḥ iva bhogaiḥ pari eti bāhum jyāyāḥ hetim paribādhamānaḥ
translated: Like a serpent with its coils, he goes around the arm, the arrow repelled by the bowstring.

original: hastaghno viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṃsam pari pātu viśvataḥ //
analyzed: hastaghnaḥ viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṃsam pari pātu viśvatas
translated: The smiter with the hand, knowing all the ways, may the male being guard the male being on every side.

original: ālāktā yā ruruśīrṣṇy atho yasyā ayo mukham /
analyzed: ālāktā yā ruru śīrṣṇī atho yasyāḥ ayaḥ mukham
translated: The one smeared with oil on the head of the Ruru deer, and the one with an iron mouth,

original: idam parjanyaretasa iṣvai devyai bṛhan namaḥ //
analyzed: idam parjanya retase iṣvai devyai bṛhat namaḥ
translated: This great homage to the goddess who is born from the rain-water.

original: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasaṃśite /
analyzed: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahma saṃśite
translated: Released, fly away, O arrow, sharpened by Brahman.

original: gacchāmitrān pra padyasva māmīṣāṃ kaṃ canoc chiṣaḥ //
analyzed: gaccha amitrān pra padyasva mā amīṣām kam cana ud śiṣaḥ
translated: Go to the enemies, fall upon them, spare not any one of them.

original: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva /
analyzed: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārāḥ viśikhāḥ iva
translated: Where the arrows fly together like young boys with arrows,

original: tatrā no brahmaṇas patir aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu //
analyzed: tatra naḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu
translated: There may Brahmanaspati and Aditi grant us protection, may they grant us protection for all days.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somas tvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām /
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām
translated: I cover thy vital parts with armor. May Soma, the king, anoint thee with nectar.

original: uror varīyo varuṇas te kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devā madantu //
analyzed: uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu
translated: May Varuna make thy breast wider. May the gods rejoice in thee as thou art victorious.

original: yo naḥ svo araṇo yaś ca niṣṭyo jighāṃsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ araṇaḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: He who would injure us from our own people or from the neighboring people,

original: devās taṃ sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaram //
analyzed: devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram
translated: May all the gods crush him. May the Brahman be my armor within.
